loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
“I want to help people through music, this is my ministry,” says Natalie, also known as NTG in hip hop music circles. 

As a female emcee, Natalie has been exposed to the pressures and challenges that artists face in handling their production and finances in the industry. The stories of artists being cheated out of their money by record labels are disheartening and true, she says. Ntune Entertainment intends to change that. 
 
Proudly based in Philadelphia, Ntune seeks to support artists and the “Philly” music scene, which suffers from a lack of independent labels. With the help of her fiancé, Natalie has been able to collaborate with artists, radio stations and producers in a variety of projects.  
 
This loan she has applied for will go towards purchasing computers, software, speakers, printers and other office supplies. It will also allow Ntune to hire a Public Relations specialist, to help spread the word, and the music.

loans.use: to purchase computers, software, speakers, printers and additional office supplies

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé majoritairement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de légumes (concombres), charbon de bois, huiles et condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèba  (femme assise à gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des légumes (concombres). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 sacs  de concombres en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji à une clientèle mixte. Madame Djénèba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group is mainly composed of monogamous women. In average, they are 47 and have eight children. They all live in Djalakorodji, a neighborhood in Bamako, which is also where they met. The members of this group are into petty trading. They sell vegetables (cucumbers), charcoal, oils, and condiments. In order to increase their business, they have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso; this is their second solidarity loan. 
Mrs. Djénèba (the woman sitting on the left hand side of the picture) has a great reputation as a vegetable (cucumbers) vendor. She plans on using her loan to buy in bulk six bags of cucumbers in Médine. She resells them in Djalakorodji to various customers. With this loan, Mrs. Djénèba hopes to make a monthly profit of 90 000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business. Thanks to this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, she plans on buying a dwelling unit.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (cucumbers)

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé équitablement de 2 femmes monogames et 2 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques de modèles différentes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou (femme assise à droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des ustensiles plastiques de modèles différentes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 pièces d’ustensiles plastiques de modèles différentes  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Kadiatou  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma is composed of two monogamous women and two polygamous women. In average, they are 48 and have eight children. They all live in Djalakorodji, a neighborhood in Bamako, which is also where they met. The members of this group are into petty trading. They sell various types of plastic utensils. In order to increase their business, they have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso; this is their second solidarity loan. 
Mrs. Kadiatou (the woman sitting on the right hand side of the picture) has a great reputation as a plastic utensil vendor. She plans on using her loan to buy in bulk 40 units of various types of plastic utensils in Bamako. She resells them to women in Djalakorodji. With this loan, Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to make a monthly profit of 80 000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business. Thanks to this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, she plans on buying a dwelling unit.

loans.use: to buy various types of plastic utensils.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.en:
Juan grew up in Honduras with a love for cars. On a visit to the United States, Juan attended a car auction and was struck with an idea. He wanted to bring US cars to sell in his native Honduras. With this idea, Juan’s business Grupo JL Logistics, a shipping and export company, was born. 

Seeking a better life for his two children, Juan moved his family to the United States. As a result, his business changed. Grupo JL Logistics now handles the export of auto parts and cars to South America. However, Juan has found an opportunity to expand his operations. Recently, Juan won a contract to supply a large veterinarian hospital. In order to fulfill this contract, he needs to purchase pet supplies. With this loan, Juan will be able to fill this contract and continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase pet supplies

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Five minutes with Miguel, and you’ll know he’s in the right line of work. Miguel is a pioneer in educating the local Latino community about hospice care, and his passion for and experience in the hospice industry is immediately evident when you talk to him.

Miguel began as a student in Osteopathic Medicine, but decided after one year that practicing medicine was not for him. He wanted to have a greater impact on his community and felt he could achieve this by working as an administrator in the healthcare field.

After moving to San Diego about a year ago, Miguel fell in love with the hospice care industry. He also noticed a need: of those who are eligible, only 7% of Latinos use hospice, compared to about 55% nationally among all ethnic groups. 

Always one to back up his convictions with action, Miguel is now opening his own hospice business that caters specifically to Latino clients. He hopes that his new business will help dispel some of the hesitations and barriers that prevent Latino families from giving their loved ones the care they need.

His Kiva loan will go towards licensing costs, as well as for furniture and office start-up costs. 

Miguel hopes his hospice business will be the most culturally sensitive hospice in San Diego County, and that he will eventually help the Latino community to turn the corner when it comes to hospice and supplemental healthcare.

loans.use: to pay for licensing costs, furniture and office start-up costs

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 24-year-old ambitious young man living with his family in Irbid, Jordan. He is a university student majoring in programming engineering, and he is in his fourth year. 

Tamer is seeking to continue his study so that he will find a job in his field after getting his bachelor's degree, which will enable him to start depending on himself. However, he is currently facing a financial crisis which is making it difficult for him to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 23-year-old university student majoring in finance, and he is in his third year. Adham has been trying to find a job to support his family, but because he didn't find one, he has set a goal: getting his bachelor's degree to find a job in his field. 

Because of the financial problems he has been facing and lack of money, he couldn't pay his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis opened a burger shop called “The Good Old Days” in El Paso four years ago. He was building a loyal clientele and was excited about his future.  In fact, he started making plans for expansion – until the landlord raised his rent by more than $950 a month last year. So Luis shut down his business just before Labor Day. 

But, Luis didn’t give up on his entrepreneurship dream. So two months ago, Luis opened in another location and renamed his business “Rock & Roll Burgers.” There, he sells nostalgia, as well as quarter-pound burgers named after one of his favorite rock and roll figures, Elvis. He offers his patrons a basic burger that he calls “The King,” with fries and a drink for $7.25. For 50 cents more, he offers the “Aloha” burger with pineapple, the “Acapulco” burger with avocado, the “Burning Love” burger with jalapeño, the “Good Luck Charm” burger with mushrooms, or the “Hound Dog Burger,” which is an eight-ounce burger with a hot dog. 

He started getting a request for burgers with everything on top, so he added that to the menu. The “Rock & Roll” burger and fries combo sells for $8.50 and the burger includes pineapple, avocado, mushrooms, jalapeño, bacon, and a hot dog. Luis likes to brag that the first customer to order the Rock & Roll burger off his menu was a petite, young woman, who couldn’t have weighed more than 110 pounds. “She finished it all and said it was terrific,” Luis said. 

Luis’s new restaurant is located in a busy shopping center adjacent to a Mexican restaurant, an auto parts store, and other shops, which makes him hopeful that he will have steady clientele once patrons discover the juicy burgers he offers. Having invested all his savings into reopening the restaurant, Luis needed cash to buy food and other inventory. So, he turned to Accion Texas for a loan. 

After two months of operating, Luis said he is excited about his future again, and is looking forward to making plans for expansion.

loans.use: to use for working capital to buy food and other inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more boards and furniture

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica has been working in bookkeeping and payroll services for well over twenty years. She started in the industry with her previous employer, where she grew the team she helped manage from five to more than one hundred twenty employees.  

Angelica says this experience provided her with more than just the opportunity to become a bookkeeping and payroll professional, but also with office management skills and basic administrative capabilities that will facilitate her establishment of her own company. 

Angelica had been thinking about starting her own business for several years, but it wasn't until she enrolled and completed the Accion Academy, an eight-week class that walks potential business owners from concept to launch.  

Through her experience in the Academy, she gained enough confidence in herself to see it through, and filed her business tax license. Immediately upon launch, she secured two smaller clients, and is well on her way to growing a profitable business.

She will use her Kiva loan to build her website, conduct some marketing, and reestablish her credit to set herself up for future success.

loans.use: to build her website, conduct some marketing, and reestablish her credit to set herself up for future success.

loans.name: Bernardine

texts.en:
Bernardine is not your typical senior citizen. She doesn't spend her days knitting or doing crossword puzzles. Bernardine operates a kiosk at a local Air Force base, selling personal products to servicemen and servicewomen.

Widowed, Bernardine was finding it hard to make ends meet, so she set out to find a way to bring in some extra cash for household expenses. Earlier this year, Bernardine opened her kiosk, selling body oils, lotions, and linens. With her charming personality and motherly attention, she was an instant hit, and business is booming. 

She has been offered a larger space at the base, and with a loan of $3,775, Bernardine will expand her inventory and purchase a T-shirt imprinting machine to make custom imprinted T-shirts on site.

loans.use: To purchase a T-shirt imprinting machine to expand the product line at her retail kiosk.

loans.name: Loky

texts.fr:
_ - 
Agée de 21 ans  Lokye st mariée et mère de avec 3 enfants en charge  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle a commencée son petit commerce en  vendant des des friperies. Elle s'approvisionne une  fois par mois marché de Hédzranawé et revend par vente ambulante dans les quartiers environnants.  Loky sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Loky is 21, married, has three dependent children, and lives in Adidogomé. She started her business by selling second-hand clothes. She buys those clothes once a month at the market in Hédzranawé and resells them in the surrounding neighborhoods. Loky is asking for a loan to expand her business in order to meet the needs of her customers and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sheets.

loans.name: Sathio's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est l’un des plus anciens du programme et compte à ses actifs plus de 20 cycles soit plus de 10 années d’expérience. Les membres sont très solidaires entre elles, vivent en parfaite harmonie. Ces femmes sont très actives dans le secteur du petit commerce dans leur localité, elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Sathio (en médaillon à droite de la photo),  est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, mariée  et mère de 03 enfants : 02 filles et un garçon dont les âges varient de 14 à 25 ans. Elle est vendeuse de poisson frais et fumé qu’elle achète auprès des camions frigorifiques et des commerçants venus de la zone côtière. Elle a une parfaite connaissance dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de 20 ans.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter  des paniers de poissons frais  et poissons fumés 
     
Ses bénéfices, servirons en grande partie à satisfaire les besoins en nourriture pour ma famille vu que mon mari est à la retraite et le reste à renforcer mon épargne.
texts.en:
With over 10 years of experience and a history of 20 loans, this banc villageois is one of the oldest in the program. The members show a great deal of solidarity to one another and live harmoniously. These women are very active in their area. They are into petty trade, as well as rainfed agriculture.

Mrs. Sathio (see inset on the right hand side of the photo), is the group's representative. She is 53, married, and has three children: two girls and one boy, whose ages go from 14 to 25. She sells fresh and smoked fish, which she buys from refrigerated trucks and traders coming from the coast area. She has a perfect knoweldge of this field, in which she has been working for over 20 years.

With this new loan, she plans on buying baskets of fresh fish and smoked fish.

The profits will enable her to feed her family, since her husband is retired, and to consolidate her savings.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh fish and smoked fish.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer con una muy buena visión para los negocios ya que se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de antojitos típicos tales como: yuca frita y sancochada, pasteles de carne, empanadas, etc. Además para tener un ingreso extra presta sus servicios domésticos como niñera. Rosa ha observado que en su vivienda el techo esta deteriorado y en la fotografía se puede observar la zona afectada, que es bastante grande por lo que ella desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old and she lives in her own house along with her family. She is a women with a very clear perspective on business since she makes a living by selling a diversity of local goods such as: fried yucca, boiled potatoes, meat pies, empanadas, etc. As a second source of income, she is a nanny as well. 

Rosa has noticed that the roofing in her house is deteriorated and in the photograph one can observe the damaged zone. The damaged zone is very big and that is why she wishes to replace it. 

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: galvanized sheets, idlers and pins to replace the roof in her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheets, idlers and pins to replace the roof in her home.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SABALY est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de pagnes à l’image de ROKIA qui est la 1ère femme assise dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 12 mètres de basin et 12 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The SABALAY group is composed of six married women who, on average, are 38 and have five children. They live in large traditional families in HEREMAKANO NORD, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni.
They met through neighbors, friends, or their business acitivity. To strengthen their finances and increase their business, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with which this is their seventh loan. The previous six loans have been successfully paid back. These women sell traditional fabric; ROKIA, sitting in this picture, first woman from the left, is one of them. With this loan, she plans on buying 12 meters of bazin (fabric) and 12 units of traditional fabric from wholesalers in Bougouni. She resells them at the market in Bougouni as well as door-to-door to various customers, who pay cash or on credit.
She expects to make a monthly profit of 45.000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to pay off her loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Iylol Al- Asbahi Group

texts.en:
This group, Iylol Al- Asbahi, consists of four women who live in Yemen's capital city of Sana'a. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. They know each other through friendship and work together in a photo studio.

Rabab is the leader of the group. She is 27 years old, married and has two children. Her oldest child is 6 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. Rabab couldn't complete her secondary education. Now, she is an employee in a photo studio with a small salary. That salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of her family. She works inside the photo studio eight hours daily. In order to increase her income, she decided to start her own business by purchasing a camera to work as a photographer outside the studio during her off hours. There are a lot of ceremonies, parties, and many events that need photos outside the studio. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to purchase a camera and photocopier to work as a photographer. For this reason, Rabab applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase a camera and photocopier to start her own business as a photographer outside her work in the studio.

Rabab looks forward to establishing her own studio and providing it with all the photo equipment and cameras.

loans.use: to purchase a camera and photocopier to start her own business as a photographer outside her work in the studio.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de arroz desde hace 9 años, el joven es muy trabajador y responsable, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa,  el joven solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc.  y asi poder tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is blurred is 27 years old and he lives in a high risk area.  He works in agriculture, mainly cultivating rice, and has been in the business for nine years.  He is very hard working and responsible, and sells his produce to basic grain dealers.  He uses his income to cover household needs.  He owns the house he and his wife live.

He is requesting a loan to buy maures, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, etc. so he and his wife can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy manures, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her job.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
O Senhor Joao é casado e tem 5 filhos dos quais 4 andam na escola. Ele é deficiente fisíco, trabalha para um singular. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção tais como pranchas, 20 sacos de cimento, 1 pá de pedra, 6 barrotes e 9 chapas de zinco etc. para dar continuidade com a obra.
O seu maior sonho abrir um estabelecimento comercial para a sua esposa
texts.en:
João is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. He's disabled and works for an individual. With the current loan he wishes to purchase construction supplies such as planks, 20 sacks of cement, one shovel full of rocks, 6 beams and 9 zinc plates. That way he will move forward with his construction work.
His biggest dream is to open a store for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as planks, 20 sacks of cement, one shovel full of rocks, 6 beams and 9 zinc plates.

loans.name: Mónica Gertrudis

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 46 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 26, 21  y 10 años, el menor es el que aun vive con ella y  estudia en escuela. Hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Mónica para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica a realizar trabajos como cortes de cabellos, tinturados, pintado de uñas, entre otros trabajos que realiza en su casa o a domicilio si así lo quieren sus clientes, en su casa está instalando un salón de belleza con la finalidad de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días las horas que pueda a veces tiene mucho trabajo pero en días puede descansar un poco más. Lleva tres años con esta actividad la cual le encanta realizar ya que se gana lo suyo y con esto le da lo mejor a su hijo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar una silla, herramientas y tintes que necesita para su negocio. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un salón de belleza completo.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito Familiar meets every 15 days in a place called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. The majority of residents in this area have different businesses like making ivory palm buttons, artisan crafts, and general commerce. This is where Mónica lives; she is 46 years old, is separated from her husband, and has three children, ages 26, 21, and 10, from the relationship. The youngest child still lives with her and attends school.

Many years ago, she learned to be a beautician in a local school. In order to earn her own income, Mónica began to provide services like haircuts, hair dying, manicures, and other services from her home or from her customers' homes. She has installed a beauty salon in her home so that she can provide better services to her customers.

She works every day for as many hours as she can. Some days she has a lot of work, but on some days she can rest more. She has been working in this business for three years and she loves doing it since she can earn her own money and provide the best for her son.

She will use this loan to purchase a chair, tools, and hair dye for her business. She has had two loans with the credit group and she likes it because of the help and benefits that she receives from the bank. Her dream is to have a complete beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase a chair, tools, and hair dye.

loans.name: Elzabeth Jacqueline

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 13 y 5 años, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.
Doña Elizabeth es una muy buena madre y esposa que le gusta trabajar para  generar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la fabricación de botones hechos en tagua,  tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, productos que entregan en el puerto de  Manta para que estos sean enviados  al extranjero lugar en el cual les dan el acabado necesario para ser comercializados. Trabaja todos los días, y lleva en este negocio por casi seis años, actividad que les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua que es la materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos pudo instalar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Credito Familiar meets every 15 days in a locality called Colorado, minutes away from Montecristi. The inhabitants of this locality have different businesses; they manufacture tagua buttons, handcrafts and other general trades. 

Elizabeth lives in this place, she is 34 years old, married, and has three children comprising the ages of 15, 13 and 5. The two oldest children study at school and the smallest one in kindergarten. Her husband is a laborer. 

Elizabeth is a very good mother and wife, she likes to work to generate her own income and in that way she can support her husband with the family sustenance. She manufactures tagua buttons; she also has a turning machine (to cut tagua) in raw form to manufacture the buttons. She delivers the products at the Manta port so that they are shipped outside of the country. It is in these countries that the products are refined to be sold. She works every day and she has been in this business for almost six years, this has allowed her to move ahead in life. 

She will employ this loan to purchase tagua, the raw material to manufacture the buttons. She has been a part of the Grupo de Credito for three cycles and she likes it because the loans allowed her to open her business. Her dreams involve improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase tagua.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 31 years old and has a business selling polythene and packaging bags. She has been in this business for five years. She is widowed with five children. 

Ruth will be using this loan to buy more polythene bags and packaging bags to sell as this will enable her to get more income. She will use the generated profits to build a permanent house for her family.

This is Ruth's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to buy land and build residential houses.

loans.use: To buy polythene and other packaging bags.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Patrick. He is a smallholder farmer from Nandi Hills, which lies on the escarpments of The Great Rift Valley. Since inheriting his parents' four acres of land, he has been deep into mixed farming. He sells milk, eggs, tea and other crops that he produces. This economic activity is what has sustained him since 1990.

Patrick is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Chicken and chicken products make the favourite meal for the populace. Because of this, the demand, as well as the price, is always high.
 
With your loan, Patrick will be able to produce more to fulfill the demand. He has committed to himself that he will plough the profits back into the business for growth. He gets fulfillment from being able to satisfy his customers' needs.

His family will also benefit from your loan because they will enjoy an improved diet.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 21-year-old university student majoring in engineering and is in his fourth year. Ibrahim is planning to keep on improving his studies until he gets his PhD. He is now facing a financial crisis and cannot pay his upcoming semester fees and is only one step away from getting his bachelor's degree. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Hawa. She is married, and has five children, aged 17, 15, 13, 12 and 6 years. In 2000, Hawa established her charcoal and sticks business. She began her business to help her husband to take care of the family. Work seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more charcoal and sticks for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits to a better enhance her living standards, earnings and profit margins. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business. Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges. This business has helped her in raising her children.  

She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business so that she will save enough for her retirement age. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 200 bags of  charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rosebella, a 51-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Kuserwo, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is happily married and has four children who depend on her for their basic needs. For the past two years, Rosebella has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her primary sources of income are milk selling, egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Although she loves dairy farming,She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” Rosebella sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and, because of her high-quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming.

To be able to meet the demand, Rosebella is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence satisfy the demand. Rosebella will use her increased income to improve her living conditions and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from more poultry manure, which she will use in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish and hence provide a solid education to her children.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Hello lender, meet Abraham. Abraham is a 29-year-old agribusiness entrepreneur. He has been blessed with one child whom he holds dear. He comes from the North Rift region of Kenya where he has a permanent resident house. Abraham inherited 12 acres that has enabled him to do mixed-farming for the most part of his life. He makes a decent living selling milk, eggs, crops and engaging in other personal businesses. 

Abraham is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle. However, this is far from any luxury purposes. The illegal ferrying of passengers on bicycles past Kenya-Uganda borders paved way for the rise of motorcycles as means of public transportation in Kenya. Popularly referred to as 'Bodaboda' (touts shouting "Border...Border"), motorcycles are used for public and goods transportation in Kenya. In deep rural places, they have displaced the use of motor cars, taxis, vans and buses. 

To Abraham, a motorcycle will various advantages. It will save him transportation hassles and costs. Many rural farmers are exploited by brokers because they do not have a proper transportation system to sell their goods at distant markets for a higher price. Unfortunately, the brokers take advantage of this and plunge farmers into abject poverty. 

With your loan, Abraham will be  empowered  to drive a positive change.

loans.use: to purchase a farm transportation motorcycle

loans.name: Nafaret

texts.en: Nefaret bought a milk cow with your help and she is very appreciative to all of you. She is now requesting another loan to take her teen daughter, seen in the photograph next to Nefaret, to a medical specialist. The daughter was hit in the head by accident when she was very little and as she grows older, she experiences consistent headaches and dizziness that don't seem to go away.

loans.use: To take her daughter to a head specialist

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима женщина средних лет. В этом году ей исполнилось 36 лет. Она замужем, ее муж работает в пекарне и занимается производством и продажей лепешек. У Салимы единственный сын, он еще маленький. Салима со своей маленькой семьей живет в городе Турсунзаде. Она тоже зарабатывает на жизнь. Салима умеет шить и кроить. На протяжении 8 лет она предоставляет услуги по пошиву женских национальных платьев. В данный момент Салима хотела бы приобрести компьютерную швейную машинку для развития своего дела. Она просит кредит для осуществления этой покупки, так как собственного сбережения не имеет. Салима будет очень благодарна за поддержку. Она надеется на Вас.
texts.en: Salima is a middle-age woman. She turned 36 years old this year. She is married, and her husband works at a bakery, making and selling flatbread. Salima has one son, who is still small. Salima and her small family live in the town of Tursun-zoda. She also earns a living. Salima can cut and sew. She has been providing services sewing women's national dresses. At this time, Salima wants to purchase a computerized sewing machine to develop her business. She is requesting this loan to make this purchase because she does not have her own savings. Salima will be very grateful for the support. She relies on You.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine to develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to assist with his coffee crops.

loans.name: Hexiell Abigail

texts.es: Hexiell de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Hexiell está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, azúcar, sopas, refrescos, huevos, golosinas, etc. para surtir la tienda y así tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Hexiell, 31, lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  For several years she has been running a small store from her house and has many customers because of the variety of products she sells.  With her income from sales and help from her husband they are able to cover some of the household expenses.

Hexiell is requesting a loan to buy more goods such as basic grains, sugar, soups, soft drinks, eggs, sweets, etc. to stock the store and enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sugar, soups, soft drinks, eggs, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para poder surtir su negocio y seguir con sus ventas y tener junto con su familia una mjeor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 47, has been selling women's and men's clothing for several years, working out of her home.  She lives in her own house with her family.  The loan she is requesting is to buy clothing wholesale to stock her business and continue with her sales activity.  This is so she and the family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Edna. She is a smallhold farmer from Kurgun in Eldoret, Kenya. She is the mother of one daughter. Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Eldoret has a thriving market for dairy products. Edna has sustained herself through dairy farming for six years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them. 

She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. From Kiva lenders, Edna is kindly requesting KES 68,275 to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. 

With increased income from the loan, Edna plans to spend money to settle the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Edna will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 26 years old and runs a food stall in Kisumu town. She sells water, soda, soft drinks and also cakes and scones. Besides this she also has a mobile money transfer business. She is single and has three children. She has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of drinking water, soft drinks and cakes for sale. She will also increase money float in her mobile money transport business. She will use the anticipated profits to grow her business, as well as to buy household goods.

This is her first loan term from Vision Fund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy water, juice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Roberto Javier

texts.es: Roberto es un señor de 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 7 años y una hija de 3 años, comenta Roberto que su esposa lo abandono dejándolo con sus 2 hijos, su niño se encuentra estudiando en la escuela, Roberto trabaja en una finca donde cuida ganado y también siembra pequeños cultivos de papas, mientras Roberto se va a la finca a trabajar es su madre quien le da cuidando a sus hijos, él es un señor trabajador y muy amoroso con sus hijos ya que los niños no tiene mamá para que les mime, Roberto va a invertir el crédito en la compra de fungicidas para curar los pequeños cultivos que son suyos y mejorar su negocio, lo que Roberto aspira es tener una buena cosecha y de este dinero comprarse una vaca de leche y mediante el ordeño y venta de leche ayudarse con los gastos diarios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 27 year old man; he is married and has a 7 year old son and a 3 year old daughter. Roberto mentions that his wife abandoned him and his 2 children. His son is studying at school. Roberto works in a farm where he watches over livestock and he also harvests small potato crops. While Roberto works, his mother takes care of his children, he is hard working man and he is also cares for his children since they do not have a mother that will pamper them. 

Roberto is going to invest the loan to purchase fungicides for his small crops and thus improve his business. Roberto aspires to obtain a good harvest and with the money he will purchase a cow and once he milks the cow, he will sell the milk to alleviate the daily expenses of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides.

loans.name: Ulziibat

texts.en:
Ulziibat, who is 30 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a driver and salesman at a food company since 2012. His wife is a book keeper and works at a private firm. Their children are in kindergarten. 

Ulziibat is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy automobile spare parts as his car is damaged severely. After repairing his car, he can continue to sell food stuffs to local stores using his car.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts in order to repair his car

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is 27 years old. He is married, and he has a son. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his parents in the Bilasuvar region because he does not have enough funds to buy a new home; for this reason, he is working every day without rest. 

From a young age, he learned all about farm work, thanks to what his parents taught him. The main crop being farmed is corn. It's going well for him because he has lots of experience in this field, and he sells high quality products. That's why he's very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the help they've given him, he'll be able to make these purchases and get higher quality products at harvest time and be able to have a higher income.

Ruslan's greatest dream is to have his own house and to give his son a better future. He has already borrowed four loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for a fifth loan of 1,100 AZN (Azaerbaijani new manat). Please support Ruslan.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying new garden tools

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 27-year-old single mother living in Chebiemit, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Her children range in age from 2 to 14 years old. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, she owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off of, just under half an acre, and has always struggled to support her family. Her primary source of income has been crops and some small personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Margaret passionately loves dairy goat farming but one challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds to buy a goat. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy a superior breed goat. From the loan, she will get a steady source of nutritious milk that she will use for home consumption and the extra milk she will sell to the neighbors. Feeding the goat will never be a challenge for Margaret because she has planted forage on her farm and will be supplementing this by cutting plants at the river bank for fodder. This will assure her of increased milk production. A goat produces about two litres every day and with this loan, she will have a steady source of nutritious milk, and use the money she used to spend on milk for essential food and pocket money for her children who are away at school. This loan is going to impact the life of Margaret positively. Margaret is already thinking ahead and with the loan, she plans to increase her milk production and sell to the local market.  Other than milk from the goat, she will benefit from the manure, which will improve her farm fertility and result in high productivity. All that Margaret waits for is for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a superior breed of goat

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Hello! Meet Zeddy, a mother of three from the Litein area of Kenya who was tired of working in an office setup and opted to give farming a try. Taking advantage of the lessons given by Juhudi Kilimo, which is an institution that provides technical and financial support, Zeddy left formal employment to start her own farming business as her retirement plan. For the past two years she has actively been involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, tea, and a variety of crops she plants. She is a small-scale farmer but she wants to improve her living conditions through large-scale farming. Zeddy is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to purchase a cow. The cow will enable her to produce milk to sell at the local market and also to neighbors. Zeddy will also use the manure from the cow to improve the soil to plant vegetables. Her loan will let her comfortably take good care of her family and reduce her need to beg anyone for assistance. Zeddy’s projections are that, by the end of the year, she will be able to buy two cows and also increase her vegetable production and milk-selling business.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en: Tahmina is a smart and hardworking girl. She is not married. Tahmina lives with her parents. Her parents are teachers. Tahmina has applied to the Economic faculty with the aim of getting a higher education. Tahmina is a first course student. She is one of the smart and successful students. She is asking for a loan to pay for her university tuition as her parents are teachers and have a small salary. She awaits your mercy. She dreams of being a good specialist in the future.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Isabellah, 33, is a small-scale farmer based in Kisii, Kenya. She is a mother of 5 children. She has been doing soley dairy farming for 6 years now.  Her primary income source is milk.

She is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She loves this business because in comparison to other livestock farming, dairying can provide a higher income per animal, monthly pay checks and more market. Expanding her farm will enable her to produce more milk and utilize the available pasture. 

With your boost, Isabellah is going to generate enough income not only to repay the loan, but also to afford her highest monthly expenses that are farming-related.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 38 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. Lilit works as a secretary. Her husband works at the court, so they both do their best to provide good living conditions for their two sons. 

Their elder son is already student at the Yerevan State University, and he is a future lawyer like his father. He is a very clever young man, and he studies with great interest and seeks knowledge. As he says, in the future he will work in that field with honesty and with high professionalism. 

Now Lilit needs this loan since she must pay her son’s tuition fee for the first semester. With the other part of the loan amount, she will surprise her son and buy a computer for him.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee for the first semester and buy a computer for him

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
He dreamed of becoming a successful athlete. Hailing from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, it isn't surprising that his career was destined to be elsewhere.

Today, 27-year-old Edwin has no regrets. He was persuaded by his father to stay in the village and start farming because there was a drop in crop yield, and there was no one to look after their farm. For the past year, he has actively been involved in mixed farming, and his primary source of income has been crops and milk. He also engages in personal business to make ends meet. He sells crops to his neighbors and to the local market, although his work is not without challenges, he says. 

Of all the activities he is involved in, sheep farming is closest to his heart. The main challenge he faces is lack of funds to increase his flock of sheep. Sheep farming is a profitable business because wool prices have skyrocketed. Edwin is an enterprising person and wants to take full advantage. From the loan he is seeking, he has already identified the breed of sheep he wants, a merino sheep. The advantages of a merino sheep are it is easy to take care of, merino garments fetch high prices, and also, merino garments are valued for their low propensity to smell bad.

Through this loan, Edwin will sell wool and be able to improve his living standards. Improved profits will be used in buying more stock and securing the future of his children. All that Edwin waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a merino sheep

loans.name: Amparo Rocio

texts.es: A sus 33 años de edad Amparo es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 9 y 16 años  que se encuentran estudiando, ella vive en el campo y trabaja al jornal, junto a sus hijos vive en la casa de sus padres y ahí mismo tienen un cerrado pequeño donde puede criar sus chanchos,  comenta que se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que tenía 15 años por eso ya tiene mucha experiencia y es buen negocio, Amparo va a invertir el crédito en la compra de  chanchos para mejorar su negocio, Amparo aspira  seguir trabajando duro y de esta manera dar el estudio a sus hijos para que no tengan la vida que ella tiene, ya que el trabajo en el campo es muy duro.
texts.en: Amparo, at 33 years old, is a single mother with 3 children at 5,9 and 16 years old who are currently studying. She lives in the countryside and works for a daily wage. She lives in her parent’s home with her children and right there they have a small pen where she can raise her pigs. She notes that she has earned a living raising pigs since she was 15 years old hence she already has a lot of experience and it is a good business. Amparo is going to invest the loan in buying pigs to improve her business. Amparo aspires to continue working hard and in this way provide an education for her children so that they do not have the life that she has since the work in the countryside is very hard.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru:
Наталья торгует одеждой на городском рынке. Наталья воспользовалась кредитом год назад для закупки школьной одежды. Она удачно вложила средства и получили дополнительную прибыль. 

В этом году Наталья тоже хочет закупить школьную одежду на осенний сезон. В это время года большой спрос и она сможет получить хороший доход. Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10 000 гривен. Кредит поможет улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Natalia sells clothing at the city market. Natalia took advantage of a loan a year ago in order to buy schoolchildren's clothes. She invested the funds very well and received an additional profit.

This year Natalia also wants to buy schoolchildren's clothes for the autumn season. There is a large demand this time of year and she can earn a good income. Natalia is requesting a loan for 10,000 hryvnia (UAH). The loan will allow her to improve her family's prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the fall season.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa is a 22-year-old refugee. He is married and the family lives in an IDP settlement.  Isa has been raising seasonal fruits and selling them at a local bazaar for 2 years. He has a good experience in this field and his monthly income is 200 AZN.

Azerbaijan people like to eat fresh fruits and use them to prepare fresh fruit juice or different sorts of jams. They like to eat jam during tea time. Local people attend Isa ’s grocery because fruits there are always fresh and tasty.

He doesn’t earn enough money to cover his family’s demands. He applied for 1,200 AZN in order to supply new seeds of fruit trees and buy fertilizers. He wants to raise vegetables to in order to diversify assortment.

loans.use: to supply new seeds

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Майрам 47 лет. В настоящий момент она не замужем, у нее есть сын и дочка. Сын живет и работает в Российской Федерации. Майрам живет в городе Конибодом вместе с 19-летней дочкой. Ее дочь сосватана и скоро выйдет замуж. 
На протяжении трех лет Майрам ведет животноводческий бизнес. Она занимается откормом и продажей быков. Помимо этой деятельности она вместе с дочерью занимается шитьем женских платьев. Сейчас Майрам нуждается в кредите. Она на часть кредита хочет купить одного быка для развития своего дела, а другую часть суммы кредита собирается потратить на свадьбу дочери. Поэтому этот кредит ей очень важен. Майрам ответственный человек и обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своих деятельностей.
texts.en: Mayram is 47 years old. At the present time, she is not married and has a son and a daughter. Her son lives and works in the Russian Federation. Mayram lives in the town of Konibodom with her 19-year-old daughter. Her daughter is engaged and will get married soon. Mayram has been running an animal husbandry business for three years. She is involved in fattening up and selling bulls. Besides this business, she and her daughter are involved in sewing women's dresses. Now Mayram needs a loan. She wants to use part of the loan to buy a bull to develop her business, and the other part to spend on her daughter's wedding. This is why this loan is very important to her. Mayram is a responsible person and promises to repay the loan on-time with the earnings from her businesses.

loans.use: to buy a bull and pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Gloria Alicia

texts.es: Gloria de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 10 años de edad y un niño de 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer con una gran tenacidad que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, su esposo también le apoya con  la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo. La vivienda de Gloria es mixta porque está construida de ladrillo hasta la mitad y la parte de arriba es de lamina, lo que la tiene un poco insegura, pensando en terminar de construir todas las paredes de ladrillo Gloria está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gloria, who is 50 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their two children, one 10-year-old daughter and a 13-year-old son. She is a woman with great tenacity who makes a living by providing domestic services. Her husband also supports the household with his job.

Gloria's home is mixed because the front half is made of brick and the back half is laminate, which makes it a little insecure. She would like to finish building all of the walls with brick. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to finish building the walls of her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to finish building walls for her home.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas las dos ya trabajan pero le ayudan económicamente,  Doña Maria tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas desde hace varios años, ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y por la amabilidad que ella tiene para atenderlos, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, tomates, frijoles, etc.  y así continuar con su trabajo para tener junto con sus dos hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
50-year old Maria lives in her own house with her two daughters. They have jobs and help her financially. Sra. Maria has run a business from her home selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) for two years. She has many customers because of the fair prices she charges and the friendliness with which she serves them.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as cream cheese, pork rind, corn, tomatoes, beans etc. Then she will be able to continue her business, and she and her daughters will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy cream cheese, pork rind, corn, tomatoes, beans etc.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer visionaria quien se dedica al comercio de tienda la cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su hogar de habitación. Vende variedad de productos como: cereales, aceite, pan dulce, golosinas, café, leche, etc. De esta forma es como junto a su esposo se ganan la vida y llevan el sustento a su hogar. Ella desea invertir en su negocio es por ello que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda como: golosinas, arroz, leche, azúcar, sal, pan dulce, frijoles, etc. Espera poder mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and she lives in her own home with her partner and their children. She is a visionary woman who works at her store, which she has been able to establish in her home, through her many efforts. She sells a variety of products such as: grains, oil, sweet bread, candy, coffee, milk, etc. It is in this way that she makes a living with her husband and that they support the household. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI, because she would like to invest in her business. She will buy goods for the store such as: candy, rice, milk, sugar, salt, sweet bread, beans, etc. She hopes to be able to increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy candy, rice, milk, sugar, salt, sweet bread, beans, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Angelica

texts.es: Vilma de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pupusas desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela que la buscan por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de atender a los clientes, Vilma está solicitando un crédito para la compra de quesillo, tomates, chicharrón, maíz, frijoles, etc. y as continuar con su trabajo y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vilma, 58 years old, lives in her own home with her family. She has earned a living making and selling pupusas for several years. Her business is located in her home. She has many customers who seek her out for her friendliness when attending to customers. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy cheese, tomatoes, pork rind, corn, beans, etc. and in this way continue with her work and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, tomatoes, pork rinds, corn, beans, etc.

loans.name: Ena Paola

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
La señora Ena tiene 27 años y es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 4 años, la cual está  en la escuela, ellas viven en la casa de sus padres.
Doña Ena para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo sacar adelante a su hija se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño puesto en su casa donde vende frutas y verduras, trabaja todos los días y comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y el cuidado de su hija, ella también en sociedad con su papá se dedica a la cría de chanchos, tienen más de 30 chanchos ya en proceso de engorde, los mismos que luego de un tiempo venden para obtener sus ganancias que le permiten salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar chanchos y alimentos para los mismos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace ya 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The Family Community Bank meets every 15 days in a place called Colorado, which is a few minutes from Montecristi. The majority of residents in this area have different businesses, like ivory palm button production, artisan crafts, and general commerce.

Ena is 27 years old and is a single mother. She has a daughter who is 4 years old and attends school. They live in her parents' home. In order to move forward with her daughter, she works in commerce. She has a small stand in her home where she sells fruit and vegetables. She works every day and splits time between working and caring for her daughter. With her father, she raises pigs. They have more than 30 pigs, which they are in the process of fattening, and will sell them in a while to earn income that will allow them to move forward.

She will use this loan to purchase pigs and food for the pigs. She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and likes it because of the help that it provides assistance so that she can move forward. Her dream is to provide the best for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhamad is hardworking man. He was born in 1969. Muhamad is married and raises his 3 children. His oldest son is a student, and two others are schoolboys. Muhamad’ wife is a seamstress. He has been busy with his taxi business for over 15 years. He has a great experience in this field.  Muhamad has an Opel.  Also he works in an organization as a tractor driver. Muhamad’s son is a student of the first course. He must pay for his son’s tuition but his income is not enough to support it. Muhamad is asking for a loan to pay his son's tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Tursunjon

texts.ru: Турсунчон вместе со своей семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. Она родилась в 1964 году. Ее муж умер рано, и она вырастила детей сама. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Турсунчон последние годы не имеет работу и поэтому она решила организовать свой бизнес и помочь детям по домохозяйству. С такой целью она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много новой информации для себя. Она планирует организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как имеет хорошие условия для развития этого бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Tursunjon lives with her family in a remote region. She was born in 1964. Her husband died early, and she had to bring up her children on her own. Her children are of legal age. In the last few years, Tursunjon has had no work, which is why she decided to start her own business and help her children with household expenses. This is why she has taken a Reach For Success course organized by the Business Women's Association and received a certificate of completion. She has learned many new things. She plans to start a livestock business since she has all the necessary conditions for this business. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS to buy livestock. She is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy cattle for launching a new business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello world, meet David. The father of 3 is a smallholder crop farmer in Nyamira, Kenya. In Nyamira, tea is the main cash crop while banana is the main subsistence crop. For the last 30 years, David has been planting tea and banana. His primary income sources are tea and personal businesses.
David is seeking a loan to purchase rabbits. These rabbits will be reared for sale. Rabbit farming is being spearheaded in Kenya by some organizations that assure farmers market for their products at an agreed price upfront. 
This investment is a big opportunity for David who has been mainly focussed on tea farming for all these years. The rabbit farm will present him an alternative source of income thus cushioning him from risks associated with tea industry. 
David has already committed returns that he will make from rabbits. The extra income is going to help him settle family-related expenses that currently take up most of his income. David stated that his family will benefit directly from the loan investment from the Kiva lenders, since he will be in a better position to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for rabbits

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a married woman; she has 2 children, both attend school. Mangale owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mangale has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other Mangale operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a conservative lady. So she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Fatima is a married lady living in Jordan with her family, which consists of seven members. One of her sons is a university student majoring in nursing, and he is in his third year. He is planning to get his bachelor's so that he will be able to find a job to start supporting his family financially. But he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, Fatima wants to support him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jesaret

texts.en:
Jesaret is 24 years old and lives with his grandmother. His parents live and work abroad.

Jesaret is a taxi driver. The loan he has applied will be used for a livestock business. Jesaret is thinking of buying sheep to fatten and then sell, and gain earnings through this. The need that must be filled is being able to have capital to be able to work. His dreams for the future are to be able to have his own land, in order to have his belongings and become independent from his parents little by little. Also, when he is old enough and mature enough, Jesaret dreams of having his own family.

loans.use: To buy sheep to start an agriculture business.

loans.name: Cholponai

texts.ru: Чолпонай 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи она в 2012 году стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Чолпонай достигла хороших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сезон в сумме до 20,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Чолпонай имеется дойная корова с теленком, также 4,00 ГА земли, где она выращивает лук, виноград и абрикос. Урожай лука уже собрали и реализовали на местном рынке, на данный момент планируют собрать абрикос и виноград, однако, необходимы средства для покупки ящиков для сбора урожая и на найм 15 человек. Поэтому Чолпонай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на полеводство и сбор экологически чистой, вкусной продукции для продажи на местном рынке, которая пользуется большим спросом. Доходы от кредита Чолпонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого бизнеса, а также на обучение детей в лицеях.
texts.en:
Cholponai is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  Looking for a source of income for her family, she became involved in agriculture and animal husbandry in 2012.  Thanks to her hard labor and painstaking work, she has achieved some measure of success and, each season, she is now making a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  She currently owns one dairy cow with her calf, as well as four hectares of land on which she grows onions, grapes and apricots.  

Cholponai has already harvested her onions and sold them at the market.  She is now getting ready for apricot and grape harvest, but she does not have enough money to buy the necessary baskets nor to pay for labor (she needs to hire 15 workers).  For this reason, she has turned to the bank Bai-Tushum & Partners and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to grow and harvest some eco-friendly and delicious fruits which will be sold at the local market where the demand is very high.  She plans to use her earnings from this loan to further develop her small business and also to pay for her children's secondary education.

loans.use: to harvest eco-friendly apricots and grapes and hire more than 10 laborers.

loans.name: Shpetim

texts.en:
With this loan, Shpetim wants to build a grocery store in his front yard and buy inventory items for this store to resell; many people have been practicing this method of running a neighborhood store from their yard here in Albania. 

Shpetim is 42 years old and has two children; 17 and 11 years of age. He’s been doing agriculture / livestock to earn a living. Currently he has dairy cows and baby calves and he sells raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. As for the agricultural products that he produces in quantity (such as beans, corn, apple fruits and grapes), he sells them to wholesale buyers. In addition to this activity, he works for pay as a prison guardian.

The village where Shpetim resides, in the southern Albania not far from the Ohrid Lake is known for the large produce of chestnuts.

loans.use: to build a grocery store in the front yard of his family house in the village where he resides and aso stock up on inventory items the store

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en: Vesna wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which helped her to to buy various foods and other products for her shop. She has made progress in her work and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. She is again requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for building a second floor onto her house and to pay for the labor. This loan will help her to improve her family's living conditions, increase their space and allow for more comfort. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase materials for building a second floor onto her house and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Fevzi

texts.en: Fevzi is father of 3 children. He is living with his family in a small village under poor living conditions and status. In order to earn a living, Fevzi had been keeping a cow, selling the milk and milk products. He also decreased his family expenses by using the products themselves. Recently, he had an urgent situation requiring him to sell the cow for quick income and is now requesting a loan to purchase a new one. He is very confident that he will be able to earn good money through this means. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his farm. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is an 18-year-old single young lady from a village near Jenin City. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Reham is a student in a local university, where she studies business administration. She would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future to help her family with part of their expenses.

Reham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Reham will be able to complete her study and find a job faster. Reham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 28 years of age, has a tailoring business that she has been running for eight years now. She is married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with a child. She also supports two people in her family.

She will be using this loan to stock tailoring materials for use. These include textiles, thread, buttons, ribbons, and tape measures. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in the future she hopes to open more tailoring shops and also make school uniforms for supply.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials for use in her business

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida is 44 year old, married with 2 kids.   Her husband is a driver. But his salary is not enough to cover family needs.  As a result, Hamida grows vegetables and fruits in her  small plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this business for 24 years. Her sons help her in this business. She is asking for the support of KIVA lenders because she wants to grow a different crop like potatoes this season. She needs  a loan 1200 azn to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds of the highest quality, to plant and therefore diversify her income.  She wants to stop depending on bean crops to be able to support the needs of her children and make progress. This is going to be her 1st  loan. Please support Hamida .

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds

loans.name: Rispa

texts.en:
Rispa is a married woman with four children; all of who are under her care. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rispa wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For this reason, Rispa requests 15,000 KES to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for window frames, galvanized sheets, and asbestos sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and has three children; all of whom go to school. She has additional family members as well. She owns her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

Caroline has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for twenty years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She gets additional income from poultry farming. She aspires to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green banana

loans.name: Jesús Con Nosotros  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del Grupo De Crédito Jesús Con Nosotros. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellos decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito con el cual esperan mejorar sus negocios y su  calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Rosa, tiene 53 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella.
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que le toco luchar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos,  ella  se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace ya 6 años  puso un  pequeño comedor en su casa el mismo que poco a poco ha mejorado con la ayuda de los créditos , trabaja de jueves a domingos por la tardes, ella  prepara deliciosos platos y su especialidad es el arroz con menestra y carne asada  lo cual es muy apetecido por sus clientes, su hija le ayuda cuando está desocupada, así es como ella sale adelante trabajando duro para conseguir sus ingresos para vivir.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Este es su primer ciclo  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sacar adelante su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y mejorar su negocio. 
La foto pequeña es de una socia que ni pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the Jesús con Nosotros Loan Group meet twice a month in the Florón part of the town of Portoviejo. They have a variety of businesses such as general stores, services etc. The members got together and formed the group in order to improve their businesses and their standard of living.

One of the members is 53-year old Sra. Rosa. She is separated and has three adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Rosa is a hardworking woman who has had to make a great effort to help her children get ahead. She sells food. Six years ago she opened a small restaurant in her house. With the help of loans it has gradually improved.  Rosa works Thursdays through Sundays in the afternoons preparing delicious meals. Her specialities are vegetable soup with rice, and roast meat; they are much enjoyed by her customers. When her daughter is not busy, she helps Rosa. In this way she is making progress and earning money to support herself.

Rosa plans to use the loan money to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients. This is her first loan with this group and she likes it because of the loans she can get for her business. Her dreams are to stay healthy and improve her business.

(The small photo is of a member who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.)

loans.use: Buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients,

loans.name: Aysheh

texts.en:
Aysheh is a 15-year-old single young lady from a village near Nablus city. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Her mother is a teacher in a public school where she earns a low income. Aysheh is a student in a local university where she studies computer science. She would like to earn her BA degree and find a job in the future to help her family meet part of their expenses.

Aysheh is taking a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay her university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Aysheh will be able to complete her studies and find a job more quickly. 

Aysheh appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university installments for this semester

loans.name: Oswaldo Rafael

texts.es:
El negocio de Oswaldo ha crecido enormemente desde que solicito el último préstamo en KIVA, mediante MiCrédito, con el cual pudo comprar más ropa usada e incrementar sus ingresos. Él se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que creyeron en él y lo apoyaron económicamente.
