Ahora ya tiene cinco años de haber iniciado con su propia tienda de segunda mano en el mercado, negocio que le ha permitido crecer personal y profesionalmente.
Oswaldo de 40 años de edad, tiene una visión clara de dónde quiere ir, esa meta es ampliar el negocio y comprar mercadería variada. Por esta razón solicita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar más ropa de segunda mano y de mejor calidad, lo que le permitirá ofrecer un servicio de calidad e incrementar su número de clientes. Ayuda a este hombre emprendedor a mejorar su calidad de vida cumpliendo con sus sueños.
texts.en:
Oswaldo's business has grown immensely since he requested the last loan from Kiva, by means of MiCredito, with which he was able to buy more used clothing and increase his profit. He is very thankful for all the people who believed in him and who supported him financially. Now it has been five years since he started with his own second-hand store in the market, a business that has allowed him to grow personally and professionally.

Oswaldo is 40 years old, he has a clear vision of where he wants to go in life, and that goal is to expand his business and to buy various goods. This is why he is requesting a new loan to buy more second-hand and better quality clothing, which will allow him to offer quality service and increase his clientele. Help this entrepreneurial man to carry out his dreams and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her brother's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah, 28 years old and the father of six children, lives with them in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He belongs to a very humble family. Selling food, soft drinks, and children's toys has been Abdullah's primary source of income for two years in his small grocery. Before working in his own grocery, he started with small capital selling hats and different kinds of accessories door to door. Over time, he accumulated a good amount of money and opened his small grocery. His effort and determination have enabled him to meet his customers' needs. 

Abdullah has plans for the future. He is applying for a loan of 98,000 YER from AMB to purchase different kinds of food and soft drinks for his grocery store in order to be able to meet all the demands of his customers. In this way, he will improve his business more.

Abdullah looks forward to opening a supermarket that will help him very much in improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of food and soft drinks for his grocery store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo vive en la ciudad de Luque en casa de sus padres, es el mayor de  dos hermanos, actualmente tiene como meta terminar su carrera universitaria superarse, ser útil a la sociedad como profesional, obtener buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia  y lograr  tener una vida digna.
Él está estudiando la carrera de comunicación, ya que quiere ser un buen comunicador y por medio de su carrera poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in the town of Luque in his parents'  house. He is the elder of two siblings. His current goals are to graduate from university, get a professional job helping people, earn a good income, help his family, and lead a good life.

He is studying Communication because he wants to be a good communicator and through his work be able to help his beloved family.

Ricardo is seeking a loan to pay his university fees so that he can continue his studies.

loans.use: Pay university fees

loans.name: Oscar Jefferson

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive el señor Oscar, tiene 21 años de edad, está soltero y aun  vive en la casa de los padres. 
Don Oscar es un joven  muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante y forjarse un buen porvenir cuando le toque formar su familia, el en sociedad con su papá tiene una fábrica de botones hechos en tagua,  todas las semanas recogen la producción que tienen y la llevan a entregar en el puerto de  Manta para que estos sean enviados  al extranjero lugar en el cual les dan el acabado necesario para ser comercializados. Trabajan  todos los días junto a su familia en esta fábrica y lleva en este negocio por casi cinco años, esta actividad les permite salir adelante e ir comprando sus cosas para su futura vida familiar.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua que es la materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así comprar bastante materia prima a mejor precio. Sus sueños son tener una fábrica más grande en un futuro.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Credito Familiar [Family Credit Group] meets every 15 days in a city named Colorado, a few minues away from Montecristi. Many of the inhabitants in this place have different businesses like fabricating ivory palm buttons, artisan crafts and general commerce.

In this place lives Oscar: 21 years old, single and still living in his parent’s home.

Oscar is a hard working young man who likes getting ahead through his efforts and forging a good future for when it is his turn to start a family. He, in partnership with his father, has an ivory palm button factory. Each week they pick up the product they have and deliver it to the Manta port to be shipped outside of the country. Is it in these countries that the products are refined to be sold. They work with their family every day in this factory and have been in this business for almost five years. This work allows him to move forward and start buying things for his future family life.

He will use this loan to buy ivory palm which is the raw material for manufacturing the buttons. He has been with the credit group for 6 cycles and likes it because he can buy a lot of raw material at a better price. His dream is to have a bigger factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy ivory palm.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, en su quinto año, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Hilda quiere, por medio de sus estudios, ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos, ya que quiere sentirse útil y salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en: Hilda is from the city of Encarnación, and is in her fifth year of university study in the field of accounting.  She is a very hard-working, fighting person. Through her education, Hilda wants to help her family and loved ones, since she wants to feel useful and to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan to invest in paying her university fees, since thus she can keep fighting to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат молодая и умная девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она родилась и выросла в столице Таджикистана. Назоката воспитали ее мать, отец, бабушка и дедушка. Она хорошо воспитанная девушка. Назокат в средней школе училась отлично и после окончания средней школы она поступила в университет. Назокат учится в факультете Экономика и Финансы. Она данное время является студентом 1 курса и учится в очное отделение. В свободное время она увлекается спортом. Назокат должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nazokat is a bright young girl. She is 18 years old and was born and raised in Tajikistan's capital. She was raised by her mother, father, grandmother, and grandfather and is a well-brought up girl. She was a good student in high school and went to university after graduating. Nazokat studies in the Economics and Finance department. She is currently a first-year student and takes classes on campus. Nazokat needs to pay for her tuition but does not have the money, so she is applying for a loan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Nasimiyu

texts.en:
Nasimiyu is a widowed woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Nasimiyu operates a grocery stall selling vegetables; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operations. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000, she wants to buy tomatoes, vegetables, onions and fruits to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, vegetables, onions and fruits to sell

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar is a conservative lady, so she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Kawthar lives in Baqaa, Jordan with her family that consists of five members. One of her sons is a university student majoring in Business Administration, and he is in his fourth year. He is pursuing his Bachelor's degree and wants to be able to study for his Master's as well. But because he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, Kawthar decided to support him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Dau

texts.en:
Dau has owned a retail shop business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her customers, and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with five children. They live in a 5-room house in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. Mary had faced some problems in life that had hindered her a lot; from the death of her father, the time period when she has no jobs, and when she was attacked by arm robbers.

Mary has applied for a new loan to be used to buy shoes, school bags, and travel boxes that will be in high demand during the period of school reopening. The business will succeed because she sells close to schools and these items are always needed by schoolchildren. No other person is selling the same items nearby. The community will benefit from this activity as people will have access to quality goods sold to them at a cheaper rate.

Mary will use the profit from this loan to increase the size of the business, her family's living standard, and to build wealth. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because they loan money with very low interest rates, they provide training on how to manage your capital in business for future success, and the borrowers pay back the loan gradually in small amount. The borrowers also benefit from the ideas shared during their weekly and monthly meetings.

loans.use: to buy shoes, socks, school bags, and travel boxes to sell

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está estudiando actualmente la carrera de ingeniería Civil, trabaja en forma conjunta con su padre en construcción.
Es soltero, su principal objetivo y sueño es terminar su carrera y trabajar en forma independiente, y por medio de su carrera poder abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir luchando por sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Herminio is from the city of Encarnación and is currently studying in the field of Civil Engineering.  He works together with his father in construction.

He is single, and his main objective and dream is to complete his degree and work independently, and through his degree be able to make his own way. Herminio is asking for this loan to invest in paying his school fees, since that will make it possible for him to continue to fight for his goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, at 61 years old, still needs to work hard. With her husband, Loreta lives with the family of her daughter whose husband works as a driver to support their 5 children and the whole extended family. 

To help, Loreta has opened a small store with capital coming from her husband's income as a vendor. Early 2014, Loreta was invited by a friend who is also availing a loan from SEED to join. She applied for a loan which she diligently finished in just 3 months. With the loan, Loreta was able to increase her stocks to include buying of rice, canned goods and bottled water which are demanded by customers from her store. With increased income from the store, Loreta was also able to invest in selling fried chicken. 

On her second loan now, Loreta plans to build shelves as display storage for the rice she is selling. Also, she plans to repair the ceiling of her store which has been damaged owing to leaks during the recent typhoon in July. With these improvements, Loreta sees that the stocks in her store will be secured and in good condition and thereby increasing her sales.

In the future, Loreta plans to go full time rice vending on top of her store. She maintains that she hopes to be productive at her age and return the support extended to her and her husband by her daughter's family.

loans.use: To build shelves as display storage for rice and to repair the ceiling of her store.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and has three children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, Chize has operated an open air food stall business. Her potential customers are the market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market. With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn, 35 years old, is a single parent solely rearing her 3 children who are aged 12, 9 and 7. 

When Angelyn and her husband separated, she decided to venture out into business. With a starting capital of only PhP 300, Angelyn invested in repacking condiments such as pepper and garlic. From her earnings, Angelyn slowly began to set up a store within the premises of her house. The business went well enabling her to sustain her family's needs and specially education expenses of her children.

However, in the last quarter of 2013, Angelyn business went almost bankrupt as she faced emergencies owing to the sickness of one of her child. To recover, Angelyn used up the cash gifts her children received for Christmas and invested those to re-establish her store. Around the same period, a neighbor who is also a partner of SEED, invited Angelyn to join.

Passing the process, Angelyn availed a first loan with SEED and was able to add more stocks in her store which boosted her income as well. Conscious that her earnings from the store would not fully cover life-risks and emergencies such as sickness, Angelyn made it a point to save her extra earnings while fulfilling her repayment duties to SEED. She also ensures that the loan she acquires is properly invested on high-selling items in her store. With her current loan, Angelyn would buy additional stocks of canned goods, milk, sugar and biscuits which are most demanded by customers in her community.

In the future, Angelyn wants to invest in selling ready-to-wear clothes in time for the Holiday season as well as in in selling school supplies. She is determined to increase her income and ensure meeting her family's day-to-day needs while at the same time ensuring preparedness in times of emergencies.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of canned goods, milk, sugar and biscuits which are highly demanded in the community.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина кредитуется в ИМОН и КИВА повторно. Она добрая и ответственная женщина. Зарина замужем и имеет 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Ее муж занимается купле продажей ткани. Она работает более 4 лет в государственном учреждении. Она работает качественно и ее коллеги очень уважают ее. Зарина и ее муж заботятся об образовании детей и хотят, чтобы они получили хорошее образование. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США для оплаты учебы детей в лицее, так как они учатся в частном лицее. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zarina is taking out another loan with IMON International and Kiva. She is a kind and responsible woman who is married and has three young children. Her husband buys and sells fabric and she has worked in the public service for more than four years. She is a good worker and her colleagues respect her. Zarina and her husband are concerned with their children's schooling and want them to get a good education. She is applying for a loan of $1050 USD to pay for her children's education costs as they are enrolled in private school. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of  four members, who will begin their sixth term with ID-Ghana. The members run a wide variety of businesses that deal in fresh fish, groceries, soft drinks and maize.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesses in Sarah's group. She joined ID-Ghana six years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling fresh fish. She started the business on her own ten years ago upon seeing how well this type of business was doing in the market.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by purchasing fresh fish from the fishermen and supplying the fish to her customers. This work generates enough income to support her family, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes best about ID-Ghana, she said she likes the health services and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish from the fishermen

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a conservative lady, so she asked her son to take her place in this picture.

Amneh is married and living in Jordan with her family that consists of six family members. Her husband works as a teacher. One of her sons, who appeared in this photo, is a university student majoring in Mechanical Engineering and in his last year of study. He also works in the evenings at a coffee shop. He plans to find a job with better income after getting his Bachelors' degree, so that he will start supporting his family financially. Currently, he doesn't have enough money to fully pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, Amneh decided to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been selling shoes in Kisumu town for 10 years now. She is 53 years old, widowed, and mother to 4 children aged between 9 and 21 years old.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of shoes to sell in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her children. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in future she hopes to grow her business and be able to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es: Yulissa: Es una joven amable y luchadora, es coordinadora del grupo solidario SEMILLA. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingreso y mejor la calidad de vida de su familia, desde hace 3 años se dedica al acopio y venta de langosta. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mariscos y venderlos a precios accesibles en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
Yulissa is a kind, tenacious young lady. She is the coordinator of the communal group Semilla. She has been working for three years bulk buying and selling lobsters, with the objective of generating her own income and improving her family's quality of life. 

She is requesting her first loan to buy shellfish to sell at affordable prices in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. 

Her dream is to build her own home and set up a small general store.

loans.use: to buy shellfish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and pay labour

loans.name: Wonderful Group

texts.en:
Patience, 40, lives in Crowborough, Harare. She is a member of the Wonderful group. A member of the group encouraged other members to come together and discuss issues that may remedy financial problems in their businesses. As part of the solution, the group started doing a ROSCA among themselves and this has since helped them in maintaining high working capital in businesses. They also approached Thrive for business support and development and the group has benefited in that they are now able to interpret business cycles in their operations.
Patience started buying and selling 10 years ago. By then, she used to sell cream cakes and she could travel a long distance selling them until they are finished. The challenge was she could not have time with her family as she had to return home late and prepare for the next business day before sleeping. With a little help from her husband, Patience restocked groceries and started selling at a busy place near her home. Sales have been good and she can now afford time with the family. With a Kiva loan, Patience is confident that she can improve her quality and quantity of stock to keep up with the increasing competition in her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Suliaman

texts.en: Suliaman has a business center located in Sinkor, Monrovia, selling electronic goods. He's been in business for a two years and hopes increased profits made by adding Sustainable Energy for All  (SE4All) products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting to his inventory will help his business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Group

texts.en:
The “Yehowa Dzi” group is made up of three enterprising women, dedicated to working for their family’s well being. They are into clothing, waakye (rice and beans) and plates. 

Evelyn is the group representative who is 35 years. She is years old and the mother of three children, who have been her inspiration for her success. She sells clothing and started this business 12 years ago with the help of a loan she got from her mother. Since then she has maintained her business. She is asking for a loan to buy a bale of clothing  to sell to customers. One of her goals is to maintain her business. 

Gifty is another one of the members. She is 42 years old, and has been selling waakye (rice and beans). Victoria is 33 years old and sells plates.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Junior

texts.en: Junior has a small electronic store in Monrovia. He is very excited to add Sustainable Energy for All SE4ALL products to his inventory. This family man hopes that adding charcoal stoves and solar home systems to his inventory will help his business grow.  Profits will be use to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To contruct chicken shelter and buy chicken feeds

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulawayo in Zimbabwe. Mercy is 41 years old and married with four children, three of whom are attending school. She has, for the last two years, run a bottle store and restaurant with the assistance of five (5) employees. Her main challenge has been limited working capital, which has seen her unable to meet customer demands. She also runs a furniture manufacturing business.

Mercy has requested $1,500.00 to buy beverages and foodstuffs for resale. She says the income generated as a result of this loan will help pay for day-to-day household expenses. In the near future, Mercy plans on running a sports bar in town.

loans.use: to buy beverages and foodstuffs

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulawayo. This is Antony. Antony is 32 years old and married with two children; one of them is attending school. He runs a retail shop selling clothing and footwear. The business has been operational for twelve years now. Antony has only one employee to assist him. He also operates a taxi. His main challenge has been stiff competition in terms of pricing from his peers.

Antony has requested a $750.00 loan to buy clothing and footwear for resale. He says the income realized as a result of this loan will improve the general welfare of his family. In the near future, Antony would like to run a clothing boutique in town.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Nury

texts.ru: Нури вместе со своей большой семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. В ее семье 9 человек. Для того, чтобы обеспечить детей Нури и ее муж трудятся упорно. Нури уже 5 лет как занимается купле продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на местном рынке. Нури очень любит маленьких детей и очень хочет, чтобы они одевались красиво и качественно. Она предоставляет своим покупателем высококачественные одежды. Нури должна обновить ассортимент товара для нового осеннего сезона. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 9900 сомони для покупки детской одежды для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nury and her extended family live in a rural area. There are nine people in her family. She and her husband work hard to provide for their children. Nury has been selling children's clothing at the market for five years. She loves kids and wants them to look nice and proper. She offers her customers high-quality clothing. Nury needs to buy a new assortment of clothes for the fall season. She is asking for a loan of 9,900 somoni to buy children's clothing for the new season. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes for the new season

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 56-year-old retired married lady, living with her family in Salt, Jordan. One of her sons is a university student majoring in media design, and he is in his third year. He would like to start studying for his Master's after getting his Bachelor's degree. But Sanaa currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees. Therefore, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has a food stall in Kisumu town and has been running it for 6 years now. She is 38 years old and married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 4 children. She also supports 8 family members.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of food items for use in her business. These include cooking oil, maize flour, salt, and wheat flour. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in future she hopes to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food items for use in her business

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is a mother of two children. She runs a silver jewelry store and also sells Tupperware. 
Her first job was selling pastries together with her son which they did for ten years. But when he had to do his military service, she was unable to manage the business alone and for a time she did not work. She did not like to sit at home and got bored, so her cousin gave her the idea of opening a silver jewelry store which she has been happily doing for six months now and has made good gains. 

With this credit, she would like to increase her supplies for both her silver jewelry shop as well as her Tupperware business. She would like to grow both of her financial endeavors so she can support her daughter’s dream of becoming a lawyer.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Perihan Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Gümüşcü dükkanı işletiyor ve aynı zamanda tuppwer satışı yapıyor.  Perihan Hanım iş hayatına börekçinin bayiliğini alarak başlıyor.  Oğlu ile birlikte on yıl bu işi yapıyor.  Oğlu askere gidince tek başına zorlandığından dükkanını devretmek zorunda kalıyor.  Bir süre çalışmıyor.  Evde oturmak kendisini sıktığından tekrar bir iş yapmak istiyor.  Kuzeninin fikir vermesi  ve teşvikiyle gümüşçü dükkanını devralıyor.  Altı aydır bu işi yapıyor ve hayatından çok memnun.  Kazancının da iyi olduğunu belirtiyor.  Tuppwer ürünlerini kullanıp memnun kaldığından çevresine bu ürünleri tanıtıp satmaya da yeni başlamış.  Aldığı kredinin büyük bir bölümü ile gümüş takılar,geri kalan miktar ilede tuppwer ürünleri alacak.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini arttırmayı düşünüyor.
Gelecek de işini daha da büyütmek ve kızının avukat olmasını istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with six children; all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

Betty sells fresh fish and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy fresh fish. She also generates additional income from selling sweet bananas. She sells on retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include the perishability of fish. 

Betty aspires to own a fully stocked fresh fish stall. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of the good customer care.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her cousin's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Zam Zam Group

texts.en:
This is a group of both men and women. Two of the women are housewives while one owns a small business and is also a community mobilizerin Kariobangi North, a Slum in Nairobi.  They all use kerosene for lighting. With kerosene lamps, they do not have sufficient light for their children to study and also there is a lot of Indoor Air Pollution (IAP)from the kerosene fumes which leads to respiratory diseases. The group leader has 2 children who are above 18 years and are both in college.
Currently on average each member spends USD 1.02 on kerosene every day for lighting. The loan will enable them purchase solar lamps- SUN KING PRO 2 that will cut their costs of kerosene. The solar is user friendly to both adults and children and they will now be able to channel their finances they used on kerosene to other activities. They will also significantly reduce the chances of house fire that emanate from un-watched kerosene lamps

loans.use: The borrower will use this loan to purchase solar lamps

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
This is a group of business women in Nairobi within Huruma slum. They are both 52 yrs and the group leaders children have all finished school. The operate small businesses and they both use charcoal for cooking. With traditional cook stoves, there is a lot of Indoor Air Pollution (IAP)which leads to respiratory diseases and also there is a lot of charcoal consumption by the traditional stoves.

Currently on average each member spends USD1.3 on charcoal everyday. The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stoves- JIKOKOA that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal.  This translates to USD234 every year for at least 5 years (lifetime of the cook stove).  This money will be saved and used for other needs like paying for their children's school fees, paying rent and making their lives better.

loans.use: The borrowers will use this loan to purchase an improved high efficiency cook stove

loans.name: Neci Education Centre Group

texts.en:
This is a group of primary school teachers in a school in Nairobi within mathare slum. The group leader who is the headteacher has 2 children who are both in school. They are in their late 30's and they all use charcoal for cooking. With traditional cook stoves, there is a lot of Indoor Air Pollution (IAP)which leads to respiratory diseases and also there is a lot of charcoal consumption by the traditional stoves.

Currently on average each member spends USD1.3 on charcoal everyday. The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stoves- JIKOKOA that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal.  This translates to USD234 every year for at least 5 years (lifetime of the cook stove).  This money will be saved and used for other needs like paying for their children's school fees, paying rent and making their lives better.

loans.use: The borrower will use this loan to purchase an improved high efficient cook stove

loans.name: Simuzar

texts.en:
Simuzar is 44 years old and married with three children. Her elder son just entered the Technical University and on September 15th will start his first course. Simuzar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. She now lives in the Fuzuli region, Bala Bahmanli village.

Last year, Simuzar took a loan to increase her business and she had successfully repaid it. Today, Simuzar requests help to buy more products to sell. She has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN. She is thankful to Komak and Kiva organization and its lenders for the repeated supports.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz vive en la ciudad de Caaguazú, vive con su papa y su hermana, estudia la carrera de comunicación bilingüe (ingles-castellano).
La meta de Luz es poder ejercer su profesión, y poder seguir capacitándose a través de postgrados, maestrías y algún doctorado, es una persona que quiere seguir creciendo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar la cuota de su carrera y también su matrícula, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Luz lives in Caaguazú, Paraguay. She lives with her father and her sister. She is studying bilingual communication (English-Spanish). Luz's goal is to be able to have a career and to be able to continue studying beyond an undergraduate degree and to do work as a postgrad, Master and Doctoral student. She is a person who wants to grow. She is asking for this loan so she can pay for university tuition and fees. The loan will be a big help to her.

loans.use: pay university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili  is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for sale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Susan, a very hard-working mother who is 40 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Mosoriot, a remote village in the fertile highlands of the Eldoret area of Kenya. 

This charming mother of four has been engaged in mixed farming for the past two years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main sources of income have been eggs, milk, tea, and a variety of food crops that she plants. 

Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Eldoret region. Susan has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. 

Being a visionary woman, Susan has always wanted to increase her poultry. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women, like Susan, will achieve their dreams and goals. 

Susan believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. 

In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Khloud

texts.en: Kholoud is a conservative lady. So she asked her son to appear in the photo instead. Kholoud is a 45-year-old married lady living in Jordan with her family that consists of four members. Her son who is appearing in the photo is a university student majoring in Civil Engineering, and he is in his third year. His aim is to  finish his studies to find a job in his field and to depend on himself. But Kholoud doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her sons' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Gita is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Maynaguri. She is married to Binod and blessed with three children. They live in a small village, Anandanagar, at Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. Two of her children are studying in secondary level of a rural school.

Gita‘s husband is a barber whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So, to help her husband financially, Gita wants to sell cows’ milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she will be able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this young, ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to start her business by selling milk products such as butter, curd and cottage cheese.

Gita seeks to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Gita will be able to reach her goals, which include constructing a new and better house, and a better education for her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Usha is from Maynaguri. She is 26 years old and married with one daughter. Her daughter is too young for school. Usha is a homemaker who looks after her child, does all the household work, and in her spare time, helps her husband in his paddy business. 

Usha's husband is associated with a paddy rice business. He purchases paddy in bulk from the wholesale market and sells it in his neighborhood and nearby villages. He has been engaged in this business for many years. He is a person who always struggles for his family's well being. Moreover, his daughter and wife are his greatest motivation in life, and for them he takes every challenge in order to provide them with a good lifestyle. He has goodwill with their customers for his good behavior and good product. Usha also assists her husband in this business. 

Now Usha and her husband want to grow their business in order to earn more profits. So, Usha is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more paddy rice in bulk from the wholesale market. She believes that the loan will help them to grow their business and can generate more income to improve the well being of the family.

Usha wants to upgrade their present business with the profit. She is thankful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more paddy for her paddy business.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёре 18 лет. Он умная и целеустремленная девушка. Сайёра в школе училась отлично и активно участвовала во всех общественных мероприятиях школы. Она с детства мечтала стать учительницей и служить своему народу. Она в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Педагогический Университет. Сайёра живет с родителями, и ее родители очень гордятся ею. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sayora is 18 years old. She is a smart and purposeful girl. Sayora studied well in school and actively participated in all the social activities at the school. Since childhood, she dreamed of becoming a teacher and serving her people. 

This year she finished high school and entered the Pedagogical University. Sayora lives with her parents, and they are very proud of her. She requests a loan in order to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Swapna is a hardworking lady. She hails from Maynaguri. She is married with three daughters and one son. They live in a small village, Khagrabari, in Jalpaiguri district.

Swapna's husband is a cycle-van puller whose income is hardly enough for the family. So, to help her husband fiscally, Swapna runs her own cattle rearing business. She sells cows’ milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she is able to support her family and save for a secure future. Now she wants to expand her business by selling milk products such as butter, curd, and cottage cheese.

Thus, Swapna seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a dairy cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Swapna will be able to reach her goal of providing a good education to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her animal husbandry and milk supply business.

loans.name: Mutiso

texts.en:
Mutiso is a 28-year-old man, married to Florence who earns additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  Mutiso has been a farmer for a period of seven years earning an income of 12,000 KES every month.

Mutiso visited one of our marketing events and was impressed with VisionFund loan products. He is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 KES and intends to use this amount  to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm plantation. Mutiso plans to use the anticipated income to boost his retail shop which his wife manages and hopes to open a general wholesale shop in his hometown.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm plantation.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба 58-летняя талантливая женщина. Она умеет кроить и шить. Этот талант она унаследовала от своей матери. Махбуба предоставляет услуги швеи у себя на дому на протяжении 18 лет. Она шьет только женские платья национального стиля. 
Махбуба овдовела давно. У нее только одна дочь-студентка, с которой она живет в маленьком городке Вахдат. Махбуба уже многие годы шьет на машинке старого производства. Теперь она хотела бы купить модернизированную швейную машинку, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Для осуществления этой цели она нуждается в кредите. Махбуба надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 58 years old, talented woman. She knows how to cut and sew. She inherited this talent from her mother. Mahbuba has provided a sewing service from her home for a period of 18 years. She only sews women's national dresses. 

Mahbuba became a widow long ago. She only has one daughter, who is a student, with whom she lives in the small town of Vahdat. 

Mahbuba has been sewing on an old sewing machine for many years already. Currently she would like to purchase a modern sewing machine, in order to expand her business. To realize this goal she needs a loan. Mahbuba hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1966 году. Садбарг замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью получения дохода она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Садбарг шьет национальные женские платья. Она начала свой бизнес со старой швейной машинки, которая осталась ей от ее матери. Это машинка шьет не качественно, поэтому Садбарг решила купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить качество сервиса и таким образом привлечь клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки новой швейной машинки. С полученного дохода она будет улучшать условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Sadbarg is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1966. Sadbarg is married and raising four children. 

With an aim to get an income, she started her business of sewing women's clothing. Sadbarg sews women's national dresses. She started her business with an old sewing machine, which her mother left her. Her sewing machine does not sew well, and therefore Sadbarg decided to purchase a new one, in order to improve the quality of her service and this way attract more customers. 

She requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni to purchase a new sewing machine. With the resulting income she will improve her living conditions. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing material

loans.name: Zarullo

texts.ru: Зарулло из района Гончи, он предприимчивый молодой человек в возрасте 29 лет. В настоящее время Зарулло является мастером по ремонту домов и эта его деятельность является сезонной. По наступлению холодов, он остается совсем без заказов. Зарулло сейчас собирается начать такой бизнес, который будет иметь стабильный доход и не будет зависеть от сезона. Он планирует заняться животноводством, а именно куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Его сбережение составляет около 200 долларов США. Еще недостающую сумму он просит в кредит, чтобы закупить двух голов бычков и корм для скота. Зарулло надеется, что его поддержат в начинании нового бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zarullo is from the Gonchi region. He is an enterprising young man of the age of 29. Currently, Zarullo is a master carpenter, refurbishing houses, and this is a seasonal business. When the cold comes, he is left without orders altogether. 

Zarullo has decided to start a business which will give a stable income and not depend on the season. He plans to work with livestock breeding, specifically buying and reselling cattle. He has around 200 US dollar in savings. As he still needs some more money, he requests a loan in order to purchase two bull-calves and cattle fodder. Zarullo hopes you will help him in starting this new business.

loans.use: to purchase two bull-calves and fodder to start a new business

loans.name: Christina Lum

texts.en:
Christina Lum is married and a mother of five children. They live in a 2-room house in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has suffered hardship from the lost of her parents, victim of theft, and the death of a large quantity of fowls in her poultry. These are some of the things that made her worried. However in spite of these, she is still hopeful that her business will improve.

Christina Lum intends to use the loan to carry out agriculture; by buying her seedlings and fertilizer; and to open up a provision store to sell items like vegetable oil, biscuits, sweets, canned tomatoes, and magi seasoning cubes. She will also buy firewood to sell, and buy more chicks, their feed and medicine to increase her poultry farm. The community will benefit from this activity because the trading will be done locally therefore it will reduce the transportation cost to buy and the community can buy at any time of the day.

With the profit from the loan, she will be able to pay the children’s school fee and take good care of the family needs. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rate is moderate and she can pay back in installments within a preferable repayment duration.

loans.use: To buy supplies to sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 52-летняя сельская женщина из села района А.Джоми. Она разведена и живет в селе вместе с детьми, невестками и внуками. Ее дети уже взрослые и им по 33, 30, 28, 26, 22 и 14 лет. Ее сыновья занимаются растениеводством. Сама Гулбахор на протяжении 15 лет занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота для продажи. Она довольна своим бизнесом, так как он приносит ей стабильный доход. Сейчас Гулбахор хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить семейный бюджет. Она просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США для купли нескольких голов коров и телят. Так поголовье ее скотов, а тем самым и доход от их продаж увеличится. Гулбахор надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a 52 years old rural woman from a village in the A. Jomi region. She is divorced and lives together with her children, daughters-in-law and grandchildren in the village. Her children are already adults and they are 33, 30, 28, 26, 22 and 14 years old. Her sons work with field crop cultivation. Gulbahor has worked with breeding cattle for selling for a period of 15 years. She enjoys her business, as it gives her a stable income. 

Currently Gulbahor would like to expand her business and increase the family budget. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar to purchase some cows and calves. As the total number of cattle increases, her income from selling them will also increase. Gulbahor hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to purchase some cows and calves to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe operates a cow selling business and she appreciates for the support of the previous loan. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business, but she is doing well with the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of cows in the future. 

With her new KES 50,000 loan she wants to purchase two cows for sale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for sale

loans.name: Jakaza

texts.en:
Jakaza is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Jakaza operates a market stall that sells vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

Jakaza decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Simon is married and has twelve children. He is a retired driver. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for fifty two years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, mangoes, avocados, guavas, macadamia and coffee. They also keep livestock. Simon is excited about beekeeping as the bees will also help in pollinating their crops.

This is Simon's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family. Simon's hope for the future is to live a better life and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Beatrice is married and has six children. She sells farm produce at her local market. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for forty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, potatoes, sugarcane and coffee. Beatrice is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Beatrice's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to develop her homestead. Beatrice's hope for the future is to establish a zero grazing unit.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Uba has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses. With her KES 10,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma always struggles to improve her food stall business, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, soap, rice and food packaging for the business. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Myc4 at large.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, soap, rice and food packaging for the business

loans.name: Kalunda

texts.en:
Kalunda operates a secondhand clothes-selling business. Her challenge in the business is seasonality. In the future, she dreams of expanding to be a wholesale supplier of secondhand clothes. 

With the 40,000 KES loan, Kalunda wants to purchase three bales of children clothes for resale in the business. She decided to join Yehu to access this loan and she appreciates the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase children clothes to resell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Joseph is married and has six children. He is a church elder as well as a farmer. He has been farming for forty years now and he is currently growing maize, vegetables, bananas, sugarcane, macadamia and coffee. Joseph is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and it will provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Joseph's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to build a permanent house. Joseph's hope for the future is to develop his livelihood.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been involved in beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

David is married and has two children. Both he and his wife have been farmers for 15 years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans and horticultural crops. They also keep livestock. 

David is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food and medicine.This will be his first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to develop his livelihood. David's hope for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Nancy is married and has three children. She is a tailor. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for fifteen years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, bananas, macadamia and coffee. Nancy is excited about beekeeping as the bees will also help in pollinating their crops. 

This is Nancy's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children and buy a sewing machine. Nancy's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Lawrence is married and has six children. He runs a restaurant. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for forty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas, fruit trees and tea and they also keep livestock. Lawrence is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey and wax and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Lawrence's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children and to improve his livelihood. Lawrence's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Maurine is married and has five children. She is a tailor. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, millet, beans and vegetables. They also keep poultry. Maurine is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Maurine’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her tailoring business. Maurine’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y aún está soltera.

María se dedica a trabajar en un supermercado, ella trabaja de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde, para llegar al lugar viaja en bus por 1hora y media, ya tiene 3 años con 3 meses de experiencia  y anteriormente estuvo trabajando en una farmacia, además en sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar fútbol.

Ella necesita el crédito para pagarle a un abogado que le elabore los documentos de aceptación de herencia, pues con lo que devenga solo le ajusta para los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos, y transporte. 

Ella sueña con construir una casa y retomar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria, 29, has a high school degree and is still single.

Maria works in a supermarket.  She works from 8am until 4pm.  In order to get to work, she travels 1.5 hours by bus.  She already has 3 years and 3 months of experience in this job.  Previously, she was working in a pharmacy.  In her spare time, she enjoys playing soccer.

Maria needs a loan to pay for a lawyer to prepare the documents she needs to receive an inheritance, because her salary is only enough to cover her expenses for food, basic services, and transportation.  Maria dreams of building a house and returning to her studies.

loans.use: to pay a lawyer to prepare the documents she needs to receive an inheritance

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of six children. They all live in a seven-room house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has suffered from the death of her parents,  the sickness of her son, theft, and inadequate capital to start up a business.

With this new loan, she will buy food items for her restaurant in bulk, such as beans, three bags of rice, cocoyams, and two tins of vegetable oil. Part of the loan will also be used to buy fowl needed for her restaurant, and bush meat. She will also improve the table conditions of her restaurant and buy more dishes. The community will benefit from this activity in that they will buy good food. Also, they can buy at any time of day.

With the profit from the loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees, and take good care of her family and their needs. She rather prefers a loan from Ghape because the interest rate is moderate, she pays back in installments, and the duration of the loan too is encouraging.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, cocoyams, vegetable oil, fowl, meat and corn.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a married mother of five, lives with her family in a five-room house in Bamenda, Cameroon. She regrets the time she had nothing to eat when she had an accident and was sick in the hospital. 

Alice will use this loan to expand her small business by buying more clothes and shoes in bulk to retail them to small traders in town. This activity will help the community in that people will not be dirty in the streets.

Alice's profits will help pay the children’s school fees, buy a plot of land upon which to build a house of her own, and also meet the family's other needs.  She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it has helped her previously, and the repayment schedule is not stressful.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married and has a 6-year-old child. Although her financial situation was alright, Özlem didn't like sitting at home with nothing to do. She wanted something to keep her busy and where she could make new friends. She learned about Tupperware from a friend. At first, she learned about the products by buying and using them before deciding to sell them. This job allows her to take care of her child and meet with her friends a few days a week. She enjoys her work. She will use the loan to raise her sales and reach a certain goal by the end of the year. “My only goal is to raise my daughter well and put her through university,” she said.
 
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Özlem hanım altı yıllık evli bir çocuk annesi.  Özlem Hanım,maddi durumunun çok iyi olduğu halde evde boş oturmaktan sıkılmış.  Bir şeylerle uğraşmak ,çevre edinmek için bu işi yapıyor.  Tupperware  satmaya arkadaş ortamında tanıştığı  tupurwere tanıtımı yapan kişi tarafından karar veriyor.  Önce ürünleri inceler alıp kullanır,birkaç kere tupperware toplantılarına katılır ve bu işi yapmaya karar verir.  Bu işi yaparken hem evine hem çocuğuna vakit ayırabiliyor hem de haftanın birkaç gününü  arkadaşları ile geçirebiliyor.  İşini severek yapıyor .  Aldığı kredi ile satışını arttıracak yılbaşına kadar belli bir satışa ulaşacağını söylüyor.  “Bir kızım var tek gayem kızım güzel bir şekilde yetiştirmek ve üniversiteyi okutmak “olduğunu söylüyor.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Pachinche Unido  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Pachinche Unido, grupo formado por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres que se unieron para recibir los créditos y con estos mejorar sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Mariela, tiene 23 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de un año. Su esposo trabaja en el campo.
Doña Mariela es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas, sobrecamas y edredones, su forma de venta puerta a puerta, trabaja casi todos los días en las tardes ya que es cuando encuentra a sus clientes y aprovecha para vender y cobrar, deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, lleva más de 2 años en este negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y sobrecamas. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y espera seguir contando con la ayuda de los créditos por mucho tiempo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of Pachinche Unido Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the town by the name of Pachinche, in Colón Parish in the city of Portoviejo.  The area is known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and ranching.  The members got together to get loans to improve their businesses.

One of the members of this group is Mariela, 23.  She's married and has a one-year-old child from that relationship.  Her husband works in the fields.

Mariela's a homemaker who sells sheets, bedspreads, and quilts to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells door-to-door and works almost every afternoon, when she makes the most of meeting her customers to sell and collect payment.  She leaves products on credit and collects weekly.  She has been in this business for more than two years.

This loan is to buy sheets, quilts, and bedspreads.  It's her first loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are quick.  She hopes to continue having the help of the loans for a long time.

Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts, and bedspreads

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Veronicah is married and has two children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for eighteen years now and they are currently growing maize, horticultural crops, macadamia and trees, and they also keep livestock. Veronicah is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Veronicah's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to improve her living standards. Veronicah's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Halime

texts.en:
Halime is married with two children. One of her sons finished university and is now a commissioned officer. Her other son is currently studying in the university. Halime started selling Tupperware with one of her friends and eventually became a Tupperware group leader. She particularly enjoys that the job takes her to different countries when she is successful in sales. To date she has traveled to eight different countries. Her target for now is to increase profits by the New Year’s so that she can travel abroad again. She is organizing Tupperware parties in different neighborhoods in order to gain new customers. With the Kiva loan, she will buy new products to sell.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Halime Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Bir oğlu üniversiteyi bitirmiş subay olmuş.  Diğer oğlu üniversitede okumakta .Halime hanım bir tupperware kullanıcısıdır.Tupperware satışı yapan arkadaşlarının önerisi ile başlar.  Zamanla bu iş de ilerler ve grup lideri olur.  Çalışarak çevre edinir.  Bu işin en güzel yanının yurt dışı gezileri olduğununu söylüyor.  Şimdiye kadar sekiz ülke gezmiş .  Hedefi bu yılbaşına kadar satışlarını arttırmak ve yılbaşında yurt dışına gitmek.  Halime Hanım ev toplantıları düzenleyerek  değişik çevrelere ulaşıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile de ürün alıp çeşidini arttıracak .

loans.use: to buy new products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una estudiante que cada día se está esmerando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de sus estudios.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder salir adelante y abrirse camino.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su carrera, ya que por medio de ello podrá seguir luchando por poder cumplir con su meta.
texts.en: Maria  is a student who each day is doing her very best to improve her living conditions through her education.  She is studying for an accounting degree and through her studies wants to be able to succeed and make her way in life.  Maria is requesting this loan so that she can use it to pay her degree fees, as through this she will be able to continue striving to fulfill her goal.

loans.use: To pay for university fees

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children, all of whom attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a 40-year-old married lady living with her family, which consists of four members, in Salt, Jordan. She has been running a beauty salon which became a source of income for her family. One of her sons is a university student majoring in sport training, and he is in his second year. His aim is to become self-dependent after getting his Bachelor's, and she wants to support him in paying his upcoming semester fees by applying for this loan.

Montaha is a conservative lady, so she asked her son to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with six children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rehema operates a food making business, making chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing food stuff is her major challenge. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. In the near future, she dreams to expand her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Mürüvet Fatma

texts.en:
Muruvet has been selling Tupperware for 15 years now. The family relies on this business to support the home and her children’s education since her spouse does not have a steady income. She recently participated in a Tupperware-sponsored overseas trip and would not have had the opportunity to do so without her career with Tupperware. With this loan she will buy new Tupperware supplies to make a better profit. Her main aim is to support her children in school.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Mürüvet Hanım onbeş yıldır bir arkadaşının teşvikiyle tupperware satışı yapıyor.  Aynı zaman da tuhafiye dükkanı işletiyor.  Eşinin sürekli bir işi olmadığından evini geçindirmek ve çocuklarını okutmak için iş hayatına atılıyor.  Her iki işi yapmakdan da zevk alıyor.  Çevresinin genişlediğini ekonomik olarak güçlendiğini ifade ediyor.  Yurt dışı gezilerine katılmış.  Bunun da bu iş sayesinde olduğunu kendi imkanları ile böyle bir olanağa sahip olamayacağını söyledi . Aldığı kredi ile tupperware den ürün alıp satışını arttıracak.  Tek amacının çocuklarını okutmak .

loans.use: to buy products to sell

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married with four children. Emine makes and sells handmade goods in order to support her family, and she is also in the Tupperware business. Her goal is to increase sales so that she can partake in one of the job perks, an overseas trip. With this credit she will buy new stock and her goal is to increase sales by the new year.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Emine Hanım evli dört çocuk annesi.  Emine Hanım ailesine katkı sağlamak için evde el işleri  yapıp satıyor.  Ablasının teşvikiyle Tupperware işine giriyor.  Altı senedir  tupperware satışı yapıyor.  Hedefi  satışlarını arttırmak ve yurt dışı gezilerine gitmek.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün almak ve yılbaşına kadar satışlarını arttırmak istiyor

loans.use: to buy products to sell

loans.name: Omm Siridisai Shg Group

texts.en:
K. Laxmi is a resident of a small village of Koraput District in Odisha state, India. She is a mother of three children. In the picture, the lady seated in the middle of the first row is K. Laxmi. Currently, two of her kids still depend on her, since one child is in school. 

Her entire family relies solely on rice farming and a grocery selling business. K. Laxmi has been involved in her current business for more than 13 years, and now she is able to earn up to 4,800 INR per month. She has never been with People's Forum India, Kiva’s partner, before. 

K. Laxmi currently leads a group of ten women who want to obtain a new loan. All of her co-borrowers are first-time borrowers with People's Forum. The total loan amount for the entire group is 150,000 INR. K. Laxmi's loan portion will be 15,000 INR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her farmland will produce a better yield so she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in Ogongo, in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Samwel is married and has seven children. He is a security guard at a school and his wife is a social worker. They also do farming. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, millet, ground nuts, bananas, pawpaws and mangoes. Samwel is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Samwel's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay for the school fees of his children. Samwel's hope for the future is to be able to sustain his family and keep them healthy and to have his children educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, viene de una familia muy luchadora, y que siempre se ha esforzado.
