Está estudiando la carrera de Psicología laboral, y es por medio de su carrera que quiere abrirse camino y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su esfuerzo y su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesina, ya que eso implica un gran gasto que le gustaría poder cubrir para seguir con su sueño de ser un profesional exitoso.
texts.en: Sergio is from the city of Paraguarí.  He comes from a family of fighters who have always strived.  He is studying for a career in occupational psychology.  Through this career, he wants to open a path for himself and be able to help his loved ones through his effort and work.  He is asking for this loan so that he can pay for his thesis as it is a huge cost that he hopes to be able to pay in order to continue with his dream of being a successful professional.

loans.use: with costs associated with his thesis.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Five years ago, Benard started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Bigwa, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Today, this hardworking man sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of food crops. He is a passionate farmer with an immense knowledge on farming, and he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. 

Dairy farming is close to his heart that everyday he wakes up to milk his cows and that makes him very proud. Although he makes profits through milk selling, he lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, he will have a humble time milking his cows and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where his cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise from being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Benard believes that through this loan his living condition will improve because he is going to have an increased milk production. He will be able to save the money that he is now spending on treating his cows because of the lack of good dairy unit. Benard waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida con mucho sacrificio está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, espera llegar a obtener su primer título, y anhela trabajar más  para lograr obtener  mayor  ingreso para su familia. 
Es soltera, vivo con sus padres, trabajo como secretaria y con mucho sacrificio está llegando a su objetivo.
Pide este préstamo para poder  pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en: With a lot of sacrifice, Zoraida is studying to be a nurse.  She hopes to earn her first degree, and she strives to work more in order to earn a better income for her family.  She is single, lives with her parents, works as a secretary, and with a lot of sacrifice is working towards her goal.  She is asking for this loan to pay her college tuition, because through this she will be able to continue fighting for her dreams.

loans.use: pay for her college tuition.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Arco Iris, es un grupo luchador y unido que está saliendo adelante para poder ayudar a sus familias, ellas también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vanesa, Directora General del Comité, quien se dedica al comercio, es decir a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace tiempo. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Vanesa solicita este préstamo para la compra de más prendas de vestir, ya que tiene mucha clientela a quien quiere seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en: The group is called Arco Iris (Rainbow).  They are a unified group of fighters who are getting ahead in order to help their families.  They are also a part of the program to eliminate poverty.  One of the members is Vanesa, the General Director of the Committee.  She works in business, selling clothing, which she has done for a long time.  Thanks to this career, she is able to maintain her home and improve her earnings.  She is a hard worker who wants to get ahead.  Vanesa is seeking this loan to purchase more clothing because she has many customers, and she wants to continue to serve them.

loans.use: purchase clothing items to resell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven muy responsable, su familia es muy trabajadora, cuentan con una pequeña micro industria familiar, su meta es ser un profesional de la Salud de manera a que mejore sus ingresos y ayude a su familia.
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y es por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Eduardo is a very responsible young man.  His family is very hardworking and they have a small family business.  His goal is to be a health professional so that he can increase his earnings and help his family.  He is studying to be a nurse, and through his education, he wants to open up a path for himself to get ahead.  He is seeking a loan to pay for his tuition, which will be very helpful.

loans.use: pay for his college tuition.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara vive con su familia en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, una vez culminada su carrera de Criminalística, quiere poder ayudar a sus padres y seguir estudiando otras carreras.
Su meta es llegar a concluir su carrera para así poder ejercer su profesión y sentirse útil a la sociedad.
Su aspiración es llegar a ser una muy buena profesional para así salir adelante y tener un buen futuro.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma cumplir con su anhelado sueño.
texts.en:
Sara  lives with her family in the city of Coronel Once he has completed her degree in criminology, she wants to be able to help her parents and continue studying for other degrees.

 Her goal is to succeed in completing her degree so that she can practice her profession and feel useful to society. Her ambition is to succeed in being a very accomplished professional so that she can succeed and have a good future.
 
She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her fees and this way fulfill her desired dream.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El grupo 12 de junio está en su ciclo número 13 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ellas están mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio de la lucha de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, quien se dedica al bordado, ella hace crochet muy lindos y que tiene muy buena venta, y es por medio de su trabajo que ayuda a sus seres queridos para un mejor futuro. Ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio, esmero y lucha está mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y quiere seguir haciéndolo, es por ello que pone todo de sí.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales como agujas, hilos de croché y otros, lo que le ayudará a seguir trabajando y esforzándose por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group, "12 de Junio" (June 12th), is in its 12th cycle in the Women's Committee program, where they all work and help one another to get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination program where they are improving their living conditions, and those of their families, through their everyday work.  

One of the members is Zulma who works in embroidery.  She makes really beautiful crochets and they sell very well.  Through her work, she helps her loved ones have a better future.  She states that through a lot of sacrifice, dedication and struggle she is improving her living conditions, and she wants to continue doing so, which is why she puts all of herself into everything she does.

She is seeking this loan to purchase materials such as needles, yarn and other supplies that will help her to continue working and striving to succeed.

loans.use: purchase needles, crochet yarn, and other items to continue crocheting.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Corazon de Jesus se llama este grupo, es nuevo y está en su ciclo número 1, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual, cada una de ellas ira mejorando.
Lidia integra este grupo, ella es peluquera, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va a su negocio por la buena atención que hace está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que de esa forma podrá ir invirtiendo en su trabajo luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar peines, tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y demás, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called Corazon de Jesus. It's new and is in its first cycle. They are part of a poverty-elimination program, through which, each of them is improving.

Lidia, a hairdresser, is part of this group. She has good customers who always go to her for quality service. She's very grateful for the opportunity she's receiving, as she will be able to invest in her business and fight to improve her quality of life. She's asking for this loan to buy combs, dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, etc. in order to keep providing her clients with a good service.

loans.use: to buy combs, dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, etc.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Sorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Leonadus

texts.en:
Leonadus lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Leonadus is married, and has one child. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 30 years now, and they are currently growing maize, millet, cassava and sunflower. They also keep bees. Leonadus is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Leonadus’ first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for the basic needs of his family and pay for his child’s school fees. Leonadus’ hope for the future is to have his child educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Chanthet's Group

texts.en: Chanthet’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanthet makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as construction worker and farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Yarn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer and selling cake and porridge to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bona's Group

texts.en: Bona’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Bona makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and he also does extra work as farm laborer and factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en: Nem’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom in Cambodia. Nem makes a living cultivating cassava and  selling Khmer medicines and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en: Sat’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sat makes a living cultivating rice, making furniture and selling groceries to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khy's Group

texts.en: Khy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en: Samoeun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Samoeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer and selling groceries at home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: Mon’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mon makes a living as a tailor and selling groceries at home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Rukia, who is in her mid 50s is married with five children. Three of them are still at school, and two of them are grown-ups.  She has been running two projects, a general store and chicken (layers, which lay eggs).  She has been in this business for four years now. She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Rukia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start the chicken business and increase on the general store stock.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She is happy with the loan.  She will use this loan to  increase on the general store inventory and to buy chicks and chicken feed.  She dreams of having a big business.

Rukia will share this loan with her loan group "Pilika Pilika" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the general store inventory and to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Nicholine

texts.en:
Nicholine is married with two children; they live in a two-room house in Bamenda, Cameroon. She regrets thinking about the disappointment she had in her marriage, an illness that kept her down for two good years, her father's death, and dropping out of school because of poverty.  Despite all these problems encountered, she knows and beliefs that business will succeed.

The new loan she has gone in for is to be used for the buying of medicine, body lotion of all types, and also to buy some of the general provision items like sweets, biscuits, school pens, and pens because she is near a school. The business will be a success because what she sells is mostly needed by school children now and again; no other person is selling the same items around her.  The community will benefit from this activity in that the people will have quality goods sold to them at a cheaper rate; the activity will help to develop the habits of the inhabitants.

The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, raise the standards of family well being, and also to acquire wealth. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training given to members, also, the interest rates is low.

loans.use: To buy medicine and other items.

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Fortunatus is in his late 20’s, and married with one child who is still small. He has been selling chips with chicken, goat meat and beef, as well as bananas. He does not fry the meat but just boils it. He has been in this business for five years now. He works with his wife. They work from 11 a.m. to midnight daily, and are able to make a good monthly profit. This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan, which he successfully repaid, to restock items in his business. Fortunatus is happy with the loan and thanks Kiva for its support of his loan group. He used the additional profit to cover household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, chicken, goat meat and beef, cooking oil, charcoal and bananas. He dreams of building his own house, and of being able to afford to send his children to very good schools. Fortunatus will share this loan with his loan group, "MTI MREFU." The three members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, chicken, goat meat and beef, cooking oil, charcoal and bananas.

loans.name: Francisco Adalid

texts.es:
Los maestros son la luz en el camino de la educación, son quienes brindan las herramientas cognitivas para convertir a los mejores profesionales. Razón por la cual Francisco, de 49 años de edad, es profesor de una universidad de la capital, donde además de enseñar, está estudiando el quinto año de la carrera de Administración de empresas en el turno nocturno, de manera que pueda seguir aprendiendo. Sueño que desde hace mucho tiempo deseaba cumplir.
En estos momentos, este padre de cuatro hijos de las edades de 12, 10, 6 y 8 años, ya lleva tres años como profesor  y quiere seguir brindando lo mejor de él. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil y así poder completar su lista de instrumentos para un mejor desempeño en sus clases, tanto como profesor como estudiante. Su meta es seguir desarrollándose en su trabajo y seguir superándose para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Teachers are the light in the pathway of an education, they bring the cognitive tools to make their students into the best professionals.  This is why Francisco, 40, is a teacher in a university in the capital.  In addition to teaching, he is studying in his 5th year for a degree in Business Administration in the night program.  This way, he can continue to learn.  This is a dream that he has wanted to accomplish for a long time.

At this time, he is the father of children aged 12, 10, 6 and 8.  He's been teaching already for 3 years, and he wants to continue to do his best.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer so that he can have a complete set of tools.  This way, he can perform better in his classes, as a teacher as well as a student.  His goal is to continue to develop in his work and continue to excel so that he can have a better quality of life along with his family.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer

loans.name: Protect The Forest Group

texts.en:
Abena came from Agave but currently lives in Gold Coast Camp with her family in Assin North District in the Central Region of Ghana. She is 48 years old and married with three children aged 24, 22, and 20 years. Abena has been growing palm plantation and cocoa for the past 25 years. She produces palm oil from the palm fruits that she harvests from her own farm. Abena is also a gari processor which she sells at the local market on market days. 

Abena's main challenge now is to secure a loan to purchase a clean cooking stove (aka an Elsa Stove) that utilizes waste products, such as palm kernel shells (virgin pellets) as fuel. Abena cannot wait to have this cost-saving and affordable clean cooking stove to improve her means of cooking. She is so eager because she can now find a use for her by-product virgin pellet, which will save her from carrying firewood after a hard day'ss work. 

Abena and her group have decided to use clean cooking stoves after a community education program about saving the forest and ways to reduce indoor/outdoor air pollution. Abena is now applying for 170 GHS to purchase an Elsa Clean Cook stove to protect her family from indoor air pollution and to reduce cutting of the trees from the forest in her village for charcoal and firewood. Abena and her entire group members say thank you to all their microlenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase clean cook stoves

loans.name: Blanco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras, dedicadas a la comercialización de mariscos, se unieron hace meses para mejorar su nivel de ingresos y calidad de vida, a través del acceso al crédito.  

Loyra: Es una mujer amable, tiene 48 años de edad, casada. Es integrante del grupo blanco. Tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es marinero. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso desde hace 3 años trabaja como pirquinera. Solicita financiamiento para pagar el salario a sus trabajadores, ya que la actividad económica a la que se dedica consiste en entregarles un monto de capital por adelantado a sus trabajadores para que le traigan mariscos y los venda a precios accesibles en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es vender ropa usada y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three hardworking women who sell seafood. They joined a few months ago to improve their income and quality of life through access to credit.

Loyra is a kind woman. She's 48 years old and married. She is a member of the Blanco solidarity group. She has three children and her husband is a sailor. In order to have her own source of income, she has been working as a seafood merchant. She request a loan to pay salaries to her employees because her business requires her to deliver an amount of capital upfront to her employees and they bring her seafood. She sells at affordable prices in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to sell used and new clothing.

loans.use: to pay upfront costs for selling seafood

loans.name: Unique Group

texts.en:
Tatu is aged early forties, married and has four school-aged kids. For five years now, she has been supporting her family by running a grocery where she sells drinks such as beers, sodas, water, spirits, juices, and wine. She starts the business from 3pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request to be apportioned among Unique, a five woman group.The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Tatu will use her loan to buy grocery drinks (beers, spirits, wine, water, and juices). She dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business and become a successful woman.

loans.use: to buy grocery drinks.

loans.name: Magomeni Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her early 50s, is single with one daughter.  She has been selling soft drinks, running a beauty salon, and selling Muslim style dresses.  She has been in this business for five years now.  She works from 9am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salma's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used  the previous loans to start selling soft drinks, sell Muslim type of dresses and buy salon equipment. She has paid back her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to  buy  soft drinks and salon equipment.  She dreams of opening a retail shop.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group "MAGOMENI" which has a total of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and salon equipment.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is married and has five children with whom she lives in a five-room apartment in Bamenda. She encountered problems like inadequate finances to start up a business, sickness, school drop out in her family due to limited funds to pay school fees, and the death of her husband.
 
With the new loan requested, she will buy seedlings, fertilizer, pay for the labor, she will also invest part of the loan in poultry farming by buying more chicks, feeders, feed, and vaccine. This activity will help the community in that food will be in constant supply, while the waste from the poultry will be used as manure for the cultivated crops.

With the profit from these agricultural activities, she will be able to sponsor her children in school, use some to pay for hospital bills, and improve on the needs of the family; she will save some for the future. 

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the organization trains on income generating activities before disbursing out the loan, and their interest rates are extremely low.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, fowl, feed, vaccines, and feeders, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Saquilla Group

texts.en:
Sebastiana is the 31 year old, energetic Secretary of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Saquilla” located in the busy and colorful town of Chichicastenango, Guatemala. There are ten women in the Trust Bank and the majority of them speak the Mayan dialect of Kiche. Sebastiana strives to be the perfect mother to her four children. She is a weaver and along with other members of her family, creates beautiful, traditional tubular or wrap skirts called “cortes”.  The cloth for the corte is woven on a floor loom with bands of color interspersed with ikat-patterned threads. As the business is growing little by little, Sebastiana is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase replacement parts for her five-foot looms!  She wants to keep her four employees busy and increase production and income for all involved. 

Many women in the Trust Bank, including Sebastiana, have gained confidence and self-esteem from experiencing increased success in their small businesses. They have also empowered themselves from the knowledge gained during their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares beneficial knowledge with the women in their own language about how to manage their loans effectively (budgeting, marketing, pricing, customer service, accounting) and how to take care of their families (health, hygiene, nutrition). Sebastiana shares that the classes on self-esteem have been very useful and taught her how to value herself more as a woman. Friendship Bridge calls the effective combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

The Trust Bank “Saquilla” extends gratitude to each KIVA investor for funding their loans. This is a tremendous help not only for the ladies but also for their families and their community. We look forward to reporting on the group in the very near future. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for her five-foot looms.

loans.name: Good Energy Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 60-year-old woman who resides in Gold Coast Camp in the Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. Grace has been a cocoa farmer for the past 30 years. She also grows foodstuffs for subsistence living and processes gari for sale in the nearby market. Grace is married with two children, aged 20 and 13 years old and all are attending school. 

Grace is the leader and representative of Good Energy Group. Grace together with her group members are applying for a GHC 170 microloan each to purchase Elsa Clean cook stoves. The stove uses virgin pellets as fuel, and this fuel is a waste material within their community which is a leading palm oil processing community within their district. By using the Elsa Clean cook stove, Grace and her group members will no more depend on the forest for firewood for cooking.

Grace and her entire group members are grateful to their microlenders for helping them protect the forest within their community.

loans.use: to purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Matonya Group

texts.en:
Siwema, who is in her early 40’s, is married and has two sons and two daughters, and only one is at school. For a period of five years, Siwema has supported her family by running a genge, selling fruits and vegetables, fresh milk and cooking oil in the same place. She operates her business both in a public-market and at home. Siwema works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request to be apportioned among MATONYA, a seven-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  Siwema will use her loan to replenish her genge with liters of milk and cooking oil. Her desire is to be successful in business and life.

loans.use: to replenish her genge with liters of milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.en:
Maria is a young 24-year-old woman who is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Esfuerzo”, meaning “effort, strength or vigor”, located in Santa Clara La Laguna on the shores of Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. She married quite young and when she was 16 years old, had the first of her two children who are now five and eight years of age.  She was unable to complete her formal education, and only reached the 6th grade. Her husband works as a bricklayer and the couple works hard to meet the needs of the family.  

Two years ago, Maria started her food service business and makes traditional Guatemalan dishes like rice or corn tamales and a thick corn drink called “atole”. She offers her delicious food for sale not only in the local market of Santa Clara La Laguna, but also in other communities within an hour of the town. Maria is thrilled that the business is going well and wants to inject more capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase rice, corn, tomatoes, sugar and oil, as well as firewood. This will be her very first loan cycle and she is most excited!

Along with the seven other members of the Trust Bank, Maria is happy to participate in the monthly meetings of the group where a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares timely and useful information with them. The combination of small loans and education, called “Microcredit Plus,” is unique to Friendship Bridge and the women gain knowledge, self-esteem and leadership skills. Some of the topics covered include effective business management practices (accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing, pricing), health, hygiene, and nutrition, as well as women’s rights.

Kiva investors are most valuable partners funding loans for Maria and the ladies in the Trust Bank. It is impossible for them to obtain capital from a regular bank. They face a more prosperous and empowered future, armed with knowledge and increased income. Thank you, Kiva investors, for your kindness and generosity!

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, tomatoes, sugar and oil, as well as firewood.

loans.name: Ejatu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Ejatu. She is married. In 2009, Ejatu established her confectionery, drinks, and provisions business. Ejatu started her business so that she will be able to support her children's schooling. 

Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are all ages. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,821,600 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Ejatu requires a loan in order to buy additional drinks and provisions. With the loan she hopes that more customers will be attracted to her business. In the future, Ejatu plans to buy a plot of land with which she will build a two room house and a parlor. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and provisions

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is forty-nine-year-old Aminata. She is married. In 2008 Aminata established her yoghurt and ice cream business. She began her business because she wanted to help in taking care of her children. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are all ages. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,461,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy additional powdered milk and sugar to make her yoghurt. She hopes that this loan will help her to get all the materials needed to do her business. In the future Aminata plans to get a shop and to improve the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk powder and sugar.

loans.name: Ajima

texts.en:
Ajima is a 43-year-old housewife who lives in the small village of Khagrabari in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district with her husband and three children.  They attend school and college. In her childhood, Ajima did not get much opportunity to study, as her parents could not afford it. She is illiterate and only able to sign her name.

Ajima’s husband, 47-year-old Makabul, is a cycle-van puller. This is a very common vehicle widely used in rural areas of India to carry loads and people. It is an irregular type of job, so there are days where he gets no work and no pay. He puts in a lot of hard labor and time, but the profit is low.  Now he wants to generate more income for his family. He is thinking of buying another cycle van to carry people for additional income. There are very few means of transport in the villages, so the cycle-van is in great demand.

So Ajima sought a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) who gives business loans to rural women.  She wants to purchase a cycle-van for her husband. It will help her husband to serve more people in their village and earn more money.  The loan will help Ajima and her husband take a step closer to their goals of improved earnings, a better future for their family and a better education for her children.

She and her husband are grateful to the generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband.

loans.name: Adama K.

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Adama, who is married. In 2007, Adama established her black pepper, garlic, seasoned salt and cooking oil business. Adama started her business because she wants to take care of her children and herself. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are of all ages. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Adama requires a loan to buy more cooking seasonings and condiments. She hopes that this loan will improve her business by getting more customers and sales. With the proceeds of the loan, Adama plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for black pepper, garlic, seasoned salt

loans.name: Iye

texts.en: This is Iye.  She is married. In 2004, Iye established her cotton, brillion, kente and batik business. She began his business because she wanted to help in supporting her husband for the effective running of their home. Her business is located in a city center, and her main customers are adults. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,629,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Iye requires a loan in order to buy additional rolls of cotton. She hopes that this loan will put her business on a very strong footing. In the future, Iye plans to open a savings account for her eldest daughter to meet her university needs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for rolls of cotton.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cartoons of ladies slippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ladies' dresses, school bags, and other school items.

loans.name: Samafuao

texts.en: Samafuao is 39 years old and married with six children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Samafuao needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a new watering hose, a sprinkler, a pitchfork and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Samafuao will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, watering hose, sprinkler, pitchfork and gloves.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Samuel.  He is single. In 2007, Samuel established his soft drinks, provision and soap business. He began his business because he wanted to live a sustainable and respectable life, and to take care of his child’s needs. His business is located in a city center and his main customers are adults. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,520,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Samuel requires a loan in order to buy large quantities of soft drinks. He hopes that with this loan he will buy more stock and earn more profits. In the future, Samuel plans to give his child all the support he needs, as he has being admitted to the university, and also to employ someone to help in the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of soft drinks.

loans.name: Lagomau

texts.en: Lagomau is 40 years old and unmarried with six children.  She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. Lagomau needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Lagomau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, tiller, rake, new gumboots and a spade.

loans.name: Birakhamba Shg Group

texts.en:
Chandrakanta, age 27 and the mother of 1 child, is a villager from the Koraput district of Odisha state, India. In the picture, the lady seated first from the left-hand side is Chandrakanta. Her child lives with her and goes to school. For the sake of her entire family, Chandrakanta has (paddy) rice cropping as their main source of income and works for others for a fee. These are the businesses that she has had for seven years. This is the first loan cycle for Chandrakanta with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of this loan will be that she can improve her lifestyle. 

Chandrakanta has formed a group of 11 to help and support each other in their businesses and in their personnel lives. As the leader of this Birakhamba Shg, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a reaping fee. She hopes that she will get a better yield. The other members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities like animal raising, milk selling etc. All the group members are very happy and excited to have this loan and they are very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a reaping fee.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
This is Maya, and she is single. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help in the business. In 1999, Maya established her vegetable and fruit business. She began her business because she wanted to take good care of herself and her family. Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,363,000 every month from this business. 

Maya would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Maya requires a loan in order to buy additional fruits and vegetable. She hopes that this loan will increase her principal and make more income. In the future, Maya plans to establish her business by getting a shop instead of a stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
24-year-old Purnima is a housewife who is engaged in making incense. She lives in the small village of Petkata, in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district with her husband and two children.  In her childhood, Purnima did not get much opportunity to study, as her parents could not afford her education. She is illiterate and only able to sign her name.

Purnima’s husband, 27-year-old Mahadeb, is a cycle-van puller. This is a very common vehicle widely used in rural areas of India to carry loads and people. It is an irregular type of job, so there are days where he gets no work and no pay. He puts in a lot of hard labor and time, but the profit is low.  Now he wants to generate more income for his family. He is thinking of buying another cycle van for additional income. The cycle-van is in great demand in rural areas, as there are very few means of transport in the villages.

So Purnima applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She wants to purchase a cycle-van for her husband. It will help her husband to earn more profit.  The loan will help Purnima and her husband take a step closer to their goals of improved earnings and a better education for her children.

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Milovale

texts.en: Milovale is 47 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells Elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Milovale has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, brushes, rollers, material, stencils, wooden carved designs and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brushes, rollers, material, stencils, wooden carved designs and rubber gloves.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is 34 years old and married with five children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Lisa needs a loan to buy insect poison, a new wheelbarrow, gloves, a watering hose, fertilizer and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Lisa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, a new wheelbarrow, gloves, a watering hose, fertilizer and new boots.

loans.name: Faaululuga

texts.en: Faaululuga is a 37-year-old, married woman with two children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Faaululuga needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a deep freezer, foam cups and Chinese lollies. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faaululuga has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a cooler, a freezer, foam cups and Chinese lollies.

loans.name: Iuogafa

texts.en: Iuogafa is 36 years old and unmarried with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Iuogafa needs a loan to buy canned food, snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, a sack of onions, and bags of flour and sugar. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy canned food, snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, a sack of onions, and bags of flour and sugar

loans.name: Bucia Papa Group

texts.en:
Faustina is a member and a leader of Bucia Papa Group. Faustina is married with seven children ages 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4. She has been a cocoa farmer for the past 10 years. She also sells foodstuffs to support her family. 

Faustina and her group members were among the participants who took part in a community exposure workshop on indoor/outdoor air pollution, deforestation and climate change presented by the field partner. She and her group members have decided to buy ELSA clean cook stoves to improve their quality of lives in the kitchen and within their community. For fuel, they have virgin pellets (palm kernel shells) as by-products of the oil processors within their community. Because ELSA clean cook stoves use virgin pellet as fuel, Faustina and her group members will be able to manage the waste within the community during stove use.

Faustina needs a micro loan of GHS 170 to acquire an ELSA clean cook stove to improve her cooking and save her from long hours spent fetching firewood from the forest which has been hard to find of late due to depletion of the forest. Faustina is grateful to all her micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Cook And Live Group

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and has been a cocoa and cassava farmer for the past 20 years. She is married with six children, ages 5 to 30.  She also operates a mini restaurant "chop bar" in her community. Victoria is a group leader of Cook and Live Group of Gold Coast Camp of Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. The entire group members have resolved to use the ELSA clean cook stove after receiving a community education on clean cooking, reduction of indoor/outdoor air pollution and reduction of deforestation and climate change.

Victoria and her group members need GHS 170 each to buy their ELSA clean cook stoves to improve their way of cooking. Victoria thanks all her micro lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Menakabala

texts.en:
30-year-old Menakabala is a homemaker who lives in a small village in Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri district with her husband and three children.  They live in a small mud house.

Menakabala’s husband, 35-year-old Bappa, is a cycle-van puller. A cycle-van is a very common vehicle widely used in rural areas of India to carry loads and people. He puts in a lot of hard labor and time in his business, but the profit is low.  Now he wants to generate more income for his family. He is thinking of buying a new cycle van for additional income. He will rent the old one to others.

Menakabala is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to help her husband to purchase a cycle-van. It will help them to generate more income.  With the profit from the business, they are thinking of constructing a concrete house. 

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for used bags and used clothes

loans.name: Egyani Group

texts.en:
Adizah is a member of Egyani Group. All the group members reside with their families within Cold Coast Camp in Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. Adizah is 39 years old and married with six children. The children are 6, 9, 12, 14, 17 and 21 years old. She has been a cassava farmer for one year. Adizah processes palm oil to earn income to support her family. Adizah and her group members have decided to buy ELSA clean cook stoves that uses virgin pellets (palm kernel shells) as fuel. Adizah is happy because virgin pellets are a by-product of her oil processing and the ELSA stove will improve the indoor air quality for her family. 

ELSA clean cook stoves have been developed under research by the African Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) Science and Technology Programme and co-financed by the European Union under BeBi Project to reduce indoor/outdoor air pollution and reduce deforestation.


Adizah is requesting a loan of GHS 170 to purchase an ELSA clean cook stove to reduce her exposure to excessive much heat and smoke in her kitchen from the use of a 3 stone stove with firewood that often makes her sick. Adizah will also save the money she had been spending on buying firewood for cooking for her household. She is thankful to all her micro lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en: Tolotea is a 27-year-old, divorced woman with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. Tolotea needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, crops, a spade, a tiller, a wheelbarrow and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Tolotea will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, boots, crops, a spade, a tiller, a wheelbarrow and new overalls.

loans.name: Asofou

texts.en: Asofou is 58 years old and single with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Asofou needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, crops, new overalls, a tiller, a wheelbarrow and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Asofou will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, crops, new overalls, a tiller, a wheelbarrow and new boots.

loans.name: Tooa

texts.en: Tooa is 40 years old and unmarried with nine children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Tooa needs a loan to buy chemicals, new boots, a machete, a crowbar, fertilizer, crops, a tiller and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Tooa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, boots, a machete, a crowbar, fertilizer, a tiller and a spade.

loans.name: Fiapule

texts.en: Fiapule is a 49-year-old, widow with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Fiapule needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, new boots, a machete, crops and a new tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Fiapule will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, boots, a machete, crops and a new tiller.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Memuna, and she is single. In 2007, Memuna established her bags of rice business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of her family. Her business is located in city centre and her main customers are of all ages. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Memuna would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Memuna requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice. She hopes that this loan will improve her business by getting more customers and sales. In the future, Memuna plans to improve her business and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bags of rice

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is married with three children. After sitting at home alone and also wanting to help her husband with the household finances, she decided to open up a small corner shop in her neighborhood and has been running her business for 11 years. A friend introduced her to the Tupperware line so she became a salesperson, bought some product and started selling. 

With this loan she would like to increase her profits by adding a larger variety of Tupperware products to sell. Her goal is also to support her children when they study at university.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Zeynep Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Evde boş oturmakdan sıkıldığından ve eşine ev ekonomisinde yardımcı olabilmek için mahallesinde küçük bir bakkal dükkanı açıp işletmeye başlıyor.  Onbir yıldır bakkal dükkanını işletiyor.  Tuppwer ürünleri ile bir arkadaşın vasıtası ile tanışmış.  Üye olmuş hem kendine ürün almaya hem de çevresine satış yapmaya başlamış.  Aldığı kredi ile tuppwer den ürün çekip ,siparişlerini alacak.  Bu kredi ile satışının artacağını düşünüyor.
Çocuklarını üniversitede okutup birer meslek sahibi yapmayı düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products

loans.name: Manika

texts.en:
Manika hails from Maynaguri.  She is an energetic and hardworking woman of 36 years. She has a secondary education. She is a woman with a great mind and good soul. She is the thoughtful mother of two children who are students in grades 10 and 3.  Manika lives in the small village of Anandanagar in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Manika’s husband, 51-year-old Shyamal, is a worker at a small tea garden.  His scant income is insufficient for the family.  Manika always strives to provide her children with all things necessary. She dreams that her children will receive a higher education.

Manika is associated with the readymade garment business. She purchases varieties of ladies garments from the wholesale market and sells them in her locality. She sells clothing like saris, petticoats, blouses etc.  She has been working with this business for many years and has long experience in this area of business.  Now, with the growing demands of her valuable customers, she wants to expand her business.

She would like to renew her assortment of goods and with this aim, she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase women's clothing for the new season. As the festival season is knocking at the door, she needs more garments in stock for her customers. She hopes the expansion of her business will earn more profit to provide her family with financial sustenance. She wants to get ahead with the business for a secure future.

She is thankful for her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her clothing business.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is Salamatu who was married. In 1997, Salamatu established her yam, pineapple, orange and plantain business. She began her business because she wanted to live a responsible life and to help her husband. Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are adults. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,097,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Salamatu would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy large quantities of yams. She hopes that this loan will improve her business and generate more income. In the future, Salamatu plans to own a plot of land wherein she will grow her own plantation. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for yams

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is 50 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Aliitasi needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Aliitasi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and a mother of three children. They live in a four room house in Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has suffered the death of a daughter, her sister and father, as well as sickness in her family.

With the new loan requested, Elizabeth will buy crayfish in bags, also buy egusi in bulk for retail as well as sell in bags to other market women.  This activity will help the community in that egusi and crayfish will be available for the population at all times.

loans.use: to buy egusi and crayfish

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is forty eight years old and married with two children who are in school.  Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Jocelyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jocelyn has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jocelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home, which was destroyed by super typhoon Kaiyan

loans.name: Sarata

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Sarata, and she is married. In 2002, Sarata established her cotton, gara lappa (wraparound skirt), and bamako dress business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of her family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Sarata would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Sarata requires a loan in order to buy additional bamako, cotton and gara lappa. She hopes that this loan improves her business by getting more customers and sales. In the future, Sarata plans to become involved in an import and export business and earn more profits. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bamako, cotton and gara lappa

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a conservative lady, so she asked her son to take her place in the photo. Nadia is a 50-year-old, married lady living in Irbid, Jordan, with her family that consists of five children. One of her sons is a university student majoring in Science and Chemistry, and he is in his second year. Her son's aim is to work in his field after getting his Bachelors Degree, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, Nadia has applied for this loan to support him.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a conservative lady, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.  Sameera is a 54-year-old married lady living in Irbid, Jordan, with her family that consists of six members.  One of her daughters is a university student majoring in Statistics, and is in her third year. Her daughter's aim is to work in her field after getting her Bachelors Degree, but she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, Sameera has applied for this loan to support her.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jerill Hasael

texts.es: Jerilll es un joven de 22 años de edad y padre un pequeño niño, Jerill se siente muy orgulloso de él mismo ya que ha podido lograr unos de sus sueños el cual es establecer su propio negocio. Gracias a una pequeña ayuda de su familia logro dar inicios y mantenerlo en crecimiento constante. Es por tal razón que él solicita un préstamo para la compra de nuevos productos como camisetas, pantalones y zapatos que le servirán para diversificar y obtener más ganancias en las ventas y de esta manera invertirlo en la educación de su hijo y de igual forma en su negocio. Sus principales metas son tener un inventario más amplio para ofrecer más productos tanto a sus clientes actuales como nuevos. Entre sus planes futuros están la construcción de nuevas tiendas en otros departamentos del país.
texts.en:
Jerill is 22 years old and the father of a young child.  Jerill is very proud of himself since he has been able to achieve one of his dreams by opening his own business.  Thanks to help from his family, he was able to start his business and keep it growing constantly.  

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase new products including shirts, pants, and shoes.  This will allow him to diversify and obtain more profits from his sales.  He can invest this in his child's education and his business.  His main goals are to have an expanded inventory to offer more products to his current customers and new ones.  His future plans include building new stores in other departments of the country.

loans.use: to purchase new products including shirts, pants, and shoes.

loans.name: Senitima

texts.en: Senitima is a 69-year-old widow with 6 children. For the past 11 years, she has had a small stall selling coconuts in her community or at the market. Senitima needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a tiller, a spade and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Senitima will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a tiller, a spade and new boots

loans.name: Holman Francisco

texts.es:
Con el semblante y la ropa lleno de aceite mecánico, sinónimo de un arduo trabajo, te recibe Holman en su pequeño taller mecánico. Es un joven trabajador y emprendedor de 22 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. Puesto que la economía familiar no prestaba las condiciones para que él se preparara en el nivel superior académico, busco otra alternativa para ser un soporte económico en su familia y la mecánica fue la mejor solución. Inició en el negocio trabajando con su hermano, poco a poco fue ahorrando para comprar herramientas y así poder independizarse y establecer su propio taller. 
Holman solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar herramientas tales como, llaves, tuercas, desatornilladores, gatos de piso, cajas y gabinetes para herramientas, soporte para autos, aceite mecánico, entre otros. Estima que con el financiamiento logrará cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo aumentar sus ingresos. Espera que su negocio siga en auge y tener la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y brindarle a su familia salud y educación de calidad. Una de sus metas establecer un negocio más grande, su esposa y su hermano lo motivan para que su sueño se haga realidad.
texts.en:
With the face and clothes stained with motor oil—synonymous with hard work—Holman welcomes you to his small auto repair shop. He is a hard-working and enterprising young man. He is 22 years old, married, and has a three-year-old son. Since the family’s finances did not provide him with the adequate conditions to pursue higher education, he looked for an alternative to provide financial support to his family and found that becoming a mechanic was the best solution. He started out in the business working with his brother. Little by little he started to save to purchase tools and, in this way, be able to become independent and have his own auto repair shop.

Holman is requesting a loan to increase his working capital. He needs to purchase tools such as wrenches, nuts, screwdrivers, floor jacks, toolboxes and tool cabinets, jack stands, and motor oil, among others. He thinks that with the loan he will be able to meet his customers’ demand and, at the same time, increase his income. He hopes that his business continues to grow, that he has the opportunity to improve his living conditions, and that he provides his family with a healthy lifestyle and quality education. 

One of his goals is to establish a larger business. His wife and his brother encourage him so that his dream becomes a reality.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as wrenches, nuts, screwdrivers, floor jacks, toolboxes and tool cabinets, jack stands, and motor oil, among others, for his business.

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en: Pamata, 49 years old, is married and has 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 8 years. Pamata needs a loan to buy a machete, a spade, a rake, chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Pamata will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a machete, a spade, a rake, chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Ana Iris

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella vive con su madre y una hermana. 

Desde hace 3 años, Ana se dedica al negocio de pupusas y lo aprendió de su madre, además hace refrescos, minutas y yuca frita, el trabajo lo realiza en casa y se involucra su madre y la hermana, su horario de trabajo es de 4:00 pm a 7:00 ya que a esa hora es cuando más se venden las pupusas. 

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar sillas y materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas y así ampliar su negocio, ya que podrá ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes y cubrir la demanda de pupusas. 

Su sueño es que su negocio se fortalezca con el tiempo, además desea pagar el crédito con ningún problema para tener las puertas abiertas de esta institución.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old.  She studied through ninth grade.  She has a three year old child and is a single mother.  She lives with her mother and sister.

For three years, Ana has worked making pupusas.  She learned how to make them from her mother.  She also offers drinks, snacks, and fried yucca.  She does this work from her home with her mother and sister.  She works from 4:00pm until 7:00pm since that is the time when the most pupusas are sold.

She needs this loan to purchase chairs and ingredients to make pupusas so that she can expand her business.  She will be able to make her customers more comfortable and cover the demand for pupusas.  

Her dream is that her business strengthens with time and she hopes to repay her loan without a problem so that she has an open door at the institution.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Lemoe

texts.en: Lemoe, 38 years old, is married and has one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Lemoe needs a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, new boots and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Lemoe will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, new boots and crops

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en: Ma. Cecilia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 15 years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as gasoline, fishing nets, wood, etc. In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as gasoline, fishing nets, wood, etc.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 45 years old with seven children, four of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Roberta has borrowed and paid off 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from other work.

Roberta aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, 31 years old, is married and has five children, four of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Arlene has operated  a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 39 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Emilda has borrowed and paid off 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. Juanita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Juanita has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 55 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like spices, coffee, dried fish, chips, etc. Leonida has been in this business for 15 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like spices, coffee, dried fish, chips, etc.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 29 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Lida has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Lida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Ermera. She is married and has 2 children. Flora has been involved in business activities since 2012, having started with her own working capital of $500. Her husband is a carpenter. Flora is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies including wooden beams, wooden boards, a drilling machine, a chisel and other materials. 

Flora is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can expand her business in the future and her income can increase. Flora keeps animals, such as pigs and chickens, at her home.

loans.use: to buy wooden beams, wooden boards, a drilling machine, a chisel and other materials.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta 7° grado, ahora está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 2 hijos, el hijo mayor estudia en la Universidad y el menor estudia 9° grado, sus hijos y su esposa dependen de él.

Demetrio es taxista desde hace 15 años, además se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería los fines de semana; su horario de trabajo generalmente es de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm y es su esposa quien le ayuda en el cuido del ganado.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar material de estudio para su hijo ya que estudia Ingeniería y necesita comprar libros y herramientas para la materia de topografía.

Su sueño es que sus dos hijos se gradúen de una carrera universitaria, también desea comprar más ganado y así tener más ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Demetrio is 54 years old and studied through 7th grade. He is currently married, and his wife performs household chores. He has two sons: his oldest son is in college and his youngest son is in 9th grade. His children and his wife depend on him.

Demetrio has been a taxi driver for the past 15 years. In addition, he works in agriculture and livestock on the weekends. His work schedule is generally from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm, and his wife helps him care for the livestock.

He needs a loan to buy study materials for this son, who is studying engineering and needs to buy books and tools for his topography course. 

His dream is for his two sons to graduate from college. He also wishes to buy more livestock in order to earn a higher income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy study materials for this son, who is studying engineering and needs to buy books and tools for his topography course.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school, She works very hard to provide for them. 

For the past seven years, Nida has run a general store in the Philippines; she is now requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell including soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn works hard to support her family. Renalyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Renalyn has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Hari Om Shg Group

texts.en:
This group, called "Hari Om Shg", consists of 10 ladies who live in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha, India. The group has applied for a loan of 150,000 INR from People's Forum (Kiva's Partner). All the members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities like animal raising, vegetable selling, milk selling etc. 

Pakama, a 45-year-old married mother with one child, has been working as a vendor selling fish and other foods such as items made of milk. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in order to increase her profit and raise her child well. She, along with her group, has requested this loan and she will use her portion to purchase more fish and other food (milk). Pakama hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family. She, along with her group members, are very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and milk for her food business.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, está casada y su esposo es albañil, tienen 4 hijos los mayores trabajan en los mercados y los menores estudian 5°grado y kínder, con su esposo son los encargados de mantener a la familia.  

Desde hace 12 años, María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un local en el mercado, anteriormente a esto trabajaba en sastrería en su casa, ella viaja todos los días y se va en bus, su horario es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm.

María necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar un vehículo ya que su hijo cuenta con una parte del dinero y necesita complementar el monto; necesita del vehículo con el fin de traer mercadería desde otra ciudad, así ya no tendrá que hacerlo en bus y no correrá el riesgo de que le roben sus productos. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia, que sus hijos sigan estudiando y en un futuro tener un local propio en el mercado ya que por el momento es alquilado.
texts.en:
43-year-old María studied up until the sixth grade. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. They have four children. Their grown-up children work in the markets and the younger children are in fifth grade and kindergarten. She and her husband are responsible for looking after the family.

For 12 years, María has made a living by selling fruit and vegetables at a stall in the market. She previously worked as a seamstress from home. She travels every day by bus and works from 6:00am to 5:00pm.

María needs this loan a lot in order to purchase a vehicle, since her son has some of the money [for the vehicle] and she needs to add to this amount. She needs the vehicle to bring merchandise in from another city, so she does not have to do it by bus and run the risk of her products being stolen.
