Her dreams are: to continue working to support her family, that her children continue studying, and to have her own stall in the market in the future since at the moment she rents one.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle, since her son already has some of the money for it and she needs to top up this amount

loans.name: Carlos Gilbel

texts.es:
Carlos, ha mejorado su negocio con la ayuda del crédito anterior,  comenta que tuvo una cosecha muy abundante, mejores ingresos y la oportunidad de cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia por una más digno.
Carlos se mantiene motivado en seguir trabajando con créditos para mantener su negocio  funcionando, por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y semilla, le será de utilidad para eliminar la maleza y proteger el cultivo de plagas.
texts.en:
Carlos has improved his business with the help of the previous loan. He says that he had a very abundant harvest, greater revenue, and the opportunity to change his family’s lifestyle for the better.

Carlos is still motivated to keep working with loans in order to keep his business working, which is why he is requesting another loan for purchasing compost, insecticides, and seeds. This will be useful for getting rid of weeds and protecting his crops from pests.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and seeds, which will be useful for getting rid of weeds and protecting his crops from pests.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Francis Danielka

texts.es: Francis a sus 23 años de edad ya posee su propio negocio, que todo empezó cuando su padre le otorgo cierta cantidad de dinero para que diera a inicio a un negocio del cual se lucrara para poder costear sus estudios y lograse salir adelante con su propio esfuerzo actualmente los ingresos de su negocio no le dan para la adquisición de una computadora es por tal motivo que ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de dicha computadora que le permitirá tener mejor orden con los trabajos asignados en sus clases. Sus principales metas son terminar con éxito su carrera. Entre sus planes futuros están la apertura de un nuevo negocio ya que le ha gustado mucho el mundo empresarial.
texts.en:
Francis, at 23 years of age, already has her own business. Everything started when her father gave her a certain amount of money to begin a business in order to earn an income to fund her education and move forward as a result of her own effort.

Currently, the earnings from her business are not enough for her to purchase a computer. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan to buy a computer, which will allow her to organize the work that is assigned for her classes better. 

Her primary goal is to finish her degree successfully. Among her future plans, she hopes to open a new business, since she really likes the business world.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina is married and she has 4 children. She is a business woman and is requesting a loan to buy additional supplies to sell in her store, including sugar, candies, cooking oils, biscuits, noodles, aqua and other things including soft drinks and hard drinks. She has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of $500. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to open a big store in the future. She is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, candies, cooking oils, biscuits, noodles, aqua and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Kenia Yuniet

texts.es: Kenia es madre de 2 hijos que aún está a su cargo y con solo 23 años de edad formo su propio negocio hace dos años con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos. Kenia anhela construir un local para atender a todos sus clientes con más comodidad y excelente servicio ya que actualmente los atiende en la sala de su casa pero para hacer realidad este sueño ella solicita un préstamo para comprar una plancha y secadora para cabello con las cuales estima que podrá obtener más ganancias las cuales le servirán para adquirir nuevos productos de belleza y al mismo tiempo abrir una cuenta de ahorro que le servirá para lograr sus sueños. Entre sus planes a futuro están en la apertura de un nuevo salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Kenia is a mother with two children under her care. At only 23 years old she formed her own company to years ago which has allowed her to raise her small children.

Kenia hopes to construct a shop to take care of all her clients more comfortably with excellent service. She currently uses a room in her house to serve them. To make this dream a reality she is requesting a loan to buy an iron and a dryer for hair with which she hopes to make more income which will help her acquire new beauty products. At the same time she wants to open a savings account that will help her achieve her dreams. Amongst her plans for the future is opening a new beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy an iron and dryer for hair.

loans.name: Jay Sibasambhu Shg Group

texts.en:
Sakuna belongs to a small village in the Koraput district, which is located in the forest area of Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady seated first from the right-hand side is Sakuna. She is 28 years old and alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture. She has been in business for years, and things have gone well for her because of the hard work she does. Sakuna is responsible and persevering, and sells her goods to customers who request them. Her aim is to continue working to get ahead. 

Sakuna, along with her group, is requesting this loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland. All the members of this "Jay Sibasambhu Shg" group are women. The other members are involved in the sale of vegetables, food and drink, agricultural services, fruit and vegetable cultivation, and raising small animals. Sakuna is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a vigorous, obliging and hardworking woman. She is 19 years old, married, and a mother of a lovely son.  She is married to Pradip, 29 years old.  She attended school up to the 10th standard and could not go for higher studies due to the lack of financial resources of her parents.

Some years ago, Kalpana and her husband began working in the area of tailoring, making a variety of clothing, providing clothing services to customers directly. Their neighbors are their main customers. She learned the craft through experience, and works with the help of her husband every day, generating sufficient resources to support her family.

Currently, she is motivated to ask for this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another sewing machine in order to grow her business to satisfy customer demand and to generate more income for her family. The festival season is arriving so they are expecting more orders from their customers. With this new machine, she will be able to greatly enhance the work and get ahead in her job.

Kalpana shows that she intends to continue putting a lot of effort into her work. Thus, she wants to expand her business and guarantee economic stability to give her family a better quality of life.  

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo, dos hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, su principal objetivo es cuidar de su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar; desde hace cinco años tiene una venta de tortillas, trabaja de las cinco de la mañana a dos de la tarde, está actividad aprendió a desempeñarla dentro de su familia, por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
Invertirá en la compra de maíz en mayor cantidad, pretende ahorrar en la compra y aumentar el margen de ganancias, Ana busca aumentar la productividad, ventas y oportunidades de progreso para su negocio.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio para tener una fuente de ingresos estable, permitiéndole sacar adelante a su familia, dar a sus hijos apoyo para que se superen académicamente y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and two children ages 15 and 8. Her primary goal is to take care of her family and support her husband with the household expenses. She has had a business selling tortillas for 5 years. She works from 5 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. She learned how to make tortillas from family members and her business is going well at this moment.

She will invest in buying corn at wholesale, to save money buying corn and increase the margins of her earnings. Ana looks to increase her productivity, sales, and opportunities to grow her business. Her aspirations are to expand her business in order to have a stable source of income, enabling her to help her family move forward into the future, giving her children the education they deserve, and paying her debts.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Jay Bajarangabali Shg Group

texts.en: Gouri is 23 years old, married and has one son.  She lives with her husband in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. In the photo, the lady seated second from the left-hand side is Gouri. She has been earning a living through cultivating vegetables for four years. The current business earns her about 4,000 INR per month to meet the family’s needs. Now Gouri is leading her group called "Jay Bajarangabali Shg" to ask for a loan. Gouri is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and to buy goats to raise. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to improve her living conditions. She is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and to buy goats to raise

loans.name: Jay Maa Shg Group

texts.en:
Piar, about 48 years old, is the group leader for the 10 members of the group "Jay Maa SHG" in the Koraput district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of three members, herself and two children. The member standing in the middle in the first row is Piar. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She has been running a grocery/general store in her village for the last six years. 

Piar, along with the other nine members from her village, formed a group and it is the first time they will take out a loan from People's Forum for the development of their existing businesses. At present, her family income is about Rs. 6,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan. With the loan, she will use her portion to purchase toothpaste, shampoo, detergent, soap, rice, edible oil, biscuits, sugar, etc, as general household items for resale. She has a dream of building a house for her family. She is excited to have this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, shampoo, detergent, soap, rice, edible oil, biscuits and sugar for resale

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan es un señor de 56 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos a cargo. Juan se siente muy agradecido y contento con su primer préstamo obtenido en KIVA-MiCrédito con el cual pudo cultivar más y obtener un poco más de ganancias de igual manera lo utilizo para la compra de comida para el ganado como gallinaza y melaza. Hoy día Juan solicita un nuevo préstamo para cultivar sorgo y para la alimentación de su ganado. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda porque así garantiza el crecimiento de su cultivo y el cuido de sus animales. Juan espera seguir obteniendo este apoyo de financiamiento para poder seguir creciendo junto con MiCrédito.
texts.en: Juan is 56 years old, married, and has three children in his care. Juan is very thankful and content for his first loan through KIVA-MiCrédito with which he was able to grow more crops and obtain greater earnings. He used it to buy food for his cattle. Today Juan seeks a new loan to plan sorghum and feed for his cattle. He shares that the loan he seeks will be very helpful because it will guarantee his crop's growth and care of his animals. Juan hopes to continue having this financial support in order to continue growing along with MiCrédito.

loans.use: to plant sorghum and feed his cattle.

loans.name: Jesús Arsenio

texts.es:
Jesús de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado en la escuela de su comunidad, no pudo seguir estudiando por la forma de pensar de sus padres y porque debía trabajar para llevar ingresos al hogar, ahora está acompañado su pareja  se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos que van a la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de Jesús.

Jesús es empleado, trabaja como vigilante en una tienda, a los 16 años entró al cuartel donde se formó como militar, años más tarde se retiró y decidió trabajar como civil, adquiriendo así su empleo de seguridad, actividad que realiza desde hace dos años y medio, antes de ser empleado se dedicaba a la agricultura. La distancia que recorre hacia su trabajo es de unos 10 km, una parte lo recorre en bicicleta y la otra en bus, su horario de trabajo es de las 7:00 am a 5:00 pm.
 

Él necesita este préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, herbicidas, además pagará la mano de obra para sembrar maíz, frijol y arroz, de esta forma podrá asegurar la alimentación de su familia.

Sus sueños son que su familia viva más cómoda, espera apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que se preparen y tengan un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 38 years old and studied up to Grade 4 in his local school. He couldn't continue to study as his parent thought that he should be working to bring income into the household. Now he is in a relationship and his partner does housework He has three children who go to school and they are the only ones dependent on Jesús. Jesús is an employee working as a security guard in a store. He entered the army at 16 years old where he trained to be in the military.

Years later he retired and decided to work as a civilian acquiring his employment as security. He has been doing this for two and a half years. Before that he worked in agriculture. He travels 10 km to get to his work, part of it on bike and part by bus. He works from 7 am until 5 pm.

He needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer and herbicide and pay for labor to grow corn, beans and rice. In this way he can ensure food for his family. His dream is that his family lives more comfortably and that he can support his children in their studies so that they are well prepared and get good work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for labor to grow corn, beans and rice.

loans.name: Adriana Auxiliadora

texts.es: Adriana es una señora de 44 años de edad, madre de tres hijos que le ayudan en las labores de la casa. Su mundo de negocio lo inicio cuando tenía 19 años cuando tenía una  pequeña pulpería que con los años la surtió de una gran variedad de productos pero luego de haber pasado por una separación con esposo el negocio decayó. Pero sueños no quedaron ahí y a uno años más tarde tomo la decisión de emprender otro tipo de negocio el de vender ropa en el mercado local de su comunidad. Adriana solicita un préstamo para la comprar más productos como camisas, blusas, pantalones, shorts entre otros productos. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de gran ayuda porque obtendrá más ganancias. Sus planes futuros son agrandar más su negocio.
texts.en: Adriana is 44 years old, mother of three children who help with the household chores. She began her business when she was 19 years old with a small convenience store that over the years she stocked with a wide variety of products but later upon separating from her husband the business declined.  But her dreams didn't stop there and one year later she made the decision to start another kind of business, this one selling clothing in the local market in her community. Adriana seeks a loan to buy more products such as shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, and other clothing. She states the loan will be a great help because it will bring additional income. Her plans for the future are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, shorts and other clothing.

loans.name: Bhanjani Shg Group

texts.en:
Sunita is a 27-year-old woman who is married and has two children; both her children are in school. She lives in a small village in Odisha, India. Sunita produces and sells vegetables in the community where she lives. She learned this line of work from her parents who dedicated themselves to this trade for many years. Sunita’s work enables her to generate the necessary income for sustaining her family. She says that she enjoys her work because it is honest labor and it helps her feel useful in her community. Sunita has more than seven years of experience in this trade. She decided to organize a group so that she and her fellow group members could help one another and improve their standard of living. 

Sunita will use her loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and to pay for labor so that she can maintain her vegetable plants. She dreams of increasing her vegetable cultivation so that she can improve her income. She and her group members are happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay labor charges for her cropland.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 19 years old, single and a third year Criminology student. Her parents are farmers and sometimes raise hogs for additional income. Unfortunately, they have insufficient funds to pay her tuition fees on time. That is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay tuition fees for school.

Mary Grace hopes to finish her education and seek a good paying job that will help lift her family out of poverty. She is very positive that lenders will approve her loan request.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for school

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 37 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for two years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es:
Adelayda es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la producción y venta de queso artesanal.
Ella es emprendedora, buena oyente, solidaria, Fuerte, luchadora, orgullosa de lo suyo, Alegre, optimista, feliz, espontánea, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad  ‘Huayrocondo’ de la provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a 55 Kilómetros de esta ciudad, sobre la carretera de Pucarani Batallas. La alimentación del ganado limita severamente la producción láctea, ya que en esta zona se dispone generalmente de tres fuentes de alimentación; los pastos nativos donde se incluyen los llamados llachales o parcelas acuáticas, los cultivos introducidos; avena, cebada, trébol blanco, etc. y por último los rastrojos de cosecha; quinua, papa, haba, cañahua, etc. Estas rastrojeras o restos de cosecha se constituyen en suplementos de menor costo y que pueden ofrecer al animal los nutrientes para ellos exigidos a fin de satisfacer sus diversas funciones fisiológicas de producción y reproducción. 
Adelayda es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, su vestimenta es típica (manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymará y utiliza el español según sus necesidades de comercio. Su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal, su granja cuenta con cuatro cabezas de ganado vacuno, dos son de raza mejorada y dos son criollos, ella obtiene de una cabeza de raza mejorada de seis a ocho litros diarios de leche y de raza criolla obtiene de dos a cuatro litros diarios. Al poseer más cabezas de ganado vacuno de raza mejorada su producción de leche se incrementa, lo que hace que puedan vender más leche, o destinar un mayor porcentaje para su autoconsumo que lo utiliza para la producción de derivados de la leche (elaboración de quesos y yogurt casero).
Es por esos motivos que Adelayda solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero mejorado, y con los beneficios mejorar su producción lechera.
texts.en:
Adelayda is a 25-year-old woman. She is single, has no children, and has a business producing and selling artisan cheese. She is enterprising, a good listener, supportive, strong, determined, proud, cheerful, optimistic, happy, spontaneous, responsible, committed to her work, and very hard-working with a good attitude. She does her work in the ‘Huayrocondo’ community in the province of Los Andes, in the province of La Paz. It is 55 kilometers away from the city of La Paz by the Pucarani Batallas highway. The herd’s diet severely limits milk production, since in this area there are generally three sources of food available: the native pastures, including the so-called “llachales” or aquatic vegetation areas; the introduced crops, such as oats, barley, and white clover; and lastly the stubble from harvesting the crops, such as quinoa, potatoes, broad beans, and cañahua [similar to quinoa]. These stubble fields or crop residue constitute a cheap food supplement for the animals, providing the nutrients they need for their various physiological functions of production and reproduction.

Adelayda has a tanned complexion and long, black, braided hair, and she dresses traditionally (poncho and full, gathered skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara and she uses Spanish according to the needs of her business. Her business is producing artisan cheese. Her farm has four head of cattle; two are improved breeds of cows and two are of Criollo breed. She gets six to eight litres of milk a day from a cow from an improved breed, and two to four litres of milk a day from a cow from the Criollo breed. By having more improved-breed cows, her milk production increases, which means she can sell more milk or use a greater percentage for her own consumption than for producing dairy products (making cheeses and home-made yoghurt).

It is for these reasons that Adelayda is requesting a loan for purchasing improved-breed dairy cows in order to improve her milk production.

loans.use: to buy improved-breed dairy cattle in order to improve her milk production

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en:
Otilia works hard to support her family. Otilia is married and has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Otilia has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Otilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luisa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling pearls in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. Luisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional cultured pearls to sell.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Delia has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en: Florinda lives in Ermera and she is a businesswoman. She has been involving in business activities since 2005. She started with her own working capital of $400. She has a kiosk in her house, so she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sugar, candies, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles, aqua, milk, cigarettes, detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin, which will give her more working capital to buy more goods. She wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, candies, cooking oil, biscuits,  noodles, milk, cigarettes, detergent and other things to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 37 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Shirley has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transportation and from doing manicures and pedicures.

Shirley aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa is a 32-year-old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Alofa needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, cooking oil, a new oven and a strainer. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Alofa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, cooking oil, a new oven and a strainer

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsevelmaa, 52 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a seller at a grocery store since 2008. Her husband works as a sentry for a newspaper company. Their daughter works for a private firm as an accountant. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to open a cafeteria. The loan will be used for paying rent, and buying raw materials and cooking tools. If her new business succeeds, it will be a major contributor for her family's future well-being.

loans.use: to open a cafeteria in order to improve her family's living standard

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

Edna has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 5 years and also earns an income from her general store.

Cecilia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Feagaimaalii

texts.en: Feagaimaalii is 26 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Feagaimaalii needs a loan to buy fertilizer, crops, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a tiller and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Feagaimaalii will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, crops, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a tiller and new overalls.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maribel has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Edelrida

texts.en:
Edelrida is 53 years old and married with three children. For the past five years she has operated a sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines. She also earns an income selling fish.

In the past Edelrida borrowed and successfully repaid 23 loans through NWTF. She has now applied for a 13,000 loan PHP loan to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar and coffee.

Edelrida is working hard to improve her shop bit by bit. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her shop

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga works hard to support her family. Dominga is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy materials like fishing nets, gasoline, etc.

Dominga has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Dominga would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing nets, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Marleny Antonia

texts.es:
Marleny, utilizo el préstamo anterior para mejorar la alimentación de los pollos de la  granja y de los cerdos, logro aumentar la rentabilidad, ha comprado muebles para su hogar, su situación financiera es favorable y cancelo las cuotas de la deuda con responsabilidad.
Por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al invertir créditos en su negocio, nuevamente opta por solicitar más capital para comprar insumos agrícolas, para cultivar granos básicos, con la cosecha mejorara la alimentación de su familia y tendrá ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Marleny used her previous loan to improve the diet of her farm-raised chickens and pigs. She managed to increase the return on her investment; she bought furniture for her home; her financial situation is favourable, and she pays off her debts responsibly.

Because of the good results that she has obtained by investing loans in her business, she is electing once more to request more capital to purchase agricultural inputs to grow basic grains. With the harvest, her family’s diet will improve, and she will have extra income.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to grow basic grains. With the harvest, her family’s diet will improve, and she will have extra income.

loans.name: Ulemj

texts.en:
Ulemj, 23, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been playing basketball professionally since 2008. He also operates a kindergarten with his wife, which they opened eight months ago.

The Mongolian winter is very harsh, so Ulemj wants to insulate his home. He is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan through Credit Mongol to buy vacuum-insulated windows. After he installs these, his home will no longer lose heat and instead conserve energy.

loans.use: to install vacuum-insulated windows in his home.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, obtuvo herramientas y materiales con el préstamo anterior,  que le han facilitado brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio, teniendo así una mejor condición económica con la que puede subsistir junto a su familia.
José se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar aceite, grasa, cables, luces, sensores,  etc., con los que atenderá muy bien las demandas de sus clientes y seguirá teniendo los ingresos que necesita para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, José obtained tools and materials that have helped him to offer better service to his customers, and thus he has a better economic condition with which he can subsist together with his family.

José finds himself in need of applying for a new loan to buy oil, grease, cables, lights, sensors, etc, with which he will tend very well to the requests of his customers and continue having income that he needs to fulfill his obligations.

loans.use: to buy oil, grease, cables, lights, sensors, etc., with which he will tend very well to the requests of his customers and will continue having income.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
Pinturas de labio, cremas corporales y tintes de cabello adornan la casa de Karla, una comerciante de cosméticos de hace quince años, cuando decidió emprender en su propio negocio siendo maestra de un colegio. A sus 49 años, es madre soltera de tres maravillosos hijos de las edades de 26, 18 y 15 años,  quienes sirven de apoyo en todas sus decisiones. Ella inició comprando pequeñas cantidades de ropa en el mercado para vender, luego agregó como su actividad principal actual, los cosméticos, los cuales tienen gran demanda en su trabajo. 
Actualmente está haciendo unas pasantías en una universidad, pues no quiere dejar atrás la enseñanza. Actividad que le sirve para sustentar los gastos del hogar y de su negocio. Karla quiere seguir creciendo y colocar más productos que le permitan aumentar sus clientes y sus ingresos. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar cremas corporales, perfumes y maquillaje de distintas marcas para ofrecer un servicio de calidad. En sus planes está agregar un apartamento en su casa para alquilar en un futuro y así poder tener una nueva fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lipsticks, body lotions, and hair dyes fill Karla's home. Fifteen years ago, she decided to open her own business as a cosmetics saleswoman in addition to her job as a high school teacher.  At age 49, she is a single mother of three marvelous children, ages 26, 18, and 15, who support her in all her decisions. She started out buying small amounts of clothing at the market to sell, and later transitioned to a main sales line in cosmetics, for which there is a high demand through her work as a teacher.  

Currently, she is enrolled in some training programs at a university, as she doesn't want to fall behind in her teaching, the activity that covers her household and business expenses. Karla wants to keep growing and stock up on more products that will allow her to increase her customer base and her income. That's the reason she is taking out a loan to use buying body lotion, perfumes, and makeup of various brands so that she can offer a quality selection. Her plans include adding an apartment to her house that she can rent out in the future, and thus establish another source of income.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, perfumes, and makeup.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn has been buying and selling charcoal for the past five years. She also earns extra income from a café. She has been sustaining her businesses through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF.

She is now applying for an 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She is working hard to steadily build her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new orange juice extractor and to also buy more merchandise and stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Hayam Group

texts.en:
Hayam is a group that applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders last year. All the members thank Kiva lenders for their first loan. 

Wafa is again the leader of the group. She applied for a first loan last year from Kiva lenders to purchase clothes and perfumes to sell door-to-door. Wafa is very thankful for Kiva lenders for her first loan that helped her very much in increasing her business. By that loan, the income from Wafa's business became increasingly more. 

Wafa has not yet completed the repayment of the installments of the first loan, but has applied for a concurrent loan of 40,000 Yemen rials (YER) from Kiva lenders to purchase many kinds of ready-made childrens' clothes to resell them to her customers for further expansion of her business. She hopes to be financed in this loan.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of ready-made childrens' clothes to resell them.

loans.name: Jared

texts.es: Jared tiene 40 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 12 años el cual es su motor que lo impulsa para seguir adelante y se sienta orgulloso de él. Jared inicio en el mundo de los negocios cuando trabajo en un taller de mantenimiento de computadora de un amigo cuando estudiaba, luego de haber terminado sus estudios con éxito y con un dinero ahorrado decidió aperturar su propio negocio de venta de productos de oficina. Jared se siente muy agradecido con Kiva-MiCrédito ya que ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio y surtirlo de productos. Actualmente Jared solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar un toner, papeles de tamaño carta y legal, lapiceros y marcadores para ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le ayudara a crecer su negocio para lograr convertirse en un micro empresario. Sus principales metas son comprar nuevos productos para surtir su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Jared is 40 years old. He is the father of a 12-year-old son, who is the driving force that motivates him to continue forward and feel proud of himself. Jared entered the world of business when he worked in the computer maintenance shop of a friend when he was in school. Then, after having finished his studies with success, and with the money he had saved, he decided to open his own business of selling office products. Jared feels very grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, since he has managed to get ahead with his business and stock it with products. Now Jared is applying for a new loan to purchase toner, letter and legal size paper, pens, and markers in order to offer more products to his customers. He judges that the loan he has applied for will help him to grow his business to become a micro-entrepreneur. His principal goals are to buy new products to stock his business and offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy toner, letter and legal size paper, pencils and markers

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en: Geralda is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is a businesswoman and she has a kiosk. She is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including noodles, perfume, coffee, cooking oils, detergents, slippers and other things to sell. She started her business in 2010 with her own working capital of $400. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to open a big store in the future. She hopes can improve her management to increase her income in the future. She also has animals like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy noodles, perfume, coffee, cooking oils, detergents, slippers and other things to sell.

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es:
María de  62 años de edad estudió hasta 5° grado de educación básica, tiene una hija que ya es mayor de ella a quien sacó adelante sola ya que ha sido madre soltera.

María tiene más de 30 años de experiencia en el comercio de mariscos, decidió dedicarse al negocio desde hace años para sacar adelante a su hija, la compra de los mariscos las realiza en su ciudad dos veces por semana y luego se traslada a su casa a refrigerar el producto y venderlo en su zona, ya que la venta la realiza casa por casa.     


Ella  está solicitando este préstamo para comprar mariscos para continuar con la venta, ya que su madre murió hace poco e incurrió en gastos, y por lo tanto ahora no tiene capital para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando y espera tener un negocio estable en el cual no tenga que caminar tanto para vender.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 62 years old, went to school through the 5th grade of basic education. She has a daughter who is already an adult whom she raised alone, since she has been a single mother.

Maria has more than 30 years of experience in selling seafood. She decided to work in this business years ago in order to raise her daughter. She buys seafood in her city two times a week and then goes to her house to refrigerate her products and sell them in her zone, since she makes her sales door to door.

She is applying for this loan to buy seafood to continue with her sales, since her mother died a little while ago and she incurred some expenses, and so now she doesn't have capital to continue investing in her business.

She dreams of continuing to work and hopes to have a stable business in which she will not have to walk so much to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy seafood in order to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Donis Luis

texts.es: Donis es un vendedor de videos juegos hace 5 años, gracias a Kiva-MiCrédito ha logrado mantener su negocio funcionando y con una amplia variedad de videos juegos para que los niños se entretengan. Donis se siente muy agradecidos con los préstamos otorgados. Actualmente él solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de PlayStation ya que es un producto muy demando por sus clientes. Estimando que el nuevo préstamo solicitado le rendirá los mismos frutos de seguir manteniendo su negocio y al mismo tiempo mejorara las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Donis has been a vendor of video games for 5 years. Thanks to Kiva and MiCredito, he has managed to keep his business functioning and have a wide variety of video games so that the children are entertained. Donis feels very grateful for the loans granted to him. Now he is applying for a new loan to purchase a PlayStation, since it is a product much requested by his customers. He judges that the new loan he has applied for will bear the same fruits for him of continuing to maintain his business and at the same time he will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a PlayStation

loans.name: José Martín

texts.es: José tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos por quienes lucha día a día para brindarle lo mejor, una buena educación que en un futuro será de mucha utilidad para que alcancen el éxito. José dio inicio a su actual negocio cuando a la edad de 20 de años se dedicó a múltiples negocio hasta que opto por consolidarse en una pulpería. Es por tal razón que él solicita un préstamo para comprar productos como azúcar, arroz, aceites, detergentes, dulces para los niños entre otros para tener una gran variedad de producto que ofrecerles a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su pulpería para obtener mayores ingresos. Sus principales planes a futuro son comprar una camioneta a medida que crezcan sus ventas y su negocio.
texts.en: José is 30 years old. He is married and has three children for whom he strives every day in order to offer them the best, a good education that in the future will be of great use so that they can achieve success. José started his present business when at the age of 20, he worked at multiple businesses until he decided to consolidate them into a grocery store. It is for such a reason that he is applying for a loan to purchase products such as sugar, rice, oils, detergents, and candies for children, among other items, in order to have a great variety of products to offer to his customers and in this way make his grocery store grow in order to obtain greater income. His principal plans for the future are to buy a truck as his sales and his business grow.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, rice, oils, detergents, and candy for children, among other items, to stock his store.

loans.name: Arsulita

texts.en:
Arsulita is 57 years old and married with six children, with one child in school. Arsulita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Arsulita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en:
Sifaga is a 57-year-old divorced woman with five children. She makes and sells ice blocks in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Sifaga needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy, and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sifaga has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy, and foam cups.

loans.name: María Ana Dilia

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, actualmente está felizmente casada y vive junto con su hija y una nieta. 

María se dedica al comercio de café orgánico con propiedades medicinales, ya tiene dos años en este negocio el cual lleva a cabo con su esposo e hija, anteriormente María se dedicaba a la venta de pupusas, pero en este nuevo negocio vieron una mejor oportunidad de salir adelante.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más café orgánico con propiedades medicinales, pues necesitan cubrir con la demanda que tienen de parte de los clientes.

María desea que siga creciendo su negocio de manera que puedan cubrir con toda la zona oriental del país.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old. She studied through high school, and is currently happily married. She lives together with her daughter and a granddaughter.

María earns her living selling organic coffee with medicinal properties. She has already been doing this business for two years, with her husband and daughter. 

Before, María earned a living selling pupusas (a fried tortilla filled with cheese and other ingredients), but this new business gives her a better opportunity to get ahead.

She needs the loan to buy more organic coffee with medicinal properties, as she needs to cover her customers' demand. María wants to continue growing her business so that it can cover the entire western zone of her country.

loans.use: to buy more organic coffee with medicinal properties to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza works hard to support her family. Eliza is married and has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines.

She requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to puchase additional materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc.

Eliza has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Eliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to puchase additional materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old and blessed with two children. She engages in selling snack foods and some grocery items within her community to generate additional income. She aims to improve this business and make it more profitable to help her husband in financing the education of her children and sustaining their necessities. 

Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail herself of additional capital of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more breads, candies, biscuits, cupcakes and chocolate to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will further improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more breads, candies, biscuits, cupcakes and chocolate to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycles that are no longer in use in a Chinese restaurant, fix them and sell them to earn extra income.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 39 years old and married with five children who are in school. Shiela works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Shiela has been in this business for eight years and also sells a variety of retail items. 

In the future, Shiela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anapenina

texts.en: Anapenina is a 28-year-old woman who is unmarried with two children. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn an income. She has been in this business for three years. Anapenina needs a loan to buy two new lawn mowers, spark plugs and new boots. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Anapenina joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy two new lawn mowers, spark plugs and new boots.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Gloria has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 26 años de edad, es un joven muy laborioso conocido en su comunidad por ser honesto y trabajador, desde los 16 años que termino de estudiar el bachillerato se ha dedicado a trabajar en una empresa que elabora bloques de cemento para construcción, ya que su familia es de escasos recursos y el trabajo que realiza sirve para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.    
 
Al tener casi 10 años de experiencia en trabajar en la elaboración de bloques de cemento, cuenta con la credibilidad  y confianza de sus jefes para dejarlo a cargo del trabajo. Ademas, de la construcción de bloques también se dedica en su tiempo libre a la agricultura, ya que cultiva 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz para el sustento de su familia.

Juan utilizará el préstamo  para  la compra de insumos agrícolas como: 1 saco de abono y herbicidas para sembrar frijol, ya que es la época apropiada para preparar la tierra.

En el futuro planea conformar una familia, pues no quiere dejar a sus hermanos desprotegidos y eso le detiene en la actualidad a casarse  y tener hijos, además quiere estudiar un técnico en diseño gráfico en el megatec.
texts.en:
Juan, 26 years old, is a very industrious young man known in his community for being honest and hardworking. He finished high school when he was 16, and has been working since then in a business that makes cement blocks for construction. 

His family has scarce resources, and the work he does helps to support his parents with household expenses.

Having nearly 10 years of experience working to make concrete blocks, he has the trust and confidence of his bosses to let him take charge of the work. In addition to building blocks, he also works in agriculture in his free time, growing 3,500 square meters of corn to sustain his family.

Juan will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs, such as one sack of compost, and herbicides to plant beans, as it's the appropriate season for preparing the land.

In the future, he plans to start a family. Currently, he doesn't want to leave his siblings vulnerable, and that stops him from marrying and having children. He also wants to study graphic design in technical school.

loans.use: to buy a sack of compost and herbicides to plant beans, as it's the appropriate season for preparing the land.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school, Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Catherine has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 64 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente casado y procreó 3 hijos que ya son independientes, Carlos vive solo con su esposa pero en ocasiones cuidan de sus nietos.


Carlos se dedica al comercio de artículos para el hogar, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, pero también aprovecha las temporadas de venta de útiles escolares ya que hay una escuela cerca de su vivienda, y en la tienda se incorpora su esposa.

El Préstamo será utilizado para comprar mercadería para su tienda.
Él sueña con ver a sus nietos crecer sanos y fuertes y que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Carlos is 64 years old and studied through high school. He's happily married and raised three children who are already independent. He lives alone with his wife, but occasionally takes care of his grandchildren.

Carlos earns a living selling household goods. He has a small store in his house, but also takes advantage of the season to sell school supplies, as there's a school close to his home. He includes his wife in the store.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for his store. He dreams of seeing his children grow healthy and strong, and that they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is 37 years old and has eight children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Chona has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Chona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en: Due to a lack of job opportunities, Jemalyn runs a small retail store within their community. She is 32 years old and blessed with one child. Together with her husband, they are aiming for a happy and successful life. They work hand in hand to generate income. Jemalyn wants to improve her store by increasing her product offerings. Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more snack foods, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, eggs, noodles, laundry soap, candies and soft drinks to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, eggs, noodles, laundry soap, candies and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is married and has four children. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy additional supplies to  keep in her store, including candies, cooking oil, biscuits, milk, noodles, candles, detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. She has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of $50. She's taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her income and she wants to open a big store in the future. She is happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. Genoveva also has animals in her house, like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy candies, cooking oil, biscuits,  milk,  noodles, candles, detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Norberto Alexander

texts.es:
Norberto de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato hace un año y medio. Se acompaño y junto a su pareja han procreado una hija que tiene un año con dos meses. Su compañera de vida se dedica a cuidar la niña, hacer los oficio de la casa.

Norberto lleva tres años de dedicarse a ejercer como policia, antes cultivaba maiz junto con su padre pero tiempo despues cuando se dio cuenta que ya queria hacerce de sus cosas y tener su familia decidio buscar otro trabajo; pero no corrio con la suerte de encontrar un trabajo, fue ahi donde decidio meterse a la academia de policia y clasifico desde hace tres años ejerce de policia.

Actualmente esta bien retirado de su casa en otro departamento del pais, para trasladarse a su trabajo lo hace en bus y se tarda 4 horas para llegar a su trabajo; su horario laboral es de 6 dias de trabajo las 24 horas y 4 dias de licencia que son los dias donde él descanza.

Con el prestamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un terrenito pequeño que le estan vendiendo para que él pueda construir en lo propio, ya que ahorita donde estan viviendo es de su suegro y él quiere tener su propia casa con ello se sentira mas tranquilo y podra tener algo propio para su hija y su esposa.

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su familia este bien tambien, dice que él quiere que su hija tenga lo necesario que no le falte el sustenteo diario y que con esfuerzo poder comprar el terrenito y poder ir poco a poco construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Norberto is 27 yeas old and completed a degree a year and a half ago. He has a partner with whom he has a 14 month old daughter. His life partner takes care of their daughter and the household chores.

Norberto has worked as a police officer for three years. Prior to that he grew corn with his father, but after some time he realised that he wanted to do his own thing and have a family so he decided to look for another job. However, luck was not on his side and he didn't find one, so that's when he decided to join the police academy. He started working as a police officer three years ago.

At the moment Norberto is very far from home, in another department of the country. He goes to work by bus and it takes 4 hours to get there. He works 24 hour days, six days a week, with four days off when he can rest.

The loan Norberto is applying for will be used to buy a small piece of land for sale so that he can build his own property. At the moment he is living with his father-in-law but he wants to have his own house so that he can live more peacefully and have something of his own for his wife and daughter.

Norberto's dream is that he and his family will enjoy good health. He says that he wants his daughter to have everything she needs so that she will never go a day without food. He hopes that with his efforts he will be able to buy a small piece of land and bit by bit start building a house.

loans.use: to buy a small piece of land to build a house

loans.name: Alatupe

texts.en: Alatupe is a 33-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells meat pies and chicken pies in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Alatupe needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, boneless chicken, finely diced meat, yeast and salt. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Alatupe has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, boneless chicken, meat, yeast and salt

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is thankful for the PHP 36,000 loan that was previously granted to her which she used for the repair and maintenance of her apartment for rent. Through this rental she is able to meet her family's daily personal and household needs.

She would like now to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan since she will now venture into the direct selling of natural medicines. Natural Botanical Supplements is now a growing global network. People are now becoming more health conscious and knowledgeable that nature's ingredients boost and cleanse the immune system, to achieve optimum health naturally. She is positive that her direct selling of this product will definitely augment her income. She is glad and thanks you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Irene dreams of seeing her new business grow. She now appears in her photo in the apartment that she rents out. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for her initial purchase for direct selling natural supplement products.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria is 26 years old. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She will buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sugar, salt, milk, SGM milk (formula), biscuits, candies, sauces, plastics and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. Now she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with a working capital of $500. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to increase her income, and to improve her business to grow bigger in the future. She also has animals like pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, milk, SGM milk, biscuits, candies, sauces, plastics and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 57 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Emelia has been in this business for four years.

In the future Emelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Liupapa

texts.en: Liupapa is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. Liupapa needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a large pot, soy sauce, cans of mixed veggies and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Liupapa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a large pot, soy sauce, cans of mixed veggies and plastic bags.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 32 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Divina has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
During the six months she maintained her pigs, Jero Pudak had no difficulties or problems. She sold her 10 fattening pigs and earned 400.000 IDR profit per month.

This profit was more than in the previous period because the price for pork also increased this month. Because she had good results, her husband gave his full support for her business. This effort has proven to fulfill her family's needs.

Now, Jero Pudak and the other member of Dewi Fortuna group decided to take a new loan to continue the business. The group's main goal is to save enough capital to stop taking loans and continue the business with their own capital. 

The needs of today's life are very expensive. They force everyone to work hard to make ends meet. Jero Pudak can not just rely on the income of her husband; she also has to work. Raising pigs is not the only solution. Now she also uses her loan to support her husband by purchasing various kinds of seed and fertilizer for their garden.

She got a loan to buy feed for the sow and use the rest for her garden. Her husband helps her to raise the pigs. They feed and clean the cage every day. Since they are paying attention to the cage and food hygiene, Jero Pudak hopes her pigs will be healthy and thrive. And both of the businesses will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Myrna has been in business for 11 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling of personal collection products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of personal collection products business for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school tuition for her son

loans.name: Arcela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arcela works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of cultured pearls business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Arcela is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of cultured pearls to sell. 

Arcela has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 36 years old. She lives in Ermera and she is married. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business in the future. She is selling a cow. She started to sell cows in 2002 with her own working capital of $360. She is selling cows because she earns a good income from this business. She is very interested in her business, so she taking a loan to buy another cow. She is happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin to her because with the loan from Ruba Rai Metin, she can have good management. She also has animals in her house like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 54 years old and is blessed with four children. They are happily living in a rural community. Due to financial hardship, she wants to re-start her small retail store to have an additional source of income. She plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps, eggs, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. She believes that having this financial assistance will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps, eggs, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Nove

texts.en:
Nove is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo, fish net, etc., for a fish cage for her fishing business.

Nove has been in this business for 10 years. Nove earns additional income from raising pigs.

Nove has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo and fish net for a fish cage

loans.name: Lemau

texts.en: Lemau is a 34-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Lemau needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lemau has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Lorely

texts.en:
Lorely works hard to support her family. Lorely is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Lorely has been in this business for 12 years now.

She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

In the future, Lorely would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to use her previous loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita still dreams of having another jeepney unit. She also hopes for good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Abatwaramuco Group

texts.fr:
Estella partie du groupe  Abatwaramuco  à Bujumbura et est mariée à Donatien. 

Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres, de sa famille élargie, qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de ciment et de matériaux de construction(clous,fil à ligaturer,étriers,...)depuis 4ans.

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de clous, de fils à ligaturer ,d'étriers à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Estella belongs to the Abatwaramuco group in Bujumbura and is married to Donatien. She has two young dependants who are members of her extended family and they are both studying. 

She has been buying and selling cement and building materials (nails, tie-wires, yoke joints,..) for the past four years and this is her first loan from Turame. She is going to boost her capital with the Kiva loan she is granted and buy a large quantity of nails, tie-wires and yoke joints to resell so she can make more money.

loans.use: to boost her capital and buy a large quantity of nails, tie-wires and yoke joints for resale so she can earn more money.

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MIRIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 55 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Bougoufiekoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de vanne, d’ustensile en plastiques et de fruits et légumes.
Les femmes du groupe MIRIYA sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAMOU, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, de l’huile, de la farine boulangère et des condiments chez les grossistes à Massigui. 
La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa gargote sise au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvestie dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Miriya group is made up of married women, who average 55 years of age with seven children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Bougoufiekoro in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and through friendship, and their activities are restauration, the purchase and sale of cereals, condiments, wickerwork, plastic utensils, fruit and vegetables. 

The women in the Miriya group turned to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to fulfil their significant customer demand and they are on their 23rd group loan. 

The customer, Mamou, who is standing second from the right in the photo, is illiterate, and she currently has a restauration activity. She is planning to buy rice, oil, flour and condiments from wholesalers in Massigui. She sells her dishes to a mixed customer base for cash in her little café in the market. She expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration.

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NAFAMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de l’habillement, de fruits et légumes et de l’essence. Les femmes du groupe NAFAMA sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente YOUMA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite 
est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de fruits et légumes. Elle compte acheter des paniers de bananes et d’orange chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvestie dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Nafama group is made up of married women, who average 34 years of age with two children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Barouéli, in the prefecture of the same name, which lies in the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region).

They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and through friendship, and their activities are restauration, the purchase and sale of clothing, fruit and vegetable and petrol. 

The women in the Nafama group turned to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to fulfil their significant customer demand and they are on their 23rd group loan. 

The customer, Youma, who is standing on the left of the photo, is illiterate, and she currently sells fruit and vegetables. She is planning to buy baskets of bananas and oranges from wholesalers in Konobougou. She sells her products retail and for cash from her home and in the market to a mixed customer base. She expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Nahouri Group

texts.fr:
Mme WOUWOLO est responsable du groupe NAHOURI.  Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 38ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des objets plastiques depuis  06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son  secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01douzaine de seaux et 03douzaines de plats.
Mme veut  épargner  ses bénéfices pour prendre soin de sa famille. Elle ambitionne aider ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Wouwolo is in charge of the Nahouri group. She is married and mother to six children, the eldest of whom is 38 years old and the youngest 18. One of her children attends school. She has three dependants.

Wouwolo has been selling plastic goods for the past six years and gets her supplies from the market in her area. She would like to buy a dozen buckets and three dozen dishes.

She would like to save her profits so she can take care of her family and her ambition is to help her children through their studies.

loans.use: to buy a dozen buckets and three dozen plates.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Ben est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne44 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 2 enfants.
