Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Glacières,Assiettes tasses  et divers.Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt de groupe. 
Mariam est un membre du groupe Ben,assise 2èmede gauche à droite, vendeuse de Glacières, Assiettes et  tasses.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Glacières, Assiettes,  tasses en qualité et en quantité au marché qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Ben comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mariam compte réaliser  120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Ben is a group of women from the Koko district of the town of Koutiala. They know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 44 years of age, are married and have at least two children each. 

This group of women buy and sell a variety of products such as ice-boxes, plates, cups and others. They joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program so that they could expand their businesses and they are on their 15th group loan.

Mariam is a member of the Ben group and is sitting second from the right in the photo. She sells ice-boxes, plates and cups and is planning to use her loan to buy a large quantity of high quality ice-boxes, plates and cups at the market. She will sell these retail to a mixed customer base. While the other members of the Ben group expect to make an average profit of 105,000FCFA through the cycle, Mariam expects to make 120,000FCFA. As well as repaying their loans, the women use part of their income to cover personal expenses and expand their businesses. They would like to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they do not run out of stocks.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Tigmi Group

texts.fr:
Mme THERESE représente le groupe  TIGMI. Mariée, elle est mère de 01 enfant. Il est  âgé de 06ans et doit aller à l’école maintenant. Elle a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mme est gérante de maquis depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les brasseries en ville.
Mme veut s’acheter 50caisses de boissons (bière et  sucrerie).
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’acheter de nouveaux matériels et des congélateurs afin d’améliorer son maquis. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir une cave.
texts.en:
Mrs. Therese represents the Tigmi group. She is married with one child. He is six years old and must go to school now. She has two people dependent on her. Mrs. Therese has been running a little bar for six years. She buys her stock in the local breweries.
Mrs. Therese would like to buy 50 crates of drinks (beer and soft drinks).
With the profits, she wants to buy new equipment and freezers in order to improve her bar. Her ambition is to open a cellar.

loans.use: to buy 50 crates of drinks (beer and soft drinks).

loans.name: Marie Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2014.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus de la commune de koungheul,elles ont comme activité principale le commerce.

Marie,à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 44 ans,est célibataire et mére de 02 filles.

Elle pratique le commerce de jus de fruits ,elle achéte du pain de singe qu'elle transforme en jus de fruits pour ensuite le revendre.

Ainsi elle compte acheter 02 sacs de sucre à 26000f le sac et 100 kg de pain de singe à 300f le kg et 16000f de produits divers. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité,augmenter son niveau d'épargne et assurer les frais de scolarité de ses filles et leurs frais médicaux.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2014. It is made up of members from the Koungheul commune, their principal activity is trade.

Marie, who is on the far right in the photo with her arms raised, is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old and has two daughters.

She sells fruit juice, she buys baobab fruit and transforms it into fruit juice to sell.

So, she plans to buy two sacks of sugar for 26000f each, 100kg of fruit for 300f each kilo and 16000f of various products.

Her aim is to expand her business, increase her savings and guarantee the school fees and medical expenses for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of sugar, and 100kg of baobab fruit.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° año de bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene un hijo que está estudiando por lo tanto su pareja y su hijo dependen de Jorge.

Jorge es albañil, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, para llegar a su trabajo viaja en bicicleta y trabaja de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm. 

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar ganado para criarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos.

Él sueña con que su ganado se críe en buen estado y obtener más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 37 years old. He went to school up to the second year of high school. He is married and his spouse sells vegetables. He has a son who is in school and so his spouse and his son depend on him. 

Jorge is a bricklayer. He has worked in the business for 6 years. He also raises cattle. To get to his job he travels in bicycle and works from 7:00 a.m. to  5:00 p.m. 

He will use the loan to buy cattle to raise, fatten and then sell. His dream is for his cattle to be raised healthy and to obtain more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise, fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilian de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado, ahora está casada y su esposo trabaja de seguridad en una empresa eléctrica, tiene dos hijos, de los cuales ambos estudian y dependen de Lilian.

Lilian trabaja cuidando a un anciano, también se dedica a criar aves de corral, este negocio se encuentra a una hora de su casa y viaja a pie. 

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar ganado, engordarlo y criarlo para luego venderlos. 

Ella planea que su ganado se desarrolle en buen estado y así tener más ingresos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lilian, 39, has a fourth grade education.  Now she is married and her husband works in security at an electric company.  Lillian has two children who attend school and depend on her.

She works caring for an elderly man and also raises barnyard poultry.  She walks an hour to get to her poultry business.  She plans to use the loan to buy cattle and raise it to sell.  She is counting on producing healthy, well-developed cattle in order to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar plant.

loans.name: Gwira Group

texts.fr:
Ernest fait partie du groupe  Gwira et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 28 ans et est marié à Félixiane ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant âgé de 6mois. 

Il fait le commerce de chaussures  depuis  5 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chaussures  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  voir son enfant étudier.
texts.en:
Ernest is a member of the Gwira group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 28 and married to Felixiane, a farmer. They have one child of six months of age.

He has been selling shoes for five years.

This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shoes for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, he wants to send his child to school.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shoes for resale to earn more.

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad. De profesión albañil, casado, es padre de dos pequeños hijos a quienes cuida con mucha dedicación. Su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también atiende una pequeña tienda que esta instalada en su hogar.

José alcanzo a estudiar hasta el sexto grado de educación básica, luego de dejar sus estudios se dedico a trabajar, aprendiendo así el oficio de albañil. José esta muy agradecido con su padre y su hermano quienes fueron los que le enseñaron ese oficio tan importante y rentable en su lugar de residencia.

José como es un hombre de trabajo, hoy para la temporada de la agricultura sembrara maíz, el cual es un grano muy básico en su hogar. Ademas de eso pertenece a una sociedad Cooperativa de pescadores en la región donde él vive.Todo esto con el fin de obtener ingresos a su hogar.

Hoy en día José quiere mejorar su vivienda para construir una habitación y un corredor que le permita una mayor comodidad, tanto a él como a su familia, Con el efectivo del crédito comprara cemento, bloques, arena, clavos, entre otros materiales.

Sus sueños a futuro se basan en una familia muy unida, siempre uniendo esfuerzos, ver a sus hijos crecer y que cada día vayan adquiriendo algo nuevo que les sirva en su futuro, para una mejor estabilidad y futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
José, 33, is a bricklayer by profession and married.  He is the father of two small children who he cares for with much dedication.  His wife is a homemaker who also attends to a small store she has set up at home.

José has a sixth grade education and left his studies to work and learn the trade of bricklayer.  He is very grateful to his father and brother who were the ones who taught him such an important, profitable skill in his own home.

José is a hard-working man who plans to grow corn which is a basic grain in his home.  He also belongs to the fishermen's co-operative in the area where he lives.  All of his work is to earn an income for the household.

José wants to carry out home improvements by building a room and a porch to make it more comfortable for his family.  With the money from the loan he will buy cement, blocks, sand, nails and other materials.

His goals for the future center on having a united family joining efforts and seeing his children grow and learn something every day for their future so they will have more stability and a promising future.

loans.use: To buy cement, blocks, sand, nails and other materials to build a room and a porch.

loans.name: José Adelso

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, está casado  y su esposa trabaja en una alcaldía, de sus tres hijos solo dos viven en casa. 

José trabaja en carpintería desde hace casi 30 años, lo aprendió de su padre que fue carpintero, luego que se casó decidió hacerlo de forma independiente y aprendió a hacer muebles finos, el taller lo tiene en el corredor de su casa y trabaja junto con su padre, además José trabaja en la agricultura y sabe hacer instalaciones eléctricas. Para comprar materia prima (madera) la compra a 6 km de su casa y otros insumos los compra en otra ciudad.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar un cepillo eléctrico y un compresor para pintar muebles ya que actualmente todo lo hace de forma manual, eso le hará hacer el trabajo más rápido y de mejor calidad. 

En un futuro él planea construir su casa más segura de ladrillo o de bloque ya que actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old. He went to school up to the 9th grade. He is married and his wife works in a city hall. Of his three children, only two live at home.   

José has worked in carpentry for almost 30 years. He learned it from his father, who was a carpenter. Later, he married and decided to go off on his own. He learned to make fine furniture. He has his workshop on the porch of his house and he works with his father. José also works in furniture and knows how to do electrical installation. He buys raw materials (wood) 6 km from his house and he buys other materials in town. 

He needs the loan to buy an electric brush and a compressor to paint furniture since now he does it manually. This will make his work higher quality and faster. 

In the future, he plans to build a safer house out of brick or blocks, because now it is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy an electric brush and a compressor to paint furniture, because now he has to do it manually.

loans.name: Ya Nere Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA représente le groupe  YA NERE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des pagnes, des chaussures (divers) depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans son secteur en ville.
Mme veut s’acheter 10pièces de pagnes, ½ de prêt à porter et 06 vernis.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut améliorer son hangar et aider son mari pour la scolarité des enfants. Mme ambitionne  voyager elle-même à Doubaï pour acheter ses marchandises et faire un nouveau hangar pour ses pagnes au marché.
texts.en: Ms. Haoua represents the Ya Nere Group. She is married and mother of four children. The oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Three attend school. Ms. Haoua has six dependents. She has been selling pagne cloth and various shoes for 12 years.  She buys her supplies in her area of the city.  She wants to buy 10 pieces of pagne cloth, half ready-to-wear, and six varnishes.  With her profits, she wants to improve her shed and help her husband with their children's school fees.  Ms. Haoua aspires to travel herself to Dubai to buy her merchandise and to build a new shed for her pagne cloth at the market.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of pagne cloth, half ready-to-wear, and 6 varnishes.

loans.name: Benedite Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA représente le groupe  BENEDITE. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé a 25ans.01 va à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des habits et sacs à mains depuis 18ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les revendeurs en ville.
Mme veut s’acheter 15complets pagnes et 03douzaines de sac à main.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut payer la scolarité de l’enfant. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en: Ms. Haoua represents the Benedite Group. She is married and mother of three children. The oldest is 32 and the youngest is 25; one attends school. She has eight dependents.  Ms. Haoua has been selling clothing and handbags for 18 years.  She buys her merchandise from resellers in the city.  She wants to buy 15 sets of pagne cloth and three dozen handbags.  With her profits, she wants to pay for her child's school fees. She aspires to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 15 sets of pagne cloth and three dozen handbags.

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es: Maria, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos con quien vive en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace 4 años Maria decidió establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: azúcar, manteca, arroz, harina, refrescos, pan huevos y otros. El negocio lo tiene en su casa donde también atiende sus labores del hogar. Con este préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo que es por un monto de 12,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir su negocio de productos como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, churros, condimentos, y otros abarrotes para tener variedad y ofrecer a sus clientes. Su plan es mantener el negocio para darles mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, is a single mother with two children and they live in a village of the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Four years ago Maria decided to set up her own grocery store business to sell basic household goods such as sugar, lard, rice, flour, soft drinks, bread, eggs and other items.  Her store is set up in her home where she also attends to the household chores.

She will use the loan she is requesting in the amount of 12,000 HNL to stock her store with products such as basic grains, sugar, lard, soft drinks, pastries, condiments and other groceries in order to offer a wider variety to customers.  Her plan is to maintain the business and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To stock products such as basic grains, sugar, lard, soft drinks, pastries, condiments and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Femmes Battantes Group

texts.fr:
Mme  AMINATA  est responsable du groupe  FEMMES BATTANTES. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a plus de 41 ans et le moins âgés à 17 ans. Personne ne va  à l’école et elle a 05 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend du combustible depuis plus de 23ans.  Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. 
Elle veut s’acheter  un camion de combustible.	
Elle veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Aminata is the leader of the "Femmes Battantes" group. She is doing well.  She is married and mother of eight children. The oldest is 41 and the youngest is 17; none of them attend school. Ms. Aminata has four dependents. She has sold fuel for over 23 years. She gets her supplies delivered to her home. She wants to buy a fuel truck.  She wants to save her profits.  She aspires to stretch the limits of her business and better care for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fuel truck.

loans.name: Nom Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALIMATA représente le groupe  NOM WENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 06ans.03 vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend divers savons depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans son secteur.
Mme veut s’acheter ½ sac de savon(kabacourou).
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Mme ambitionne  agrandir le champ de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata represents the Nom Wende group. She is married with three children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest six. All three go to school. She has seven people who depend on her.
Mrs. Salimata has been selling soap for eight years. She buys her stock locally. 
She would like to buy half a sack of soap (kabacourou).
With the profits, she wants to save up. Her goal is to widen the scope of her business.

loans.use: to buy 1/2 a sack of soap.

loans.name: Berta Noemí

texts.es:
Berta de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 22 años de edad, ella es madre soltera pero a pesar de eso le brinda los estudios sus hijos, uno bachillerato y la otra hija en la universidad, ella vive junto a sus hijos en el terreno de su madre pero tiene su propia casa.

Berta tiene un negocio de tortas y tacos, además trabaja sirviendo café y pan en una funeraria de su ciudad, también trabaja por temporadas en una fábrica de azúcar. En la funeraria trabaja de 5:00 de la noche  a 7:00 de la mañana del siguiente día y tiene 2 años en ese trabajo, el negocio de los tacos y tortas lo hace desde hace 5 años. Berta siempre ha trabajado en diferentes actividades, y cuando se separó del padre de sus hijos tuvo que trabajar más duro para sacarlos adelante.

Ella necesita el crédito para cubrir gastos de graduación de bachillerato de su hijo, además invertirá en el negocio de tacos y tortas y cancelará un saldo vigente de un crédito personal. 

Ella sueña con tener estabilidad en su negocio y que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Berta is 39 years old, completed high school, and has two children, ages 18 and 22. Berta is a single mother but, in spite of this, she has given her children an education. One is finishing high school while her daughter is in university. Berta lives with her children. They live on Berta's mother's land, but have their own house.

Berta has a business selling cakes and tacos. She also serves coffee and bread and one of the city's funeral homes, and, for two years, has done seasonal work at a sugar factory - there she works from 5pm until 7am the next day. Berta has had the cake and taco business for five years. Berta has always worked in different areas and, when she separated from the father of her children, she had to work harder in order to help them to get ahead.

Berta needs this loan in order to cover her son's graduation from high school, and to invest in her cakes and taco business; Berta will also pay off a personal loan.

Berta dreams of having a stable business and that her children will continue to study until they have a profession.

loans.use: to cover her son's graduation from high school, and to invest in her cakes and taco business; Berta will also pay off a personal loan.

loans.name: José Willmer

texts.es:
José es un joven muy emprendedor de 25 años de edad, lamentablemente por dificultades económicas solo logró estudiar hasta el 9° grado, está soltero y vive con sus padres  pero ayuda en lo que puede en su hogar.

José se ha dedicado principalmente a la agricultura, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta clase de trabajo, él sale desde muy temprano de su hogar a cultivar su propia cosecha, además trabaja como ayudante en terrenos ajenos.


José invertirá el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para fortalecer su cosecha de maíz, si la cosecha es buena dejará una parte para consumo del hogar y la otra parte la venderá en el mercado y así podrá ayudar a sus padres con los gastos.

José siempre ha soñado con tener su propio negocio, y piensa que con los préstamos podrá lograrlo, además le gustaría retomar sus estudios para superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old and is a very enterprising young man. Unfortunately because of financial difficulties he was only able to study as far as ninth grade. He is single and lives with his parents, but he helps as much as he can at home.

José has mainly worked in agriculture and has been doing this type of work for 6 years. He leaves home very early in the morning to tend to his own crop and also works as a helper on other people's plots. 

José will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to boost his corn crop. If he gets a good harvest he will keep part of it for his own household's consumption and will sell the rest on the market, thus helping his parents out with the living expenses.

José has always dreamed of having his own business and thinks that with the loans he will be able to achieve this. He would also like to restart his education so he can make progress in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to boost his corn harvest.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 67 años de edad, es ama de casa, no fue a la escuela por la falta de recursos económicos que tenían sus padres, Juana quedo viuda desde hace muchos años y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ya todos son mayores de edad, por lo tanto ya no dependen de ella.

Juana vive con su mamá, su nieta y 2 bisnietos; pero solo depende de ella, solo su madrecita.
Juana se dedica al cuidado de su familia y a los quehaceres de su casa, ya que esta jubilada desde que su esposo falleció.

El crédito que esta solicitando Juana en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de materiales como: piedra, cemento y arena para construir un muro y mejorar su vivienda.

El sueño de Juana es comprar un vehículo, para poder trasladarse fácilmente al mercado donde compra sus víveres y para llevar a su madrecita a las consultas médicas.
texts.en:
Sixty-seven-year-old Juana did not attend school as her parents could not afford it. Juana was left widowed many years ago. She has five children who are now all adults and do not depend on their mother.

Juana lives with her mother, granddaughter, and two great-grandchildren. The only one who depends on Juana, however, is her mother.

Juana takes care of her family and of the household chores as she has been retired since her husband died.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy cement, stones and sand to build a wall and make improvements to her home.

Juana's dream is to buy a vehicle in order to travel easily to the market where she buys supplies and to take her mother to medical appointments.

loans.use: to buy cement, stones and sand to build a wall in her home.

loans.name: Nohemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nohemy de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta 6°grado, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad los cuales asisten a la escuela, uno de ellos está en 1°grado y el otro en 4° grado, y son los únicos que dependen de Nohemy.


Nohemy tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, la cual administra desde hace 6 años, su madre era comerciante y así fue como Nohemy aprendió el negocio, su esposo se involucra y le ayuda en el trabajo, Nohemy trabaja de 6:00 AM a 5:00 PM. 

Ella solicita este crédito para surtir su tienda, comprará arroz, azúcar, frijoles, gaseosas, café, etc, el préstamo le ayudará a tener variedad de productos de la canasta básica, para que todos los habitantes de su cantón puedan encontrar en su tienda lo necesario en cuanto para su consumo.

Su sueño más grande es que sus hijos puedan superarse académicamente y sean profesionales, que puedan tener un mejor futuro que el de ella y su esposo, y también desea arreglar su casa ya que se encuentra en mal estado pues tiene ciertos agujeros en el techo y en la temporada de invierno ingresa el agua a la casa.
texts.en:
Nohemy is 28 years old and studied as far as 6th grade. She currently has a partner and he works in agriculture. She has two children aged 7 and 10 who go to primary school. One of them is in 1st grade and the other is in 4th grade. They are her only dependents.

Nohemy has a small shop in her home which she has been running for 6 years. Her mother was a shopkeeper and this is how Nohemy learnt the business. Her husband gets involved and helps her with the business. Nohemy works from 6am to 5pm.

She is asking for this loan to stock her business and plans to buy rice, sugar, beans, fizzy drinks, coffee etc. The loan will help her to have a variety of the basic daily staples, so that all the local residents can find everything they need to buy in her shop.

Her biggest hope is for her children to do well in their education and become professionals, so that they can have a better future than she and her husband have. She also wants to make improvements to her home since it is in a poor condition. It has several holes in the roof and, during the winter, water gets into the house.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, beans, fizzy drinks, coffee etc.

loans.name: Luparia

texts.es: Doña Luparia, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y reside en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro junto a una hija. Ella trabajo por varios años en una empresa privada y al quedar sin empleo decidió por su propio negocio. Hace 7 años se ha dedicado a vender mercadería como ropa de segunda americana, ofrece blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, ropa de niños, y sandalias.  El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar más ropa como pantalones, ropa de cama, blusas, camisetas, y sandalias, para surtir y que su negocio crezca. Tiene como meta seguir mejorando su casa y tener siempre ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Luparia is 57 years old and a single mother to four children. She lives in the Negrito municipality of Yoro with her daughter. Luparia worked for a private business for a number of years but, on becoming unemployed, she decided to start her own business. For seven years Luparia has sold secondhand American clothes. She sells blouses, dresses, skirts, trousers, children's clothes and sandals. Luparia is applying for a loan of 10,000 Lempira, which she will use to buy more clothes, such as trousers, pyjamas, blouses, shirts and sandals to stock up and to expand her business. Luparia's goal is to continue making improvements to her house and always to have an income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, such as trousers, pyjamas, blouses, shirts and sandals to stock up and sell.

loans.name: Sagrario De La Paz

texts.es:
Sagrario de 28 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar 1° de educación básica, está acompañada y su pareja  es comerciante y aún no tiene hijos.

Sagrario se dedica a la venta de tickets de lotería y venta de ropa en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, se ha dedicado a estas actividades desde niña, pues su padre le enseñó desde los 7 años, para llegar al lugar de trabajo viaja todos los días por la mañana. 

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para todas las edades para vender en el mercado, con esto aumentará el nivel de ventas y tendrá mayores ingresos. 

Su sueño más grande es invertir en su casa ya que por el momento es de bahareque y quiere hacerla de ladrillo para mayor seguridad de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sagrario is 28 years old and only attended primary school for one year. She has a partner, a businessman, and does not yet have children.

Sagrario makes a living selling lottery tickets and clothes at the municipal market. She has been doing this work since she was a girl, her father having taught her how to do this work from the age of seven. Sagrario travels every morning in order to arrive at her work.

Sagrario needs this loan in order to buy clothes for all ages to sell at the market. With these items, she will increase sales and have a higher income.

Sagrario's biggest dream is to invest in her house as it is made of mud. She wants a brick house so that it will be more secure for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for all ages to sell at the market.

loans.name: Doris Maribel

texts.es: Doris, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Lleva dos años de dedicarse a vender ropa de segunda para damas y caballeros. Vende camisas, camisetas, short, pantalones, chamarras y también cortinas y sabanas. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con la institución y es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar jeans, pantalones, camisas y blusas y aumentar el inventario para seguir vendiendo. Su meta es crecer como comerciante y con los ingresos ayudar con el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Doris is 36 years old and a single mother to two children. She lives in the municipality of Azacualpa in Santa Bárbara. For two years Doris has been working selling secondhand clothes for men and women. She sells shirts, blouses, shorts, trousers, sweatshirts, as well as curtains and bedclothes. Doris sells these items as a street vendor. This loan will be Doris' third with the organisation. It is a loan of 10,000 Lempira and will be used to buy jeans, trousers, shirts and blouses to increase stock and to sell. Doris' goal is to continue growing as a business-woman and to use her income to help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy jeans, trousers, shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Marta Eva

texts.es: Doña marta, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, reside en un sector del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente vendía alhajas y mercadería general. Hace 12 años que vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Las ventas son realizadas de manera ambulante o por encargos. Vende blusas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos y camisetas. Ha obtenido cinco prestamos para mantener activo su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 17,000 Lempiras para comprar mas ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para vender y obtener mas ingresos. Su sueño es tener un local para vender ropa.
texts.en:
Marta is 60 years old and is a single mother with 5 children. She lives in a district of the town of San Pedro Sula. She has always worked in retail and previously sold jewellery and general merchandise. For the last 12 years she has been selling men's, women's and children's clothing. She sells through orders or as a street vendor and sells blouses, trousers, dresses and t-shirts.

She has had five loans to keep her business going and is now asking for another loan of 17,000 lempiras. She will use this to buy more men's, women's and children's clothing to sell, so she can make more income. 

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elisa Beatriz

texts.es:
La injusticia es el factor principal  por la cual Elisa decidió estudiar la carrera de Derecho, puesto que es una joven que vela por el bienestar de las personas y desea que se desarrollen en un mundo lleno de oportunidades. Tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y no tiene hijos. Es una joven inteligente, emprendedora y trabajadora, cursa su primer año de la carrera y aparte de estudiar trabaja como impulsadora en una empresa, de manera que pueda ser un soporte en la economía familiar. Está muy agradecida por el apoyo incondicional de sus padres por lo que quiere esforzarse en ser una profesional exitosa y brindarle un futuro seguro y estable.
En la actualidad las universidades y el mundo de la tecnología se complementan, trabajan de la mano puesto que los profesores asignan trabajos en línea y en cualquier investigación se requiere del internet. Por esta razón Elisa solicita un crédito, requiere comprar una computadora laptop, medio que le facilitará entregar los trabajos de sus clases en tiempo y forma. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que desea ser la mejor alumna, ya que uno de sus objetivos principales es lograr graduarse con honores. Tiene muchas metas en la vida, una de ellas es establecer su propio bufete jurídico, asegura que trabajara hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Injustice is the main reason why Elisa decided to study for a degree in Law, since she is a young woman who is concerned about people's wellbeing and wants people to flourish in a world full of opportunities. She is 22 years old, is single and does not have any children. She is an intelligent, enterprising and hard-working young woman. She is in the first year of her degree and as well as studying she works as a sales promoter for a company, so that she can provide support for the family's finances.

She is very grateful for her parents' unconditional support and for this reason she wants to work hard to become a successful professional so she can provide them with a secure and stable future.

Nowadays universities and technology go hand in hand and complement each other, since the teachers assign work on-line and any kind of research requires the internet. This is the reason why Elisa is asking for a loan, since she needs to buy a laptop computer. This will enable her to submit her classwork on time and in the right format. She is putting her faith in the loan, since she wants to be the best student, as one of her main goals is to graduate with honours. 

She has many goals in her life, one of which is to set up her own legal practice. She gives assurances that she will keep working until she achieves this.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Aisa Isabel

texts.es:
Aisa de 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues la situación económica de sus padres no se lo permitía, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los  oficios domésticos, tiene 9 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y a los cuales no pudo brindarles el estudio por lo cual tuvieron que trabajar desde muy pequeños.

Aisa se dedica al cultivo del maíz y frijol, también a engordar cerdos, además trabaja de corralero desde los 8 años de edad, y cuando es tiempo de siembra hace los dos trabajos para así obtener más ingresos para el hogar.

Él necesita el crédito, para comprar 6 cerdos y alimentos para los mismos, ya que es una forma de obtener ganancias cuando los vende.

Sus sueños son llegar a tener una granja de cerdos y de pollos de engorde, para mejorar sus ingresos y tener una mejor vida en la que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Aisa, 58, didn't have the chance to go to school because his parents' economic situation didn't allow it.  He's in a relationship and his partner takes care of the housekeeping.  He has nine children who are already adults; he wasn't able to give them an education because they had to work from a very young age.

Aisa earns a living growing corn and beans and fattening pigs.  He also has worked as a ranch hand since he was eight years old.  When it's time for planting, he does both jobs to earn more income for the household.

He needs the loan to buy six pigs and pig feed, because it's a form of earning a profit when he sells them.

His dreams are to have a farm for fattening pigs and chickens, to improve his income, and to have a better life and not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy six pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en:
Carlina is grateful for the Php 50,000 loan that was previously granted to her, which she used to upgrade her facilities and buy more stock of mineral water. Through her earnings, she is able to meet her family's daily personal and household needs.

She would like now to apply for a Php 15,000 loan to buy a one-month stock of mineral water.  She is positive that her increased inventory will definitely mean more sales and income. She is glad and thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Carlina aims to further grow her business. She religiously saves from her earnings to repay her loan and for her dream to go around the world. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the upgrade of her facilities and buy more stock of mineral water  to expand capacity.

loans.name: Sonia Yamileth

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 31 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo se fue hace varios años a Estados Unidos y trata de ayudarle económicamente a ella y a sus tres hijos.


Sonia se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ya tiene un año de dedicarse a este negocio,lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de
darles lo mejor a sus hijos y obtener mas ingresos, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja en un  horario de 7:00 AM a 1:00 PM.

 
Sonia solicita este préstamo para comprar maíz y leña para continuar con su negocio de venta de tortillas.

Su sueño es mantener su negocio funcionando y que sus hijos crezcan en mejores condiciones de vida, y ayudarles siempre para que se superen y lleguen  a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is 31 years old. She was able to study as far as her high school diploma. She is married and her husband went to the US several years ago and tries to help her and their three children financially.

Sonia makes a living selling tortillas and has been doing this for a year. She learnt the trade because of the need to give her children the best and have more income. She has the business in her home and works from 7am until 1pm.

Sonia is asking for this loan to buy corn and firewood so she can continue with her business selling tortillas.

Her dream is to keep her business running. She hopes her children will grow up with better living conditions and hopes to be able to keep helping them so they can improve themselves and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to continue with her business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and purchase educational equipment for her oldest son

loans.name: Reodina

texts.en:
Reodina, at 59 years old, is a forceful and determined woman. 

For 14 years of her life, she has dedicated herself to working independently in her business. For four years, she combined this work with other activities, but after that she decided to throw herself fully into her business and got started in her own welding shop. 

She works with her spouse every day from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. She has managed to generate the income needed to help her spouse with household expenses and to support her children. 

Reodina's goal is to move her workshop outside of her home, which would improve her working conditions and allow her to increase her production. This would guarantee better profitability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase iron

loans.name: Mauricio Enmanuel

texts.es: Mauricio es un joven de 22 años de edad que le gusta expresar gráficamente ideas, hechos y valores tanto social, cultural como económico ya que todo eso es una base sólida para aplicarlo en sus estudios, esa fue la principal razón por la cual decidió estudiar Arquitectura en Diseño Gráfico. Mauricio solicita el préstamo para pagar el curso final de su carrera ya que logrando culminar sus estudios con éxito estima que se le abrirán las puertas para optar a un empleo en su especialidad de igual forma el préstamo le ayudara para tener mejores equipos de trabajo. Sus principales planes a futuro son solidificar su equipo de trabajo con el objetivo de crear mejores diseños arquitectónicos que le abrirán las puertas en las instituciones o empresas afines.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 22, is a young man who likes to graphically express ideas, facts, and values--whether social, cultural, or economic--because all this is a solid base to apply to his studies.  That was the main reason he decided to study graphic design in architecture.

Mauricio's requesting the loan to pay for the last course in his degree because he managed to finish his program successfully.

He thinks doors will open to him for choosing a job in his field, just as the loan will help him have better better work equipment.  His main plan for the future is to strengthen his work equipment so he can create better architectural designs that will open doors to him in institutions or related companies.

loans.use: to pay for his final degree course

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta  segundo grado, está casado y su esposa es ama de casa, además elabora petates para comercializarlos, tiene dos hijas de las cuales solo una estudia, la otra porque no tiene la edad para ir a la escuela, de Salvador dependen económicamente solo tres personas.

Salvador se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, ya lleva más de 18 años realizando esta actividad, lo aprendió desde muy pequeño con su padre. A Salvador le gusta producir granos básicos para la venta y también para el consumo familiar, él  trabaja 8 horas todos los días de la semana y a veces más, la parcela le queda muy cerca pues solo camina 10 minutos para llegar al lugar.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar abono y venenos para usarlos en su cultivo para nutrir bien las plantas y tener una baja incidencia de plagas.

Sus planes a futuro son que sus hijas estudien en la escuela, y seguir cultivando para tener alimentación.
texts.en:
Salvador is 36 years old and studied as far as second grade. He is married and his wife is a housewife and also makes bedrolls to sell. He has two daughters and only one of them goes to school. The other one is too young to start school yet. Only three people depend on Salvador financially.

Salvador makes a living growing basic grains and has been doing this for more than 18 years. He learnt alongside his father when he was very young. Salvador likes growing basic grains to sell and also for the family's own consumption. He works 8 hours every day of the week, and sometimes more. The plot of land is close by and he only has a 10-minute walk to get there. 

He needs the loan to buy manure and poisons to use on his crops, to feed his plants well and reduce the incidence of pests.

His plans for the future are for his daughters to go to primary school and to keep growing crops so they have food to eat.

loans.use: to buy manure and poisons to use on his crops, to feed his plants well and reduce the incidence of pests.

loans.name: Martina De La Paz

texts.es:
Martina de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo es albañil pero actualmente se dedica a cuidar una granja de gallinas, tiene un hijo que asiste a la escuela.

Martina tiene una tienda en su casa desde hace unos 4 años, pues vive frente a la escuela y decidió iniciar con el negocio por iniciativa propia.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar churros, gaseosas, dulces, galletas para aumentar el inventario de su tienda.

Ella sueña con mejorar su casa y que su hijo sea profesional, además desea que siempre exista unidad en su familia.
texts.en:
Martina is 27 years old and studied as far as her high school diploma. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer, although currently he is looking after a chicken farm. She has a son who is at primary school.

Martina has had a shop in her home for 4 years, since she lives opposite the school and decided to start up the business on her own initiative.

She needs the loan to buy doughnuts, fizzy drinks, sweets and biscuits to increase the stock in her shop.

Her dream is to improve her home and for her son to become a professional. She also hopes that her family will always be united.

loans.use: to buy doughnuts, fizzy drinks, sweets and biscuits to increase the stock in her shop.

loans.name: Loteuaina

texts.en:
Loteuaina is a 34-year-old unmarried woman with 4 children. 

She makes and sells Samoan banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. 

Loteuaina needs a loan to buy a bunch of bananas, a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven, and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Loteuaina has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a bunch of bananas, a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven, and plastic bags

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Ligaya would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ligaya wants for her business to continue to operate and to flourish, and she also desires to see that each member of her family is always healthy and happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Sherlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from tailoring. 

Sherlyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like fishing nets, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

Sherlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like fishing nest, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Lei'u

texts.en:
Lei'u is 58 years old and married. She has five children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Lei'u needs a loan to buy new gum boots, a sprayer, chemicals, crops, a spade, a tiller and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Lei'u will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new gum boots, a sprayer, chemicals, crops, a spade, a tiller and new overalls.

loans.name: Tauvasa

texts.en:
Tauvasa is a 73-year old-widow with 1 child. 

She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Tauvasa has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai is 43 years old and married with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. 

Sivai needs a loan to buy two spades, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, fertilizer and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Sivai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy two spades, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, fertilizer and crops

loans.name: Urgamal

texts.en:
Mrs. Urgamal, 46 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her daughter have been working as hairdressers since 1999. Her husband is a firefighter and works for an emergency department of the state. 

They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam in order to insulate her home. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to insulalte her home in order burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own house-rental business for years and she earns well from this. 

To improve her profit, Josefa would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of the boarding house. An amount of PHP 50,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place so that they could attract more boarders. She will also use the loan for the maintenance and to buy spare parts of their taxi unit, which they used for transportation service. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education that they don't currently have. 

In the future, Josefa wants to buy another taxi and hopes that her family will always be free from sickness. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her apartment.

loans.name: Ana Ofelia

texts.es:
Ana de 63 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado está casada y es madre de tres hijos, su esposo es agricultor y sus hijos ya formaron su propia familia.

Desde hace más de 50 años, Ana se dedica a la elaboración de petates para comercializarlos, este trabajo lo aprendió con su madre, esa es la principal fuente de ingresos de Ana, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral para venderlos. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar abono para aplicar a su milpa y también pesticidas para el control de plagas, ya que su esposo siempre cultiva granos básicos para el consumo en su casa y para alimentar a sus animales.

Para un futuro ella sueña con tener fuerzas para trabajar y que sus hijos la apoyen cuando ella ya no pueda hacerlo por la edad.
texts.en:
Ana, age 63, studied until the sixth grade.  She is married and she is the mother of three children.  Her husband is a farmer, and her children already have their own families.

Ana has been making and selling petates (woven sleeping mats) for more than 50 years, having learned this work from her mother.  That is Ana’s principal source of income, and in addition, she raises and sells pigs and chickens. 

She needs the loan in order to purchase fertilizer for her cornfield and pesticide for pest control, as her husband grows basic grains for home consumption and to feed their animals.

For the future, she hopes that she will have the strength to work, and that her children will support her when she becomes too old to do so.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her cornfield and pesticide for pest control.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of recycled materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional recycled materials to sell for her recycled materials business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years. Elizabeth earns more income from food vending.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Evelyn Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evelyn es una joven emprendedora de 24 años de edad, busca superar los obstáculos que se le presentan día con día, actualmente está acompañada y tiene un hijo que estudia 2° grado.

Ella tiene un negocio que atiende junto con su madre, venden tortillas durante el día y pupusas en la noche, realizan este oficio todos los días. Evelyn trabajaba antes en un comedor, pero vio que podía obtener mayor ganancia teniendo su propio negocio.

El préstamo lo utilizara para pagar una deuda que tiene pendiente, debe salir de este compromiso porque ya le exigen la cancelación total, en este momento no cuenta con todo el dinero, debido a que ha retomado sus estudios y ha incurrido en gastos. 

Su principal sueño es poder culminar sus estudios, llegar a tener un título universitario y buscar un empleo que le permita a ella y su familia salir adelante.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 24, is a young entrepreneur.  She wants to overcome the obstacles that come up every day.  Currently she's in a relationship and has a son who's in second grade.

She has a business she runs with her mother.  They sell tortillas during the day and pupusas [stuffed tortillas] at night.  They do this job every day.  Evelyn used to work in a restaurant, but she saw she could earn more with her own business.

She's going to use the loan to pay back a debt that's pending.  She needs to fulfill this commitment because she's being required to pay it in its entirety.  She doesn't have all the money at the moment because she has gone back to school and incurred expenses.

Her main dream is to be able to finish school, get a college degree, and look for a job that will allow her to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to pay back a debt

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 34 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Merlita has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Merlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Narandorj

texts.en:
Narandorj, 49 years old, lives with his wife and son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a service man at a power plant for 29 years. His wife is a laboratory worker and works at the power plant. Their daughter is currently studying at university in Korea. Their son studies at third grade of university. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to pay for his daughter's tuition fee. His daughter has passed the entrance exam of a prestigious Korean university and opened a great opportunity for her future. So the borrower wants to help his daughter in getting the necessary education.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married. She has an adult son. Svetlana has her own business. 

Svetlana has sold flowers at the central market for 16 years. She has a large assortment and good prices. 

Svetlana rents a selling place. She is hardworking and responsible. Svetlana wants to develop her business further.  

Svetlana is asking for a loan in the amount of 31,000 UAH to buy a selling place at the market.

loans.use: to buy a selling place at the market.

loans.name: Manzese B Group

texts.en:
Leah, who is married and has got two children (one schooling and another still a baby), is in her late 30s. She has been a businesswoman selling cold drinks, chicken and animal food called pumba. She has had this business since 2004. Leah works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her first loan request via Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. The loan will be apportioned among Manzese B, a five-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
 
Leah will use her portion of loan to buy pumba and drinks for selling. In the coming years, Leah would like to buy a farm to undertake an agriculture project.

loans.use: to buy pumba and drinks for selling.

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to buy additional household products for his rolling store business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for a new 25,000 PHP loan for him to buy pails, brushes, plates, hangers, and other household products needed in his business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Raymund dreams of having another rolling store so that he could give the best education for his children. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for pails, brushes, plates, hangers, and other household products.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy additional stock of soft drinks and other grocery items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of soft drinks and other products needed in her variety store business. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ofelia dreams of her business continuing to flourish and she hopes that her children will complete their studies. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of soft drinks and other products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Santos Guillermina

texts.es:
Santos de 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos pero algunos ya son mayores de edad, y no dependen de ella


Santos se dedica al comercio desde que tenía 15 años, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, lo cual es un trabajo honrado del que obtiene ganancias para salir adelante.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa de diferentes estilos y para todas las edades y así surtir su negocio.

Ella espera seguir adelante con su trabajo ya que es su medio se subsistencia.
texts.en: Santos is 53  years old, married and has 6 children. Some of them are already adults and no longer depend om her. Santos has had a business for 15 years selling clothing of all types. It is honest work that gives her revenue to get ahead. She needs a loan to buy more clothing of various styles and for all ages to stock her business. She wants to continue on with her work as it is her source of sustenance.

loans.use: to buy clothing of different styles and all ages to stock her business.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is a hardworking mother who owns and manages a small retail store within their village. She is 37 years old and blessed with three children. 

She wants to improve her business and increase her income in order to sustain their daily necessities and finance the education of her children. She plans to acquire more goods to resell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance amounting to PHP 13,000 to purchase grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell. 

She is hoping she will obtain her requested amount to further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: José Eladio

texts.es:
José tiene 45 años de edad, está casado  y tiene dos hijos que dependen de él.

José se dedica al manejo de autobuses, ya tiene 14 años de experiencia en esta actividad la cual le ha servido para llevar el sustento a su familia.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción  para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, esto le permitirá tener una casa en mejores condiciones y que su familia se sienta más segura.
 
Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en: José is 45 years old, married and has two children who are dependent on him. José  works driving buses and has 14 years of experience in this field which allows  him to provide sustenance for his family. He needs a loan to buy construction materials to make improvements on his house. This will allow him to have a house in better conditions and have his family feel more secure. His main dream is for his children to grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 54 years old and married. She has 12 children, four of whom are in school. Lucy works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. 

Lucy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future Lucy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 35 años de edad, está casado y tiene una hija que estudia en el kinder, solo ellas dependen de Juan.

Juan tiene experiencia en la actividad agrícola, ya que, desde joven realiza ese trabajo, también desde hace ocho años tiene un molino de motor con el que presta sus servicios a los habitantes de la comunidad, quienes diariamente llevan a moler su maíz para convertirlo en masa y posteriormente hacer las tortillas. 


Él necesita este préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, ladrillos y laminas para realizar una galera para el molino y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, también comprará una pieza que le está fallando a su molino.


Su sueño es ver construídala galera para su molino y que lleguen mas clientes al lugar.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, married, and has a daughter who is in kindergarten. Only his immediate family members are dependent on him.

Juan has experience in farming since he has been involved in this type of work from a young age. For the past eight years, he has also owned a motorized grain mill that he uses to offer services to the residents of the community. Every day he is able to grind up corn and turn it into cornmeal so that it can be used later for making tortillas.

Juan needs this loan so that he can buy cement, sand, bricks, and metal sheets in order to build a shed for his grain mill. This will allow him to provide better service to his customers. In addition, he will also buy a missing part for his grain mill.

His wish is to build a shed for his grain mill and to see more customers come to his place.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for making a shed to house his grain mill and to acquire a spare part.

loans.name: Santos Virgilio

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre trabajador de 43 años de edad, tiene dos hijos para quienes trabaja arduamente junto a su esposa y de esa manera sacarlos adelante.

Santos tiene experiencia en la agricultura, ya que desde muy pequeño su padre le inculcó este trabajo y hoy en día le ha ayudado a desarrollar muy bien la actividad con la cual obtiene el alimento diario para su familia.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para aplicar a sus cultivos de granos básicos.

El espíritu de trabajador de Santos  lo conduce a tener nuevas esperanzas y sueños es por eso que planea ser un exitoso productor en la actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking 43 year old man. He has two children and he and his wife work hard to help them get ahead.

Santos is an experienced farmer because his father taught him the work from the time he was very young. Even today his father helps him hone the skills with which he earns his family’s daily bread.

He needs a loan to purchase fertilizer and compost to apply to his crops of basic grains.

Santos working spirit leads him to have new hopes and dreams. Consequently he plans to be a successful producer in the agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost to apply to his crops.

loans.name: Delgersaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Delgersaikhan, 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing taxi service to local people since 2000. His wife is hair dresser and works at a barbershop. Their children all go to secondary school. 

Mr. Delgersiakhan is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy an LCD television. Their former television is out of date, and his family is tired of blurry images. 

In the profile picture, he is sitting with his wife and youngest of their children.

loans.use: to buy an LCD television

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtuvshin, 46 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been growing and selling vegetables such as potato, carrots and cabbages to local people at market since 1998. His family came to Ulaanbaatar in 2000. They live in a traditional Mongolian ger. He owns land in the countryside where he grows his vegetables. 

Now, Mr. Enkhtuvshin is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT buy high quality potato seeds. These type of seeds are very rare, so he wants to store them in advance for later use. He grows vegetables in a large area, and those vegetables absorb large quantities of carbon dioxide. 

In the borrower profile picture, he and his wife are ready to sell vegetables to local people.

loans.use: to buy high quality potato seeds

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline is grateful for the PHP 8,000 loan that was previously granted, which she used to buy more quantities of bags, blankets, clothing and other similar products. Through her earnings, she is able to meet her family's daily personal and household needs.

She would like now to apply for a PHP 9,000 loan to buy more bed sheets, school bags, etc. to add to her current inventory. She is positive that her increased inventory will definitely mean more sales and income. She is glad and thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.  

 Arline aims to strive more to grow her business and dreams of having a bigger store in the near future. She desires to give her family a more comfortable life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products like school bags and bed sheets to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Merrydith

texts.en:
Merrydith is 35 years old and married. She has four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. 

Merrydith requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Merrydith has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks, sugar, coffee and salt for her business.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 49 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal sales business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

Loida has borrowed and repaid 34 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Loida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Nina

texts.en:
Maria Nina works hard to support her family. Maria Nina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Maria Nina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Maria Nina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jeralyn works hard to support her family.

Jeralyn has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs to support her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Jeralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Perla Esmeralda

texts.es:
Perla es una mujer de 61 años que desde muy joven ha desarrollado el don de las ventas, pues era algo que le apasionada y que además ayudaba en los ingresos económicos en su hogar. Ahora tiene 40 años como comerciante de ropa, perfumes y accesorios del hogar. Ingresos que han sido indispensables para salir adelante personalmente y que su hijo tuviera el título como abogado. 
Esta madre soltera ha pasado por muchos sacrificios para que ella y su hijo vayan mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida. Entre ellos, mirar migrar a su hijo a otro país, quien ahora la ayuda económicamente. En estos momentos ella solicita un préstamo para incrementar su mercadería comprando platos, vasos, sillas de plástico, ropa, entre otros productos de gran demanda en sus ventas.  Esto le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y a seguir creciendo para poder llegar a tener una tienda estable y dejar de vender en su casa.
texts.en:
Perla is a 61 year old woman who at a young age developed a talent for sales. It was something she was passionate about ad that also helped earn income in her home. She has been a merchant selling clothing, perfume and home accessories for 40 years. The income she has earned has been indispensable in helping her personally get ahead and her son become a lawyer.

This single mother has endured many sacrifices so that she and her son could little by little improve their quality of life. Among other things, she has watched her son migrate to another country where he now helps her financially.

At present she is requesting a loan to increase her inventory by purchasing plates, glasses, plastic chairs and clothing among other products, which are in high demand. This will help her to increase her income and continue expanding so that she can open a store and stop selling from her house.

loans.use: to purchase plates, glasses, plastic chairs and clothing, among other products.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 50 años de edad,  está acompañado y tiene ocho hijos.
Benito se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que realiza desde muy joven, y fue su padre quien lo instruyó en este trabajo, la cual hoy en día le sirve para llevar el sustento al hogar.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, arena, etc, para el mejoramiento de la vivienda donde reside con su esposa e hijos.

Su sueño es mantener unida a su familia, además espera ampliar la vivienda para que cada miembro de su familia tenga su propio espacio.
texts.en: Benito is 50 years old. married and has 8 children. Benito works in agriculture, something he has done since he was very young. His father taught him how to do this work and today it allows him to support his family. He needs the loan to buy construction materials  like cement, cinder blocks, sand, etc. to make improvements on the house where he lives with his wife and children. His dream is to keep his family together and he also wants to expand his house so that each member for his family has their own space.

loans.use: to buy construction material like cement, cinder blocks, sand, etc. for his house.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 69 años de edad, junto con su esposa tienen una familia muy numerosa conformada por doce hijos. Miguel logro cursar tercer grado de estudio, por falta de recursos económicos no continuo estudiando; pero con esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, uno de sus hijos se fue al extranjero para poder ayudar a la familia económicamente, dos más se casaron e independizaron los demás aún viven con Miguel y también trabajan, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Miguel en el invierno cultiva todos los años 2.82 hectáreas de milpa sembrando maíz, frijoles y maicillo y en el verano se dedica a la elaboración de teja en un negocio particular para llevar el pan de cada día. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar madera, teja, cemento, arena, ladrillo para finalizar la vivienda y así mejorar la calidad de vida y comodidad de su familia, parte del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas, quiere cultivar una parcela de tierra con sorgo.

El sueño de Miguel es que cada uno de sus hijos tengan una habitación individual.
texts.en:
Miguel is 69 years old. Together with his wife he has a large family consisting of 12 children. Miguel managed to finish Grade 3 at school but due to a lack of resources could not continue to study. But with effort and work he has manged to get ahead with his family. One of his children went to the United States to be able to help the family financially. Two others have married and are independent and the rest live with Miguel and also work. His wife does the housework.

In the winter of every year Miguel plants 2.82 hectares of fields growing corn, beans and sorghum and in the summer works at making cloth in a private business to make the daily bread. The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy wood, tiles, cement, sand and bricks to finish work on his house and improve the comfort and quality of living for his family. Part of the loan will be invested in agricultural inputs as he wants to plant a parcel of land with sorghum. Miguel's dream is for each of his children to have their own house.

loans.use: to buy wood, tiles, cement, sand and bricks to complete his house and to buy agricultural inputs to grow sorghum.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a fishing net.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts along with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, vive con sus padres, está soltero pero tiene un hijo que depende de él.

José trabaja como motorista desde hace 10 años, razón por la cual posee una amplia experiencia en su trabajo y lo realiza con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, por medio de esta actividad es como José ayuda económicamente a sus padres y a su hijo, además tiene conocimientos en la crianza de pollos de engorde ya que tiene cinco años realizando dicha actividad con la cual obtiene ingresos extras.
