Él necesita el crédito para comprar 300 pollos y  alimentación y medicamentos para los mismos para que crezcan fuertes y sanos para venderlos en un futuro.

Su sueño es ser comerciante o proveedor de pollos, además espera seguir ayudando a su hijo y a su padre.
texts.en:
José, age 32, lives with his parents.  He is single and he has a child who depends upon him. 

José has been working as a bus driver for 10 years, so he has a lot of experience in his work, which he carries out with great effort and dedication. It is by means of this activity that he helps his parents and his child financially. Additionally, he knows about raising broiler chickens, as he has been engaged in this activity for five years now, by which he earns extra income. 

He needs the loan in order to purchase 300 chickens, plus feed and medications for them so that they will grow strong and healthy in order for him to sell them in the future.

His dream is to be a dealer or supplier of chickens, and he also hopes to continue helping his child and his father.

loans.use: to purchase 300 chickens, plus feed and medications for them.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar de 47 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, tiene 2 hijos que están pequeños y dependen de él.

Oscar es albañil, ya tiene 25 años de dedicarse a este trabajo el cual aprendió por medio de sus padres, además se dedica a la agricultura y un hermano le ayuda en el trabajo.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para abonar su cultivo y obtener buena cosecha.

Él espera que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado para asegurar la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar, 47 years old, is married, and his wife works as a vendor. He has two young children who depend on him. 

Oscar is a mason. He already has been doing this work for 25 years, which he learned from his parents. In addition, he works in agriculture, and a brother of his helps him with the work. 

He needs this loan to buy fertilizers, in order to fertilize his crops and have a good harvest.

He hopes that his crops will develop well in order to ensure the family is well fed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to fertilize his crops and have a good harvest.

loans.name: Corazón De María (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Corazón de María está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio, quienes son vecinas y amigas, con el banco comunal han afianzado y estrechado más su amistad, todas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras que día a día buscan mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. Vive por el sector de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señor. Jessica, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 5 años de edad, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por  lo que viven en casa de su madre pero de manera independiente.
Diña Jessica labora en una fábrica de velas de lunes a viernes 8 horas diarias, en su casa se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y pollos. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Corazón de María” [Mary’s Heart] is comprised of nine women and one man. They are all neighbors and friends and have strengthened their relationships thanks to this group. They are all hardworking women who fight every day to reach financial stability. The members live in an area called Yanaturo, in the city of Cuenca, the country’s third most important city in economic terms. It was declared UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1999. Its inhabitants are kind and courteous and have a warm heart. They keep their culture and traditions alive.

One of the members is Jessica, who is 23 years old and married. She has a five-year-old daughter and her husband works as a mason. They do not live in a house of their own. Although they live with her mother, they are independent. 

Jessica works making candles in a factory. She works for eight hours, Monday to Friday. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens at home. She will use the loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for them. Her goal is to buy a house.

The woman in the small picture could not attend the meeting when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for them.

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevo porvenir está formado por 5 socias y 2 socios quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia goza de un clima frió, se encuentra rodeada por montañas las que les regala hermosos paisajes, sus terrenos son fértiles. Su gente es amable y gentil que aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gloria, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 5 hijos de 22, 21, 18, 15 y 13 años, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, sus dos siguientes hijos estudian y trabajan  y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Gloria desde hace 7 meses se dedica a la venta de confitería y trabaja de lunes a viernes en una escuelita de la localidad, en su casa se dedica a la crianza  de cerdos, gallinas, cuyes y ganado, también a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de dulces y en alimento para sus animales. Su meta es seguir creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Porvenir" communal bank is made up of 5 women and two men who live in the Cumbe parish in Cuenca. This parish has a cold climate and is surrounded by mountains which gives them beautiful scenery and fertile land. The people are friendly and peaceful and maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of the group is Gloria. She is 42 years old, married and has 5 children from this union aged 22, 21. 18. 15 and 13 years old. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. The next two study and work and the last two study in Secondary school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and they live in their own house.

For the past 7 months Gloria has been working selling sweets from Monday to Friday in a local school. At her house she raises pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and cattle and also farms for the consumption of the household and to sell. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of sweets and feed for the animals. Her goal is to continue to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy sweets and animal feed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité kuña Guapa, inician el ciclo 26 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, Ellas son de la ciudad de Luque, el comité viene trabajando con la encuesta de la eliminación de la pobreza con el fin de superar su línea de pobreza.
Laura es integrante de este grupo, es una persona muy sacrificada que lucha para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para el día a día y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades, vende comidas variadas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, ya tiene una clientela formada que siempre compra de el.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, hortalizas, condimentos, etc., de manera a poder seguir luchando por un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Guapa" committee is starting its 26th cycle in the program for women entrepreneurs. They are from the city of Luque. The committee has also been working with the poverty elimination survey project, with the aim of raising themselves above the poverty line. 

Laura is a member of this group. She is a very self-sacrificing person who works hard to give her family everything they need day after day, so that they don't have to suffer through times of need. She sells a range of foods which she makes herself and then goes out to sell as a mobile vendor. She has steady customers who always buy from her. 

She is requesting this loan to invest the funds in buying various supplies to continue making her foods, such as vegetables, meats, greens, condiments, etc. In this way she can continue working hard for a better future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, greens, condiments and other supplies to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza está formado por 9 socias quienes tienen una gran amistad, la misma que les ha permitido formar este grupo para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, siempre están con una sonrisa para los visitantes.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mariana, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 14, 12, 10, 8 y 6 años, su primer hijo  estudia en el colegio y sus cuatro últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Mariana tiene una tienda desde hace 5 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, esta actividad le da la oportunidad de estar con su familia y cuidar de ellos cuando la necesitan. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda. Su meta es que su tienda llegue a ser un mini mercado.
texts.en:
The group Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) is made up of 9 members who have a great friendship among them, which has allowed them to form this group in order to improve the economic stability of their homes and help their children get ahead. They live in the city of Cuenca, which since December 1999 is a Cultural Heritage site. Its people still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns, and always greet visitors with a smile.

One of the members of this group is the Señora Mariana. She is 33 years old, married, and from this marriage has 5 children aged 6, 8, 10, 12, and 14. Her first child is studying in college, and her other four children attend a little school in the city. Her husband works as a mason, and they don't have their own house, and therefore must live by renting. 

Doña Mariana has had a store for 5 years. She works Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. This work gives her the opportunity to be with her family and to take care of them when they need her. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of food items for her store. Her goal is that her store becomes a small market.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es propietario de una ferretería, se dedica a la venta de artículos de electricidad, herramientas, etc. Su local está ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad de Pilar.
Él está casado, y comenta que su esposa la ayuda siempre para poder, de esa forma, progresar y salir adelante. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se sacrifica mucho.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de herramientas varias para su ferretería ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ricardo owns a hardware store and sells electric goods, tools, etc.  His shop is located in a strategic area of the city of Pilar.  He is married and says his wife helps him whenever she can, so they are able to progress and get ahead.  He is a very hard working entrepreneur who sacrifices a lot.

Ricardo is requesting a loan to buy a variety of tools for his hardware shop so he can continue with his sales activity.

loans.use: To buy a variety of tools to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La Sra. Maxima anteriormente trabajaba en la argentina y enviaba dinero a su marido y de a poco juntaron dinero y así poder montar un negocio en su hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación hoy día cuenta con un autoservice muy bien surtido, gracias a eso pudo hacer que su hijo siga sus estudios quien está estudiando en Estados Unidos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de Cervezas, caña, golosinas y embutidos, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Maxima used to work in Argentina and send money to her husband; and little by little they were able to save money and open a business in their home.

Thanks to her efforts and dedication she now has a well-stocked store which allows her son to continue his education in the United States.

Maxima is requesting a loan to buy beers, sugarcane, sweets and sausages so she can maintain her sales activity and strive to improve her situation.

loans.use: To buy beer, sugarcane, sweets and sausages, etc.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus integrantes, donde una de ellas es la Sra. Felicia quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. 
Nivel uno quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco más para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, donde ella a través del esfuerzo y por medio de la costura está luchando por poder salir adelante. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante por medio de su sacrificio y trabajo, luchando día a día por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is participating in the poverty elimination survey to improve the living conditions of its members.  One of the members is Felicia who showed a Level One poverty level on the last survey.  Level One means she should make a bit more effort in her sewing business to improve her living conditions and get ahead.  She is a person who wants to prosper through sacrifice and work, struggling every day to improve her life and that of her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy fabrics, threads, elastic, buttons and other goods so she can continue with her work and fill customers' orders.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads, elastic, buttons and other goods.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Isabel se encuentra en el ciclo 23, este grupo esta con las expectativas bien claras de que quieren salir adelante motivo por el cual están luchando para mejorar sus vidas.
Ernesta tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, es una persona muy trabajadora, que pide este préstamo para surtir con productos variados su despensa.
Ernesta quiere seguir capacitándose a través del programa de comités, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo y ofreciendo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank Santa Isabel, which is in its 23rd cycle now. Its members have clear goals and want to make headway, which is why they are fighting to improve their lives.

Ernesta owns a grocery store. She works every day, starting early in the morning. She is a hardworking person. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store.

Ernesta wants to continue training through the Committees Program. This way, she will be able to continue getting ahead and providing the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is married and she works hard to support her family. 

She has a fishpond operator business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Rafael está integrado por 16 integrantes, están en el programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan   ya que   se encuentran en la misma situación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Tomasa, quien tiene una despensa , venta de combustible, comida y es cocinera medio día en una escuela, y es por medio de estos trabajos que lucha para poder ayudar a su familia. 
La Sra. Tomasa pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, comestibles, frutas, verduras y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called San Rafael, and is comprised of sixteen members. They are all part of the Women’s Committee Program, and work together because they all have similar problems.

One of the members is Tomasa, who owns a grocery store. She sells fuel and food, and works part-time as a cook for a school. She works hard and these jobs give her the means to help her family.

Tomasa is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store, such as vegetables, foodstuff, fruits, etc., and be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, foodstuff, fruits, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Shaoni

texts.es:
Shaoni vive en casa de sus padres, está en pareja, y comenta que tiene un local de ventas de todo tipo de Granos y especias en general, se  dedica a esta actividad hace más de 13 años, y por medio de este trabajo es que está mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Shaoni está pidiendo este préstamo para la compra de un local, ya que así podrá ir mejorando en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Shaoni lives with her parents. She is in a relationship. She says that she has a stall where she sells all kinds of beans and general spices. She started this activity more than 13 years ago and she is improving her living conditions through her work.

Shaoni is requesting this loan to buy a business location which will improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a business locale

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Khadija is a member of the Antokia Group. She is in her thirties, married and has got two sons and two daughters. All of her children are at school. 

Khadija is a hardworking woman who wants to develop her projects to a better level. Lack of capital and business helpers are the main challenges facing her business, but she still wants to improve her business and manage it well so that she continues to receive more orders. 

She runs two separate businesses. Firstly, a restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and supper, and secondly a beauty salon where she provides nice hairstyles and many more salon services and beauty products to her customers. Khadija needs to renovate her beauty salon so that it looks classic and attractive, and so that it is easier to charge higher prices. This is an idea/comment that she has received from many of her customers. She works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

Khadija has a long-term relationship with Tujijenge and this is her fourth credit request. The credit will be apportioned among the 7 members of the Antokia Group. With her previous loans, since repaid, Khadija started her beauty salon business and has managed to maintain her restaurant with the required cooking ingredients. She is very proud of Kiva's support and her life now looks very different to before. She has grown her businesses and been able to afford to pay school fees easily for her kids. All of this because of Kiva's loans! They really change people's lives, and she is so thankful to everyone who has supported the lives of all these members. 

Khadija is now requesting her fourth loan which she will use to renovate her beauty salon by putting up tiles, buying new chairs and painting it in a 'beauty' color. 

The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to renovate her beauty salon by putting up tiles, buying new chairs and painting it in a 'beauty' color.

loans.name: Jesus Miseriocordioso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesús Misericordioso está en el ciclo 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde a través de el podrán mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celsa, ella tiene un kiosko bien surtido en su casa que ha ido mejorando y trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos. Celsa está capacitándose para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de galletitas, golosinas, comestibles, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Jesus Misericordioso group is in the 12th cycle of the women committee's program, where all of them work and help each other to get ahead in life. They are conducting a poverty elimination survey that will help them improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Celsa. She has a well-stocked kiosk at home that she has been improving. Working at the kiosk has allowed her to support her family and loved ones. Celsa is going through training to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of cookies, candy, groceries, drinks and other items, which will allow her to continue working and striving to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, groceries, food and other items.

loans.name: La Merced  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Merced está formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia Santa Ana en Cuenca, su actividad más importante es la agricultura, ganadería y pequeños huertos frutales; estos productos son para el autoconsumo y lo poco que resta se comercializa en la ciudad de Cuenca. Las socias trabajan día a día con una sonrisa en los labios y le ven en cada amanecer la mejor oportunidad de superarse y entregar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Laura, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven  independientes, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en donde viven es propia.
Doña Laura desde hace 8 años tiene una tienda, labora en ella de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, como pasa en casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos, también a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de víveres para la tienda y en alimento para sus animales. Su meta es que su tienda sea más grande.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The La Merced Credit Group comprises 11 women who live in the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca.  Their most important occupations are farming, raising live-stock, and tending small fruit orchards; these products are for their own consumption, and what little remains is sold in the city of Cuenca.

The members work with a smile upon their lips every day; and they see each new day as the best opportunity to make their lives better and give their children a better future. 

Señora Laura is a member of this group. She is 57 years old, and she is married. She has three children who are grown-up  and married, and living independently. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and they live in their own house. 

Doña Laura has had a store for 8 years. She works in it from Sunday to Sunday, with no fixed schedule, as it is in her house. She raises chickens and pigs, and she also farms for her household consumption. 

She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of supplies for the store and in feed for her animals. Her goal is to make her store bigger. 

The small photo is of two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, and feed for animals.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 27,500 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested the additional loan to build up her fishing business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
This is Nelda. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Now, she would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelda dreams of expanding her business and that she will be able to open a new branch. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell rice. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 19,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of fish to sell through her fish-vending business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is married and she has 3 children. She has been involved in business activities since 2013. She started with her own working capital of $600. She has a kiosk in her house, and she taking a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin, which she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as  eggs, milk, pop, noodles, cooking oils, cigarettes, biscuits and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. She is happy with the loan she is taking from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to improve her business and to increase her income in the future. She also has animals like pigs and dogs.

loans.use: To buy eggs, milk, pop, noodles, cooking oils, cigarettes, biscuits and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is a 26-year-old single man. He lives with his humble family in Taiz city, Yemen. He studied till Secondary education, and now he is an employee in the private sector. 

The house where Abdulaziz lives with his family is very old. It needs repair and maintenance. Unfortunately, his salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. He knows this project will cost him a lot of money. He wants to cover the costs of the repairs, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. 

As a result, he is requesting a Youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials like cement, iron, steel, bricks and other materials in order to make repairs on his house to make it comfortable and suitable for living.

Abdulaziz looks forward to providing his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase constructions materials like cement, iron, steel, bricks and other materials in order to make repairs on his house to make it comfortable and suitable for living.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en: Ilda, 38, is married and has 3 children. She sells secondhand clothes. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 600 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital. She will use the loan to buy more secondhand clothes such as men's shirts, women's shirts, and other secondhand clothes to sell. She started to sell secondhand clothes in 2006 with her own working capital of 400 uSD. She is doing this business because she earns a good income from it. She sells in the market so many people come to buy from her. She is happy to take the loan from Tuba Rai Metin  because she wants to improve her business and she wants to manage her business well.

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, women's shirts, and other secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Imarika Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu, who is in her early 30s, is single with four kids who are still going to school.  She has been a food vendor for five years now.  She works from 06 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mwajabu's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the food cooking ingredients, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought chairs, bought a wardrobe, and covered household expenses.  She is happy with the loan, and appreciated Kiva for their support.  

She will use this loan to buy more food cooking ingredients to serve more people.  She dreams of owning a hotel. 

Mwajabu will share this loan with her loan group, "IMARIKA", which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food cooking ingredients

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes that her business will grow more. She dreams of a simple life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from their fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 40 years old, married, and is raising seven children together with her husband. She has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she raises hogs. She started this work nine years ago with a purchase of pigs for 2,000 PHP. Thanks to Maribel's hard work, today her business has three pigs. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan from ASKI to buy two more pigs in order to increase her hog-raising business headcount. Maribel plans to invest earnings from the loan into further increasing her domestic livestock numbers and into saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy two head of pigs in order to increase her hog-raising business headcount.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, sugar and rice

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana raises pigs. To increase the business, Juana’s loan will be used to buy feed and three piglets. In a period of six months, the pigs will be ready to sell. The profits gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and three piglets.

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Juan Bautista está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que se está esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Delia es peluquera, siempre ofrece un buen servicio a sus clientes, es por ello que se destaca, y quiere seguir creciendo y mejorando para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, tintes y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group which is called San Juan Bautista is in its first loan cycle of the women's committee programme. It is a new group which is working hard in order to grow and make progress. 

Delia is a hairdresser. She always provides her clients with a good service and this is why she stands out. She wants to continue growing and improving, in order to be able to help her family. 

She is asking for this loan so she can use it to buy shampoo, rinses, scissors, hair colour and other items.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, scissors, hair colour and other items.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is 26 years old, and married with a child; his wife is pregnant and soon his second child will be born. Vusal and his wife are IDP (internally displaced persons), and from Fuzuli city for over 20 years. Now they are living in Ahmadbayli village of Fuzuli region. 

Vusal has a shop where he sells personal and cleaning products; he started this business five years ago. Today Vusal is planning to support his business, and for this reason he needs 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy stock. 

He says great thanks to the Kiva organization for the loan, and helping him to increase his business. In the future, he wants to expand the area of his store.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry es un grupo formado en la ciudad de encarnación, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Paublina, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender, es una persona muy luchadora, que por medio de sus ventas está tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella comenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, carne, pollo y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry group was set up in the city of Encarnación. All of the ladies are doing the poverty elimination survey. 

Paublina is one of the members, and she earns a living selling food which she makes herself and then goes out to sell. She is a very hard-working person who is trying to improve her own and her family's living conditions through her sales. She says she has built up a very good clientele who always buy the delicious food she makes.

She is asking for this loan which she will use to buy vegetables, seasoning, meat, chicken and other items, so she can continue with her work as she has been doing up until now.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seasoning, meat, chicken and other items.

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother of three children, two sons and one daughter, two of whom are schooling while the other is still a baby. She is married and in her thirties. Elizabeth runs a poultry and livestock business where she keeps goats and chicks until they grow and are ready for selling. Despite being into agriculture, she is a tailor by profession, and has opened a room where she designs and makes clothes with fabrics. She has been in these businesses for more than ten years now. Working from 06am to 07pm per working day, she is able to earn a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her third loan request to be apportioned among Munduli B, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Elizabeth used the previous loan, since repaid, to start her tailoring business by buying fabrics and sewing machines. She also bought poultry chicks and chicken feeds. She manages to receive an extra income, which she uses to cover part of her kids' school fees and household expenses. Elizabeth will use her new credit request to buy chicken feed and fabrics for her tailoring business. She dreams of being successful with her projects.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "MUNDULI B", which consists of two members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken food and also fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel owns and operates a multicab which he uses for school service. He has been successful in his transportation business for years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income by purchasing and selling frozen food products.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for his vehicle. He is requesting an amount of PHP 35,000 for the maintenance of the multicab and to buy more stock of frozen products to sell in his business.

In the future, Arnel wants to have another multicab that he could also use for school service. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his multicab unit.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a dairy farmer in Kangundo town. She is 47 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. She has been in this business for the past 5 years and she currently makes a monthly income of about KES 20,000.

She will be using this loan to buy another dairy cow. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another cow.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia lives in Ermera; she is married, and she has three children. She is a businesswoman. 

She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a clothes shop and she is earning a good income from selling clothes. She is happy because she is selling in the market and so many people like to buy.  She started this business in 2010 with her own working capital of $2,000. 

She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to add it to her capital to buy more clothes, including underwear, baby shirts, kids shirts, t-shirts, shirts and other clothes to sell. 

She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can get good management in the future for her business.

loans.use: To buy underwear, baby shirts, kids shirts, t-shirts, shirts and other clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has a retail shop in Tala town. She is also a dairy farmer, and she supplies dairy milk to various customers. She is 52 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She also supports two people in her family.

She will be using this loan to buy a dairy cow. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more dairy cows.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loan successfully. 

In future Agnes hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам  мужчина 35 лет , женат. Родился и вырос в сельской местности. С детства занимается скотоводством . В данный момент он разводит крупный рогатый скот  на своем участке земли  ,который служит для получения молока ,говядины и кожевенного сырья . Каждый день ранним утром жена Мукарама доит коров и продает молоко на рынке. Молоко быстро скупается . Мукарам хочет дать своим детям образование, хорошую жизнь . Поэтому они с женой работают от зари до зари. Мукарам планирует приобрести еще несколько голов крупного рогатого скота и корма для них. На данный момент Мукарам не владеет нужной суммой.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд . Он рад,что люди,нуждающиеся в финансовой поддержке,могут достичь своих планов благодаря таким организациям,как МДО Арванд.
texts.en: Mukaram is a 35-year-old married man. He was born and raised in a rural area and has been involved in animal husbandry since his childhood. At the present time, he raises cattle on his plot of land in order to obtain milk, beef and leather raw materials. Mukaram's wife milks cows early every morning and sells the milk at a market. The milk is bought fast. Mukaram wants to provide his children with an education and good life. This is why he and his wife work from dawn until dusk. Mukaram is planning to buy several more heads of cattle and feed for them. Currently, Mukaram does not have enough money to accomplish this. This is why he came to MDO Arvand. He is glad that people, who need financial support, can achieve their goals thanks to organizations like MDO Arvand.

loans.use: to buy cattle and livestock feed

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is age 24, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; she is a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and tuition in evening. It is challenge for them to afford the school and tuition fee, so that both are doing a lot of hard work to run the setup of their house. 

She owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband is doing small jobs in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products are going to be gone, and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Sonia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan; she will buy cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her services. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
20 years ago, Joyce started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Nyaramba, a remote village in the rich highlands of Kisii, Kenya. Today, this humble mother of six children sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy barn, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy barn. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy barn provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Joyce believes that through this loan, her living conditions will permanently change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy barn. Joyce patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy barn

loans.name: Fabiola Milagros

texts.es: Fabiola es una joven de 20 años de edad con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Día a día se esfuerza para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder ofrecerles un futuro mejor. En sus tiempos libres le gusta ver películas y ayudar a su mamá a cocinar una riquísima carapulcra. Actualmente trabaja en una prestigiosa empresa y también está siguiendo una carrera universitaria. Fabiola está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le brindaron podrá acondicionar una habitación que sus padres le cedieron para que pueda vivir cómodamente, con esto podrá seguir esforzándose para terminar su carrera y convertirse en una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Fabiola, 20, is a young woman with a great desire to get on in life. She works hard every day so she can improve her family's quality of life and offer them a better future. In her spare time she likes watching films and helping her mum to prepare a tasty carapulcra [a Peruvian stew of potatoes and meat with a peanut sauce]. She is currently working for a well-known company and is also doing a university degree.

Fabiola is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given her she will be able to set up a room which her parents have given her so that she can live comfortably. By doing this she will be able to continue to work hard to finish her degree and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to set up her room.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a farmer living in the rich highland area of San Jose, an area known for good quality crop production. She is married and has children, all of whom are of school-going age. For the past five years, Minda’s primary income has come from raising hogs. She enjoys keeping her hogs, but her biggest business challenge is the lack of funds. 

Minda is requesting a loan to buy two piglets and pig feed for her business. She chose ASKI for her loan because they process client loans faster and their loans are offered with a low interest rate. During her training, Minda learned that micro-finance institutions help improve the lives of small-scale farmers. She will use her increased income to help pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and pig feed for her business.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina is 41 years old and she is a businesswoman. She has a kiosk, and now she is requesting a loan of $1,200. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin. The loan will used to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as pop noodles, garlic, spices, Masako, rice, detergent and other things to sell. 

She opened her business in 2006 with a working capital of $ 4,000. She also sells in the market, so many people come to buy her goods. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her management and she wants her business to grow bigger in the future. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy pop noodles, garlic, spices, Masako, rice, detergent and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.en:
You could say Nidia was born into the car business. As the daughter of an auto mechanic, some of her earliest memories are of her and her father sitting in front of or underneath a car, learning everything there is to know about cars. These days, Nidia has a brother-in-law with an auto dealership and another who trades in cars on the side, so you could say this business is a natural fit for her. 

Nidia started NLS Auto Sales, a used car brokerage selling pre-owned vehicles utilizing internet sites such as Craigslist. With no showroom or lot, Nidia’s overhead remains low, and she plans on keeping her full-time job while slowly growing her business.

Knowing how to work underneath the hood of a car doesn't mean you know how to work underneath a canopy of red tape, and Nidia has seen plenty of that. Running a car dealership requires several licenses and a seller’s permit, all of which tie up money and which need to be submitted to the DMV sequentially, which has been a time intensive process for Nidia.

Nidia’s Kiva loan will go toward paying down these licensing fees, paying start-up costs, and for a rainy day fund. 

Nidia hopes one day to hire her brother-in-law and expand her inventory, and with the help of generous Kiva lenders she will be able to do just that.

loans.use: to pay for licensing fees, start-up costs, and for a rainy day fund.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 34 years old, married, and has four children whom she sends to school. She is operating a computer shop for income. She offers internet browsing, encoding and printing services. Her income usually goes to pay school bills, meals and revolving capital in the business. 

She wanted to improve her income, so she is now asking for additional capital of P35,000 to buy ink and computers. She hopes to render fast services and gain continuous profits in her computer shop.

loans.use: to buy ink and computers.

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Regina, a married mother in her 50's, has got four children: one son and three daughters. Only one is schooling, and the rest are grown. She has been running a poultry business and a general store selling more items: cooking oil, water, rice, sugar, maize and baking flour, pens, books, sodas, juices etc. She has had her business for more than 10 years now, working from 06 am to 10 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her fourteenth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She is a good person who normally takes care with her business. She desires to grow her business more and live better. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she used them to buy chicks and chicken feed, shop items, and bought water, which she sells at wholesale price. Regina's business is now good, and she grows her monthly income. She used the business income to cover part of the school fees and home food expenses.
 
Regina will use her new credit request to buy a stock of cooking oil for her shop to sell. She will share this loan with her loan group, "TEMBONI", which totals four members who will hold each other accountable to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cooking oil

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 37-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. The condition of her house is not good and the living standard of her family is miserable.

Her husband owns a spare parts shop in which he sells motorbike spare parts such as silencers, fuel tanks, foot rests, wheels, tyres, tubes, etc. Asia has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy the desired spare parts to sell on a daily basis.

Asia's husband supplies spare parts to other shopkeepers also. The spare parts shop is their single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to know that he is in great need of growing his business so that he could more easily cope with future expenses. 

Asia hopes that he will succeed in his planning for the future, and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of new, stylish fabrics in order to meet all the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Resty’S Group

texts.en:
Resty and her group members extend their thanks and gratitude to Kiva lenders for their previous loan. Members used their loans to buy good quality seeds, farm inputs and paid laborers to cultivate their land. Their harvests increased last season and so was their income. Resty the group leader, purchased a bicycle to help her carry her farm produce to the market and her 14 year old son uses it to go to school.

Group members therefore request for a new loan to expand their farms, buy piglets for rearing and attain specialized training on better farming and animal rearing skills. With the new loan, Resty and her group members believe they will increase their incomes, food security and knowledge on farming.

loans.use: To expand farms, buy good quality maize, fertilizers and attain training in farming

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en: Sambo’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sambo makes a living cultivating rice and raising duck and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. The child in the photo is the son of one of the group members

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhonn's Group

texts.en: Sokhonn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokhonn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. The child in the photo is the child of one of the group members.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Soklang's Group

texts.en: Soklang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Soklang makes a living cultivating to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. The child in the photo is the child of one of the group members.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Him’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Him makes a living cultivating rice, selling​ firewood and working as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. The children in the photo are the children of the group members.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en: Lanh’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lanh makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. The child in the photo is the child of one of the group members.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ret makes a living cultivating rice and raising the ducks to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. The child in the photo is the child of one of the group members.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khuoch's Group

texts.en: Khuoch’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Khuoch makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pros's Group

texts.en: Pros’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Pros makes a living as a teacher to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. The child in the photo is one of the children of the group members.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en: This is Cosmas. He is a father of four children and has been rearing Dairy cows for the last 10 years. "Cows are my lifeline, they have sustained my family all these years"  he says. With an extra dairy cow, Cosmas will lower his unit cost of production as a way of managing the high costs of animal feeds. With a loan from kiva, he will increase his income and his family will live a better life.

loans.use: purchase one more dairy cow, lower unit cost of production and be able to save and improve living standard of his family

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las trabajadoras está en el primer ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Herminia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados en general, ella gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Según su encuesta se encuentra fuera de la línea de la pobreza, igualmente ella trabaja para aumentar sus ingresos y el de su familia. Su marido también trabaja y de esa forma se ayudan para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Herminia este préstamo para poder comprar prendas y calzados variados, ya que así podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo sigue haciendo, luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
The group "Women Workers" is in its first loan cycle with the program of the Committee for Entrepreneurial Women. They all work and help each other in order to get ahead.  They are participating in a survey for the elimination of poverty, and one of their group members is Herminia.  She works selling clothing and shoes. Thanks to this work she is able to maintain her home and increase her income.  According to her survey she finds herself outside of the poverty line, but she continues to work in order to increase her income and that of her family.  Her husband also works and in that way they help each other to continue to grow and move forward.   

Herminia needs this loan in order to purchase clothing and shoes in various styles, so that she can continue her sales as she has been doing, and continue struggling for her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, a 60-year-old widowed woman lives at Tuguegarao with her children. She has four grown up children. Together with her son, they manage a motorcycle welding and repair shop. Aside from the shop, Flora also sells grocery items in her small store. She hopes to keep improving her businesses in order to gain good profits. 

She is now asking for an additional P25,000 to invest in the welding shop and retail store. She will buy welding rods, as well as grocery items (biscuits, soft drinks, breads) to sell. This loan will be a great help in expanding her sales and also improve their output of high quality repair services. She will save additional revenue for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy welding rods and grocery items (biscuits, soft drinks, breads ) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a rice grower at their village with her husband. She has grown up children whom she sent to school through their profits in the rice farming business. She hopes to keep increasing their income for continuous development of her crop production. She is now asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides for use in farming. Ensuring good growth and nutrition to crops will lead to abundant harvests someday. She will save additional revenue for the family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 61 years old, widowed, and has two adult children. She is from Baybay, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling different kinds of goods to the people in her locality, which she has been doing for more than four years. 
 
Lourdes' business was ruined when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. As of now, she is starting to rebuild. Lourdes requested a loan, which she will use to buy more stock, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap, toiletries, bread, chips, biscuits, coffee, and sugar. With this loan, she will be able to increase the stock in her store, which will attract more buyers. In the future, Lourdes hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap, toiletries, bread, chips, biscuits, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Shahnaz wants to grow the business of her husband, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. 

She is the a honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan; she in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. 

She is expecting a boost in earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. 

She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
Gurban is a 46-year-old man. He is living in Ahmadbayli village in the Fuzuli region with his lovely family.  Gurban’s family consists of 4 persons - Gurban, his wife (who is a housewife and doesn’t work on incoming business) and 2 children - a girl who is going to school and a boy who is studying in the second course of a technical college. 

The family members are Internally Displaced Persons - IDP - from Fuzuli city. Gurban and his wife have been in the animal breeding business, buying little calves, raising them and selling them to make money. Today Gurban needs a loan in the amount of 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to support and develop the family business. With this amount he plans to buy 2 calves. Gurban is thankful for the help of the dear Kiva organization and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for 2 calves.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 3 years now. This is the source of her income. Jennifer has a three-year-old daughter. 

Jennifer is requesting a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy a new engine. In the future, Jennifer dreams of making her fishing business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy a new engine.

loans.name: Erick Francisco

texts.es: Erick Francisco, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa, la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de maíz de buena calidad y que tenga un buen desarrollo y que tenga una cosecha adecuada, además de comprar algunos fertilizantes necesarios para aplicarle a la plantación una vez que este en desarrollo, también en pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno y de labores culturales. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una mejor calidad del producto para el consumidor. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Erick Francisco is 20 years old and lives with his wife, who is his top priority.  With his loan he plans to purchase corn seed of high quality so that he will have good growth and an adequate harvest.  He also will buy fertilizer for application on his fields once the crop has developed.  He will also pay for workers who will help prepare the land.  With this purchase of products and assistance his crop will be of better quality for his customers.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has never had any other state loans, but Kiva's partner FUDECOSUR has offered a loan with better interest rates and better support.

loans.use: To plant corn.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick supplies retail goods in Tala town and has been in this business for 15 years now. He is 53 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. 

He will be using this loan to buy more goods for his supply. These include beauty products and plastic materials such as plates, cups and jugs. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business as well as to repay the loan.

This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has paid his previous loans well. In the future he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock of beauty products and plastic materials.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима трудолюбивая женщина и заботливая мать. Ей 50 лет. Она всегда заботится об образовании своих детей. Ее муж Ато тоже добрый человек. Он занимается перевозкой грузов. Е него есть автомашина Камаз. Фотима живет дружно вместе со своими детьми и мужем. Ее младший сын учится в лицее. Он учится отлично и изучает английский и русский язык. Фотима должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына в лицее, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор своего сына в лицее. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fotima is a hardworking woman and a caring mother. She is 50 years old. She always cares about her children's education. Her husband, Ato, is also a kind person. He is involved in transporting loads. He has a Kamaz truck. Fotima lives happily with her children and husband. Her youngest son attends a lyceum. He studies excellently and learns English and Russian. Fotima has to pay for her son's lyceum tuition, but does not have money. She is requesting this loan to pay for her son's lyceum tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's lyceum tuition

loans.name: Afsha

texts.en:
Afsha is 27 years old and has two children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a beauty parlor where she is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients reside in the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon. 

Afsha requested a loan from Brac Pakistan, which she will use to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc. She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of the town to enhance her income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gertrude's Group

texts.en:
Getrude and her group members are excited about the impact of their previous loan. They thank Kiva lenders for their support and so much interested in taking on another loan double their impact. Getrude used her previous loan to open up a new garden on her piece of land given by her father. She also used part of the money to buy good quality tomato and cabagge seeds and herbicides. Her harvest was so good that she used part of her income to buy a cow, and decided to plant bananas in her new garden. She used the rest of the money to pay for school fees of her son, and saved little of it.

Getrude and her group members are now requesting for a new loan so as to expand their gardens.

loans.use: To buy good quality seed, fertilizers and pay for casual laborers to expand gardens

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Embracing her Mexican roots, Marisa, a first-generation U.S. citizen looking for a means to support her family, began her own catering business in 1995. In 2002, Marisa opened her own restaurant, Tijuana’s Mexican Kitchen, in the heart of Lincoln Park, Michigan. 

Now, Marisa’s business is thriving and the entire family is working together to run three different locations throughout the Metro Detroit area. Marisa loves being able to pursue her passion of cooking every day while also being able to provide for her family both in the U.S. and in Mexico. She is happy that her own entrepreneurial endeavor has become a family business that will be passed on to her children and grandchildren. 

To keep expanding in popularity, Marisa needs a loan. She needs a new air conditioner, a new floor for the dining area, and inventory to be able to fulfill her orders. She hopes to see her business thrive, so it can provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for the restaurant
